loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
History of the client: Virginia is a traveling merchant. She sells perfumes, cosmetics, and decorations in large quantities. She travels to Santa Cruz (one of the largest departments in the country) every two weeks to carry out her work. This is the fifth time that she is requesting a credit with IMPRO. Her history in our institution qualifies her as a "1" client, which means that she has fulfilled her payment obligations very well. The requested amount will go towards the purchase of merchandise (barrettes, decorations, cosmetics, and perfumes).

Her previous loans and work allow her to request this loan, since she has good experience in her business which will let her earn income to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Historia del Cliente: Virginia es comerciante viajera, vende perfumes cosméticos y adornos en cantidad, viaja a Santa Cruz (uno de los departamentos más grandes del país) quincenalmente para efectuar su actividad económica. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (trabas, adornos, cosméticos y perfumes).

Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like barrettes, cosmetics, and decorations for her business.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.en: Yesenia is thirty years old and a single mom, raising her two children alone.  Yesenia owns and operates a small clothing store in a rented locale in the Café community of Santo Domingo.  She plans on supplementing her business with new styles of men’s and women’s clothing.  She also wants to add an assortment of perfumes and deodorants to the business with the intention of attracting new customers.  Yesenia hopes to become the most well-established supplier of these goods in her community.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk and add other goods to expand her business

loans.name: Budumuli East B C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nassim N.. She is currently in the business of tape recording and CD writing and is requesting a loan to purchase a computer. Nassim is 22 years old and is married. Her husband is a matooke supplier. She has 2 children ranging from age 2.5 to 7 and her children go to school. Each week, Nassim makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy basic household needs. Nassim has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to buy a CD player and the loan was paid back on time.

Nassim is joined in her small group by Nalongo N., Nusula N., Christine M., Habiba B. and Hadijja N.. Nalongo N. has a business selling chairs and wants to purchase a carpentry machine. Nusula N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to buy more clothes. Christine M. operates a business of selling used clothes and wants to add more stock. Habiba B. is currently in the business of selling old clothes and is requesting a loan to increase inventory. Hadija N. sells used clothes and wants to stock more clothes with the loan.

loans.use: To increase capital stock

loans.name: Sanja

texts.en:
Sanja is a 22-year-old woman from East Sarajevo. She is not married and she lives with her parents.

Sanja will use this loan for 1000 KM for purchase on wholesale trade more plastic dishes, vases and other plastic items for household that she resells. She has a shop where she is retailing these items. Her wish is to expand the business in order to employ more people and to become a self-employed woman.

loans.use: For purchase more material.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly N. is a subsistence farmer and she also sells farming equipment. Aside of these activities, she is a Khmer noodle maker in Svay Phluos Village in Kampong Speu Province. Last year, she  obtained a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Ly N. now would like to buy one more cow  to plough her rice field during rainy season. Thus, she would like a loan for this purpose. She is 54 and a widow of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to plough her rice field during the rainy season.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Nieves is a 56-year-old woman who lives in a very poor community called Mata D. Palma, which is on the outskirts of Hato Mayor. Nieves lives with her husband and 15-year-old daughter in a small home. She started a small business two years ago selling homemaD. food to her community members. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more flour, oil, plantains, and chicken. Nieves operates her own `fritura,´ a small business that makes homemaD. snacks, such as empanadas.  In the Dominican Republic, it is very common for people to buy a snack on the street corner as they walk to work, their homes, or simply when they are out and about. The money from this loan will help Nieves to buy enough ingredients to make the food necessary to meet the demands she faces. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more stable with the help of this loan.  The profits she makes will enable her to better proviD. for her family.  On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Nieves herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

The loan will also help fund the businesses of the other group members. 

About Group Loans: In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults on the loan.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, plantains, and chicken

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng B., 44, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband, Pen Sophal, and their two children. She works as a farmer, growing vegetables and selling them in the market for US $5 each day. Her husband works as a construction foreman and typically makes US $7.50 each day. Her husband believes that he can increase his income and expand his business if he had the necessary capital.

Heng B. has asked for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more construction tools for her husband’s business. She looks forward to seeing the results of this investment and seeing how her standard of living can be improved.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly S., 39, and her husband, Mr. Bunna Saum, 41, who live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1991 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in a local school and the youngest is still young and stays at home.

Mrs. Somaly S. has been selling fruit for five years. She buys some fruit from villagers and some from the market to sell to tourists at the village riverside. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for seven years. Now he wants to change his business from motor taxi to Tuk Tuk driver because that way, he can carry more passengers than he can as a motor taxi. The couple lacks the money to buy a Tuk Tuk. Therefore, Mrs. Somly S. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to add to her own money to buy a Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motor trailer (TUk TUk) for her husband

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 32 años, actualmente está embarazada, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos.
Trabaja en las labores ganaderas desD. hace 2 años, porque notó en esta actividad una buena opción D. desarrollo para su familia, es así que comenzó primero con una vaca, ahora cuenta con 3 vacas, sale todos los días por L. mañana a hacerlas pastear, aprovecha D. sus animales L. leche que producen, L. cual elL. comercializa diariamente, el alimento diario D. sus vacas es L. alfalfa, que extrae D. sus propias tierras D. cultivo.Por su actual estado D. embarazo, ahora no pueD. hacer tareas que requieren mayor esfuerzo físico, como cargar grandes cantidades D. alfalfa, por ello, su esposo es ahora un apoyo importante en su trabajo.
Isabel se motiva cada día por ver a sus hijos creciendo y superándose.
L. razón D. su solicitud D. crédito se debe a que elL. necesita comprar alimento balanceado y dosis antiparasitarias para sus vacas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children and is currently expecting a third child. For two years Isabel has worked with livestock. She chose this work because she saw a good development opportunity for her family. She began with one cow, but now has three. Every day she goes out in the morning to take her cattle out to graze. She also benefits from their milk, which she sells every day. Isabel's cows eat a daily diet of alfalfa, which Isabel harvests from her own fields. Because of her pregnancy, she currently is not able to perform tasks requiring a lot of physical effort, such as carrying large quantities of alfalfa. For that reason, right now her husband is a key source of support for her work. Seeing her children growing and excelling motivates Isabel every day. She is requesting a loan because she needs to purchase cattle feed and medicine for controlling parasites for her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle feed and medicine for her cows

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Ngân tham gia Quỹ năm 1998. Trước khi chưa tham gia Qũy kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do không có vốn để phát triển kinh tế. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn và mua máy sát để làm kinh tế. Hiện nay kinh tế của gia đình anh chị đã phát triển và anh chị đã mua sắm được nhiều trang thiết bị cho gia đình. Chồng chị làm nghề thợ xây nên công việc của anh rất ổn định thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Chị có 3 con, 2 con hiện đã trưởng thành, 1 con đi làm thu nhâp 1.200.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 12.000.000đ đầu tư mua thóc làm hàng sáo.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Hoang joined the Fund in 1998. Before joining the Fund, the family's finances experienced many difficulties, and they did not have the capital to develop a business. After joining the Fund, she boldly borrowed money to buy a rice processing machine to start a business. Currently the family's finances has expanded and the couple has been able to purchase many essentials for their family. Her husband works as a construction worker, so his work is very stable with an income of 1,500,000 per month. She has 3 children, 2 of whom of grown, and 1 who works and earns 1,200,000 per month. In this round of funding the family is requesting a loan of 12,000,000 VND to invest in buying rice crop to process into edible rice. Their average month income is 6,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Bisalima

texts.en: Bisalima is a mother of 3 children. She has her own business selling fruits and vegetables. She buys her goods from big wholesale stores and sells them at the small market by her house. She wants to take a loan for repairing her small place at the market from which she sells her goods and also increase her inventory.

loans.use: Repair her stall and buy stock

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 28 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos  menores de edad. Se dedica a  su pequeña bodega que tiene desde hace  3 años  en su casa. Este negocio le permitido aumentar sus ingresos económicos, también le ayudo a poder  estar junto a sus hijos, siendo esto lo que le agrada, tener un negocio  en casa. Sumado a ello, la venta en su bodega es  favorable, debido a que en su comunidad  las tiendas  son muy pocas. Pero lo difícil de esta actividad es poder adquirir la mercadería que  requiere  para su tienda, para ello tiene que bajar a la ciudad a realizar sus compras. Es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, no ha tenido demoras en sus pagos correspondientes. Mónica invertirá el dinero en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, los cuales son los más requeridos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mónica is 28 years old, is married and has three young children. She is dedicated to her small convenience store that she has had for 3 years in her house. This business allows her to augment her income and also helped her to be together with her children, this is what she likes about having a business in her home. In addition, sales at her convenience store are favorable because in her community there are few stores. The difficult part is acquiring the goods required in the shop because she has to go into the city to purchase things. This is her fourth loan with MFP; she has not had delays in her payments. Mónica will invest the money in the purchase of essential goods, those that are most needed in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than S. is a widow who lives in Siem Reap Province. She is 48 years old and makes a living washing clothes as well as selling roast beef in an area of her village. She started both businesses twenty years ago and currently earns revenue of approximately $10 per day. S. is a sacrificing women and works hard to earn the money to sustain her kid's food. She now has four children, all of them single. One her son is a motorcycle taxi driver, earning an income around $5 a day to help meet the family's needs. S. needs to ask for a loan to purchase beef and ingredients to make roast beef for resale and a motorcycle for her family to ride.

loans.use: To purchase beef with ingredients to make roast beef

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Married with five children, Rose B. is a fifty four year old trader. She trades in cereals, like maize, and also operates a grocery shop at Agogo, a community where the major occupation is farming. She has been trading for the past year, a business she started with a small amount of money. Since then she has been able to support her family. 

Rose wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize and grocery items like biscuits, sugar, milk etc to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. The demand for the maize is high, as many of the second cycle schools have resumed and she has to prepare food for the boarding students. Sometimes students would arrive in large school busses and purchased large quantity of maize. Rose says your assistance would be of much help to her.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of maize to restock her grocery shop.

loans.name: Nidia Del Crarmen

texts.es: Nidia del Carmen Q. V. tiene 41 años, está casada, y tiene cuatro hijos. Todos sus hijos trabajan por cuenta propia. Sus propósitos con su negocio son de ampliar el local en donde pueda atender más clientes. El tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de dos años; ya que comenzar con este tipo de negocio no fue fácil ya que ella no poseía la experiencia. Por lo que en su negocio inicia con capital propio y con la ayuda de los préstamos de la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amiga ha podido sacar adelante a su negocio. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para salir adelante. El préstamo solicitado por Doña Nidia fue de C$ 20.000 a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Nidia del Carmen Q. V. is 41 years old. She is married and has 4 children. All of her children are working on their own. She intends to expand the premises of her business to serve more customers. She has been in this business for two years. It wasn’t easy to start this type of business because she had no experience. She began her business with her own capital and was able to manage it with the help of loans from Fundación León 2000 and friendly organizations. Her dream is to expand her business to make ends meet. Mrs. Nidia applied for a loan of 20.000 Córdobas (NIO) in a period of 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria sells provisions, drinks and food items. She is hoping to borrow N80, 000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and food items to sell. She is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and to sell

loans.name: Mirsa

texts.es:
MIRSA F. F., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito” con domicilio en el Jr. Guillermo Sisley N° 490 del distrito de Callería, tiene 45 años, 4 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo de tapicería.

En conjunto con su familia, su esposo y sus hijos, iniciaron el rubro de tapizados, especializándose en moto taxis, y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  compraron materiales para incrementar su pequeño negocio.

Hoy en día, su taller es muy conocido y los clientes llegan recomendados o por cuenta propia, lo que hace necesario que tengan sus materiales listos para cualquier pedido, por lo que el préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en compra de madera, Marroquín, pernos, tachuelas y otros.

Con el apoyo que tubo de Manuela Ramos que fue bastante por cierto, ha podido salir adelante, ella y su familia, por lo que esta contenta con esta ONG.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirsa F. F. is a member of the Successful Women Communal Bank. She lives on Guillermo Sisley Jr. No.490 of Calleria District. She is 45 years old and has four children. Her husband works in upholstery. Along with her husband and children she opened the workshop: “Rubro de Tapizados”, which specializes in Motorbike-Taxis. They bought materials for their business with their first loan of S/300.00 Nuevos Soles. Presently, their workshop is known and the customers are recommended or arrive of their own accord, so it is important for the F. F. to have materials in stock to be able to take orders on the spot. Mirsa will utilize the requested loan of S/1.500.00 Nuevos Soles, to buy wood, bolts, nails, tacks and other materials. With the great help from Manuela Ramos Credit for Women, Mirsa and her family have been able to progress and she is very pleased with this organization.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, bolts, nails, tacks and other upholstery materials

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en: Mr. D. currently owns five hectares of arable land. On the arable land, Valentin grows plums that he sells on the agricultural market. He sells the harvest of plums to exporters of table plums. He also brings some of the plums home to produce jam. He then sells the jam during difficult financial periods. He has run this business for three years already. Business is profitable, but Valentin wants to increase his profitability with new seedlings.

loans.use: To increase profitability through new seedlings.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Alberto M. atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su vivienda en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León. La inversión que requiere hacer es de una compra de un panel solar porque en su comunidad no poseen energía eléctrica y para ello le urge la implementación de dicho panel. 

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para el pago del panel a lo inmediato y así iniciar a utilizarlo y a la vez garantizar que sus pequeños hijos logren estudiar por las noches por medio de las lámparas eléctricas que el panel permite conectar.
texts.en:
Alberto M. needs to invest in his house, which is in the Telica municipality in the city of León. The investment he requires is to buy a solar panel because his community does not have electricity. That is why he wants to install the solar panel. He has gone to Ceprodel to receive a loan to buy the panel immediately. That way they can start using it and guarantee that his small children can study at night. They can use the light of the electric lamps that the panel allows them to connect.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for solar panel

loans.name: Malang Group

texts.en: Malang is the leader of the three-member Malang group. Each of them wants to receive a loan for advancing their business, and have requested a group loan. Malang wants to take out a loan for his general store, Halema wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business, and Habibullah wants to take out a loan for his business of selling fresh fruit.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
C. Đỗ Thị (727020927) is a 35 year old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To making a living, C. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. C. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. C. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 6 Group

texts.en:
These five micro-entrepreneurs live in Batey 18. This is a small settlement around one of the many sugar cane fields in La Romana. The sugar cane fields are owned by a private company, who also owns the houses in the batey and has some control over the commercial activities allowed inside the batey. This forces many of the batey inhabitants to leave their home and their children for extended periods of time to sell their goods. 

Mariluz M., the group coordinator, has 3 children (ages 11, 9 and 4). She sells two different things: candy and snacks, which she sells from a palatera (a small market stand) and chorizo (a type of sausage). This loan, which is Mariluz's very first loan with Esperanza, will allow her to purchase merchandise for both of her sales. 

However, Mariluz does not intend to remain a seller. She intends to learn beauty culture and open a beauty salon in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase candy and chorizo to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr:
O. Fatima est née le 17 juin 1934 à ADJOHOUN, une ville du département de l’OUEME.  Depuis plus de 30 ans, elle habite à Cotonou dans le quartier de Gankpodo. Elle a à sa charge cinq enfants, trois filles et deux garçons, qui sont tous scolarisés.

Fatima exerce l’activité de la vente des produits divers (savons, sucre et tomate en boîtes, détergentes, des cartes de recharge téléphonique) dans son domicile.  Elle s’approvisionne régulièrement à Dantokpa, le marché le plus grande du Bénin.  Actuellement, Fatima sollicite un crédit d’Alidé pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Fatima O. was born on the 17th of June, 1934 in Adjohoun, a city in the district of l'Oueme. For over 30 years she has lived in the Gankpodo quarter of Cotonou. She has five children in her care, three girls and two boys. They all attend school. Fatima is in the business of selling assorted products ( soaps, boxes of sugar and tomatoes, detergent, phone cards ) from her home. She buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the largest market in Benin. Fatima is now requesting a loan from d’Alidé to support her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies assorted goods and phone cards to resell

loans.name: Ernesto Alejandro

texts.es: El joven Ernesto Alejandro B. tiene la actividad económica de un salón de belleza ubicado en su humilde vivienda. Ernesto tiene 23 años de edad. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica brindar el servicio de salón de  belleza. A pesar de la corta edad que tiene ha salido adelante, ya que tenia que hacerse cargo de los gastos de su familia. La única manera que podía lograrlo era dedicándose a brindar el servicio de belleza y así salir adelante debido a sus escasos recursos. Esta solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de materiales, para el negocio es necesario mencionar que el joven es el encargado de hacer peinados, pistoleados, tintes y todo  lo relacionado con la belleza. Su mayor sueño es acondicionar su negocio para que obtener mas clientes.
texts.en:
The young Ernesto Alejandro B. has a beauty salon located in his humble home. Ernesto is 23 years old. He has been providing salon services for more than four years. In spite of his young age, he has been successful, because he had to take care of his family's expenses. The only way he could do that was to provide beauty services, so that he could succeed with few resources.

He is requesting a loan to buy more materials. For his business, he is in charge of styling hair, straightening, dyeing, and everything else related to beauty. His greatest dream is to set up his business to obtain more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 42-years old.  She is married and has given birth to four children, one boy and three girls. All the children are still in school. The family lives in a rented apartment. Beatrice sells soft drinks. She buys the drinks from wholesalers and sells them in a kiosk in her community. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy bulk assorted soft drinks in order to grow her business. Beatrice hopes to give all her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is divorced with two children. She sells vegetables at an open market in Ivano-Frankovsk town. Lilia co-owns this business with a friend of hers. They work in shifts to be able to extend the workday and increase their sales.

Lilia has been in this business for five years. During this time she has earned her clients' loyalty and respect The business enables Lilia to have a stable income and take care of her children. Lilia requests a loan of $775 to purchase seasonal produce that is high in demand. Offering more produce for sale will increase her income and help care for her family.

loans.use: To increase assortment of produc

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
La señora Ricarda Rodriguez vende artesanías en el mercado central del departamento de León donde a diario oferta las artesanías nicaragüenses a sus clientes y a la vez es visitada por turistas que se interesan en comprar tales productos para llevar a sus países. 

La señora Ricarda acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las artesanías debido a que requiere abastecer sus estantes y así continuar brindando los productos a los clientes que le visitan.
texts.en:
Ricarda Rodriguez sells handicrafts in the Department of León's central market. She offers Nicaraguan crafts to her customers each day, and she is also visited by tourists interested in buying these items to take to their countries. Ricarda came to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase more handicrafts, because she needs to stock her shelves in order to continue providing these products to the customers who visit her.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of handicraft items

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn Y. is a farmer in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. Since it is the rainy season, she needs to cultivate rice but she does not have enough money to buy rice seed so she decided to ask for a loan. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a fishnet and a boat for her husband, Mr. Chor Meourn, who is a fisherman.

Mrs. Horn Y. is 31 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and also a fishnet and boat for her husband

loans.name: Din Mohammad

texts.en:
Din M. is the son of E. M.. He lives in the 16th district of Kabul Afghanistan. He is 50 years old and is married with seven children. He has been a farmer since he was a child. He works hard on his land in order to have lots of clients and sell much of his fresh vegetables. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to purchase all his necessary materials. 
He is glad and would like to mention that Kiva is the best process.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for farming

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie D. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has 2 grown children. She is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. Josie has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Josie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Josie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 34 year old man who lives in Beirut, Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Yousef has been selling fruits and vegetables since 1989. He sells all types of fruits and vegetables depending on the season. Yousef has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him expand his stock and diversify his merchandise.  
Yousef is special in his work because he offers good quality products and has competitive prices. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase a variety of merchandise. In the future, Yousef plans on improving his business by continuing to diversify and by offering more merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Bizard

texts.en:
Bizard E., 35, is married to Marlyn E. and together they are blessed with two children. The elder is studying in high school and the younger is in elementary school. The family lives in Dasmariñas, Cavite, a province just south of Manila.

Bizard E. is a sewer and does furniture upholstery. He has been a sewer for 17 years.

A member of Center for Community Transformation* for more than a year, he has already received six loans from CCT because of good attendance in their weekly fellowship meetings and his regular payment of dues. With the added capital that he received from CCT, his business grew and now he earns 12500 PHP net profit per month.

Because he sees that his business is flourishing, he now wants to further expand his business by applying for a 16000 PHP loan so that he can use it as added capital to buy more raw materials for making more furniture.

He prays that God will continually bless his business so that someday he can have his own upholstery shop full of clients and earn enough money for his kids to finish their studies until they graduate in college.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: To purchase leather and other material for making furniture.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Daniela del Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 48 años  de edad,  desde hace veinte años puso una pulpería el cual administra todo esto lo ha logrado con apoyo de su esposo como los financiamiento que Afodenic  a dado ya que ha invertido en productos varios. Su esposo trabaja en construcción, procreo cinco hijos  tres independientes y dos están estudiando. Con las ganancias ha logrado hacer mejoras a su casa, hace poco la pinto para que se viera bonita y poder atraer la clientela con una mejor visión de su pulpería. Con este préstamo invertirá en granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, pastas colgate, productos enlatados de sardinas, atún, salsa inglesa, salsa de tomate, pollo, carnes y lácteos para poder sastifacer las necesidades a su clientes ya que es lo que se consume día a día.  Sus créditos han sido para aumentar el inventario y para aumentar las ventas y mejor en esta temporada ya que espera vender más,  ya que las ventas  han estado bajas.Da las gracias a la institucion por los ciclos aprobados y por hacer posible su rentabilidad en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Daniela is a hard working woman. She is 48 years old and for the past 20 years she has run a small home-based grocery store. She has accomplished this with the help of her husband and with financing from Afodenic, which has allowed her to invest in a variety of merchandise. Her husband is a construction worker. They have five children, three of them are adults and two are students. Her earnings have allowed her to make improvements to their home. She recently had it painted so that it would look nicer and so that customers would be more attracted to her store. She will invest the money from this loan in basic items, such as: rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, soap, toothpaste, canned sardines, tuna, Worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce, chicken, meats, and milk products in order to satisfy the needs of her customers, as these are the things that they use daily. She has used her past loans to increase her inventory and sales. She hopes to do so this season, as her sales have been a bit low. She thanks the institution for approving her past requests and for making it possible for her to say in business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in basic food products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Prepare and sell food products

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally D., a rice grower from Veruela, Agusan del Sur, wishes to obtain a loan to improve her harvest by buying better farm supplies. She has seven children. Her eldest child is 24 years old. She is quite happy with the income she earns from growing rice on her farm. She hopes to receive a loan of 6,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. because in addition to providing loans, they also enroll all of their clients into an insurance program.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Karla Magdalena

texts.es:
Karla C. es una  dama que labora como Instructora de Informática en un instituto de la ciudad de Managua. Es madre soltera, por lo que se esfuerza grandemente en su trabajo para obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. 

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: pio, cemento  y mano de obra para el mejoramiento de su  su casa de habitación  que ha estado en malas condiciones pero ahora mejorará grandemente gracias a esta inversión que ella está haciendo.

Con este crédito, ella garantiza tener un lugar seguro donde sus hijos vivan y toda la familia pueda desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Karla C. V. works as a Data Processing instructor at the Nicaraguan-German Professional Training Center (CECNA) at the Nicaragua National Autonomous University. She is a single mother, because of this she puts a tremendous amount of energy into her work in order to be able to sustain the well being of her family. She plans to use her loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials like spackle, cement and man power to make improvements to her home that is currently in poor conditions but that will get a lot better thanks to the the investment that she is making. With this loan, she will be able to provide a safe home for her kids and family to develop in.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Sabati Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Sabati  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles au quartier Dioni de la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Baouréli, quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments (huiles maggies), de céréales, du savon, des tubercules, du poisson etc.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les 4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Sabati sont à leur  5 prêt solidaire.
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, deux tonnes de céréales (haricot mil, maïs), des colis des variétés de condiments alimentaires (des épices et un fût d’huile alimentaire).
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs et grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes à Dioni et au marché de Konobougou, généralement au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui servira à étoffer leur fonds de commerce et subvenir aux dépenses ayant trait à la nourriture, à la scolarité des enfants et à la santé.
texts.en:
All ten women from the Sabati group are married. On average they are 32 years of age with two children, and all live in traditional households in the Dioni neighborhood of Konobougou, in the Baouréli prefecture of the 4th administrative region of Mali. These women got to know each other through family ties and are retailers of various goods, such as food condiments (Maggi vegetable oil), cereals, soap, tubers, fish, etc. Having fully repaid their four previous loans, the women from the Sabati group are now requesting a fifth group loan. They intend to use it to buy two tons of cereal (beans, millet, corn), and packages of various food condiments (spices and a barrel of vegetable oil). They mainly get their supplies from local producers. They then sell their products in Dioni and at the Konobougou market, in general for cash, to a customer base of both women and men. They hope to achieve average monthly earnings of 20,000 FCFA each, which will be used to bolster their working capital and contribute to family expenses regarding food, children’s education and healthcare.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various goods

loans.name: Future Planners Group

texts.en: Issa B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs from the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have named their group 'Future Planners'. The leader of the group, Issa B., is an Okada driver (motor-bikes used as taxis). He has been in the Okada business for three years now.  The 34-year-old Issa was born in Matotoka village, about 8 miles from Magburaka. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children. With this loan, the members of the 'Future Planners' group will buy a new motor-bike.

loans.use: Buy a new motor-bike

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mr. C. is a rural villager, 32 years old, who lives in the capital of Phnom Penh. Here, he makes a living as a publisher in the cloth publishing company and earns a salary of $150 a month, which he uses to support his family’s daily living expenses. C. has a life partner in his wife who works sewing clothes in factory and is also a good homemaker, cooking tasty meals for the family. They have two school-aged kids who are dependent on their income. C. saw that the poultry-raising trade operated by his neighbor is a profitable one and he hopes to invest in this sector in order to make additional income for family. However, he doesn’t have money for this propose. Thus, he looks for a $1,200 loan which will enable him to purchase one thousand small chickens to raise in a stall he built. Note: Mr. C. was not available for photographing, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a thousand small chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beef cattle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D. is from the village of Bongbongon, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Evelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately  PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Izat

texts.ru: Джураева Изат проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 56 лет. Вдова, имеет 5 детей. Дети в России на заработках. Сама Изат имеет среднее образование. После того как мужа не стала она занялась животноводством. Изат откармливает и продает крупно - рогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Izat D. lives in the region of Yavan. She is 56 year sold. She is a widow and has five children. They are now working in Russia. Izat has secondary education. After he husband passed away she started doing animal husbandry. Izat feeds and sells large cattle. She has been in this business for more than five years. She is taking out the loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Mauricia Del Socorro

texts.es: Mauricia del Socorro tiene 63 años, hace más de 3 años que inicio con este negocio como es una pulpería, Mauricia ha intentado muchas cosas para mejorar la estabilidad de su familia. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender ropa, pero tenía muchas dificultades ya que no pasaba mucho tiempo con su familia. Pero como no tenía mucho dinero decidió invertir sus ahorros en víveres y venderlos a los vecinos. Poco a poco fue incrementando su tienda, aunque no cuenta con muchos productos ella sigue trabajando para incrementarlos, vende arroz, azúcar aceite, etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, azúcar y aceites para su tienda. Sueña con terminar de realizarle ciertas reparaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mauricia del Socorro, 63, started her general store more than 3 years ago. She has tried many things to improve her family's economic stability; she previously sold clothing, but had many difficulties and was not able to spend much time with her family. Because she did not have much money, she decided to invest her savings in supplies and sell them to her neighbours. Little by little her store has been growing, and although she does not have many products she continues working to expand her inventory. She sells rice, sugar, oil, etc. With the requested loan, she wants to buy supplies such as rice, sugar and oils for her store. She dreams of completing certain home repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital: general store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 28, is married and has two children. He runs Mama Judy General Shop and his wife assists him in the business. David divides his time to manage his business and his job where he works as a driver. He belongs to Prosper group in Faulu Kenya, whose members guarantee one another's loans. 

David has requested for a loan of Kes 40,000 to add stock of sugar, cooking fat and soap in his shop. He hopes to invest in other businesses so as to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and soap

loans.name: Elenie

texts.en:
Being single has not limited Elenie B.’s opportunity to feel what it is like to raise children and to take care of their needs every day. At home, she is accompanied by a nephew and niece. She makes them feel loved and is helping in making their lives comfortable. In a way, she feels as though she is the real mother of her loving nephew and niece. From them, she draws out strength and determination to work hard and improve their standard of living. Nevertheless, Elenie still looks forward to having her own family in the future. But, meanwhile, she wants to be financially stable. 

To be able to reach her dream of having a stable source of income to support her above-mentioned aspirations, she joined ASHI in 2003. Loans made to her since then until the present have enabled her to start raising hogs and buying and selling them as a business. All throughout her membership, Elenie has never been a problem for her co-members in terms of payment. 

She believes that fate has been good to her without giving her a hard time to manage her business. After four months of raising her hogs, she sells them either alive or slaughtered to people in her village and sometimes in the market. Along with that, she also buys different commodities for selling. 

Elenie enjoys spending the small profit she earns through the business to give her niece and nephew necessary things. However, thinking about a better kind of house to comfort and shelter her and the children she is taking care of, the urge to grow her business further becomes so intense. Because of that, she is requesting a much larger amount of loan for the financial capital growing her business requires.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise and to purchase commodities to resell

loans.name: Gladys 	Virginia

texts.es: La Señora Gladys Madre de dos hijas muy responsables que lucha en la vida por darles una educación buena a ellas, la actividad que tiene es bastante humilde  sacrificada pero rentable, inicio su negocio ya hace dos años atrás obteniendo buenos resultados ya que las hamburguesas que realiza son muy agradables, debida  a esta razón es que se animo a solicitar un crédito para comprar un carrito mas grande donde pueda elaborar mas hamburguesas y mas rápido y asi los clientes también se sientan cómodos, siendo este un emprendimiento de una mujer es bastante valorado por el esfuerzo que realiza durante todos los días a partir de las 18:00 pm hasta las 24:00 pm, y esta es la rutina de la señora todos los días de la semana, para que sus niñas puedan estudiar dignamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is the mother of two responsible daughters and struggles in life to provide them with a good education. She has made sacrifices to operate her modest business, but it has been profitable. Gladys started selling hamburgers two years ago and has obtained good results. For this reason, she was motivated to apply for a loan in order to buy a larger food cart so that she could prepare more hamburgers in less time and make her customers feel comfortable. Being a woman entrepreneur, Gladys values the effort she puts into the work she performs every day from 6pm to midnight. Her daily routine enables her daughters to have a decent education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a larger food cart for selling hamburgers

loans.name: Ericka Delfina

texts.es:
Ericka nació y vive en la ciudad del Cusco donde vive con su esposo y fruto del matrimonio tienen dos hermosos hijos. 

Ericka lleva toda su vida rodeada de panes. Su padre era maestro panadero y se dedicaba a la elaboración de panes en sus dos hornos que están ubicados en el distrito de San Sebastián, cerca de la ciudad del Cusco en Perú. Ericka cuando era niña ayudaba en el horno a su papá y le daba un porcentaje de las ganancias.  Al cumplir la mayoría de edad Ericka, su papá decidió darle para que administre uno de los hornos. 

Decidida a mejorar y administrar el negocio, Ericka al ver que tenía mucha demanda sus ricos panes. Utilizo sus ahorros para abrir una panificadora “El Crocandito” en su domicilio, donde vende panes especiales, bocaditos y tortas. La pueden encontrar en su panificadora, que está equipado algunas vitrinas, los 7 días de la semana, desde muy temprano hasta bastante tarde de la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro de panes. Ericka desprende una imagen de experiencia y amabilidad. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su panificadora y el negocio se anima bastante durante la hora del desayuno y loche. Ella vende panes de buena calidad y a un costo barato.     
  
Con su próximo préstamo, Ericka espera recibir $400 USD. Por el momento, su panificadora, esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar una vitrina y para comprar los insumos para la elaboración de masa. 
Ericka pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.  El sueño de la socia es abrir otros planificadores “Crocanditos” en la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Ericka was born and lives in Cusco city where she lives with her husband and fruit of their marriage - 2 beautiful children. Ericka has spent her life surrounded by bread. Her father was a master baker and worked making bread in his 2 ovens located in the San Sebastián district, close to Cusco city in Peru. When Ericka was a little girl she used to help her father with the ovens and he used to give her a percentage of his earnings. When Ericka became older her father decided to give her one of the ovens to administer. Determined to improve and administer her business well, Ericka had a lot of demand for her delicious breads. She used her savings to open an industrial bakery 'El Crocandito' in her house, where she sells special breads, snacks and cakes. You can find her in her bakery, which is equipped with various display cases, 7 days a week, from very early until quite late at night or until her supply of bread finishes. Ericka gives off an image of experience and friendliness. A regular flow of customers visit her bakery and the business becomes quite busy during breakfast and lunch hours. Ericka sells good quality bread at a cheap price.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display case and ingredients to make dough

loans.name: Keam

texts.en:
The smiling-faced person shown in the photo is Mrs. T., a 45-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. In addition, she raises a few pigs from which she is able to generate extra revenue to meet the financial crisis of her family. She runs her business at home and earns approximately $5 a day. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her.

There is a neighboring farmland in good location for farming. T. wants to be the owner of this land but she doesn’t have enough money to buy it. Thus, she is looking for loan to be able to afford to purchase the farmland where she will plant more crops.

loans.use: To purchase neighboring farmland where she will plant crops

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: Benita, de 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, Javier y Roxana de 14 y 12 años. Juntos residen en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su propia casa. A pesar de tener primaria incompleta, eso no lo incomodó a que siga luchando por la satisfacción personal y familiar. Benita, le gusta sobresalir y conjuntamente con su esposo abrieron una mecánica, específicamente elaborar puertas y ventanas de metal, en donde repara, suelda, con el fin de obtener un mejor resultado de calidad. Asimismo sus clientes se sienten satisfechos por el buen acabado que les brinda, incluso la buena crítica o comentarios de su trabajo, hacen que Benita se esmere más en su trabajo. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, y juntos le dan mucho amor y dedicación a su trabajo, pero además tiene a cargo de sus colaboradores, de esa manera lo puedan facilitar en cualquier tarea que se les encomiende. Por lo general su taller está ubicado en su mismo barrio de su propia localidad, de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche. Su plan a futuro es abrir una tienda con el propósito de que pueda diversificar su cartera de clientes y elevar su calidad de vida. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se asegura cumplir fielmente con su cronograma de pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal, ya que obtiene buenos beneficios económicos. Con el crédito que solicita le servirá para que pueda comprar la materia prima, de esa menara pueda elaborar eficiente los servicios que requieren sus clientes.
texts.en:
Benita, 36 years old, is married and has two children, Javier and Roxana who are 14 and 12 years old. Together they live on the outskirts of the Peruvian jungle, in the town of Santa Rosa where they own their own home. She carries on fighting for her personal and family's satisfaction, despite not having completed elementary school. Benita likes to improve herself and along with her husband she has opened a shop in which they manufacture metal doors and windows. and where they also fix and mend in order to obtain better quality results. Their customers are pleased with the finished product and their compliments on her work makes Benita want to work even harder. She normally works alongside her husband and together they put a lot of love and dedication in their work. They also have assistants and that allows them to make any order easier to accomplish. The shop is located in the same neighborhood they live in. They work Mondays through Saturdays, from 7am to 8pm. Her plan for the future is tu open a shop to diversify her customer base and improve her quality of life. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she commits to comply with her schedule of payments. She also thanks her community bank for making good economic benefits available. She will buy raw materials with the loan to be able to efficiently fill her customers' orders.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase metal to manufacture door and windows

loans.name: Virgen De Bronce (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Virgen de Bronce está formado por 11 socias, son mujeres con mucho sentido del humor que luchan día a día  para ofrecerles  a sus familias un mejor porvenir. Viven por el sector de la Virgen del Bronce en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza natural, su centro histórico, su gente y su gastronomía.

La Señorita Sonia B. vive por el sector de la Virgen del Bronce, este es el tercer crédito que realiza y tiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias de la banca comunal. Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad es soltera y tiene una niña de un año y nueve meses, vive en casa de sus padres los que tienen casa propia.
La Señorita. Sonia es estilista pero por el momento no ejerce su profeción, se dedica hace 3 años a la cría de cerdos, ella compra cerdos, los cría un tiempo y luego los vende.  Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un cerdo y el alimento para todos sus animales.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener su gabinete de belleza para ejercer su carrera.

La Señora Narcisa T. vive por el sector de la Virgen del Bronce, tiene de 44 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 18, 13 años de edad. Su primera hija es modista y trabaja, su segunda hija estudia en la universidad y su última hija  en el colegio, su esposo es de profesión artesano, gracias al trabajo conyugal están construyendo su casa propia.
Doña Narcisa es artesana y se dedica a la elaboración de bases para flores y cuenta con una floristería, arreglan los salones para todo tipo de evento social como  matrimonios, cumpleaños etc., labora en su negocio de domingo a domingo sin tener un horario fijo. Este es el sexto crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, los cuales le han servido mucho en su negocio. El nuevo crédito lo va invertir en la compra de materia prima para realizar sus arreglos florales.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgen de Bronce is made up of 11 members. They are all women with a good sense of humor that strive day after day to give their families a better future. They live in the Virgen del Bronce neighborhood in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its natural beauty, its historic downtown, its people and its cuisine. Señorita Sonia B. lives in the Virgen del Bronce neighborhood. She is 31 years old, single and has a 21 month old daughter. She lives with her parents who have their own house. This is her third loan and she has a good rapport with all the members of the communal bank. Señorita Sonia is a stylist, but at the moment she is not pursuing her profession. She has been raising pigs for the last 3 years. She buys pigs, raises them for a time and then sells them. With this loan she will buy a pig and feed for all her animals. Her goal is to have a beauty parlor so she can pursue career. Señora Narcisa T. lives in the Virgen del Bronce neighborhood. She is 44 years old, married and has 3 children ages 22, 18 and 13. Her oldest daughter works as a seamstress, her second daughter is a university student and her youngest daughter is in high school. Her husband works as a craftsman and because of their joint work efforts they are building their own house. Doña Narcisa is also an artisan and makes bases for flowers and has a flower shop. She arranges rooms for all types of social events such as weddings, birthdays, etc. She works everyday and doesn't have a fixed schedule. This is her sixth loan with the communal bank. The loans have been a big help to her business. With this loan she will buy materials to make flower arrangements. Her goal is to finish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a hog and feed for all the animals.  Also, to purchase flowers, pots, etc.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena C. is from the village of Barangay 26, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Azucena is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Azucena owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies like boiled corn and rice cakes in the local community. Azucena has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Azucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Azucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Azucena is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional corn to sell and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Azucena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional corn to sell and provide working capital

loans.name: Musee

texts.en:
Musee K. is a 38-year-old fishmonger in Mtwapa, Kenya.  He is married to Magaret Musee, who is also a fishmonger and contributes to the family income.  They are blessed with five children.  K. has been in the fishmongering business for the last eight years, and business has been good thus far.

Musee was introduced to KADET, and he is now requesting his first loan, which he intends to use to buy sacks of charcoal for resale as a secondary business and to build a washing basin for his fish mongering business.  

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children, and he hopes to be successful in his businesses.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal for resale as a secondary business

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en:
Conrado A. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. He is 34 years old. Conrado is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Conrado owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing multipurpose cab services to local community members. Conrado has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Conrado joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conrado is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for the maintenance of the vehicle. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Conrado from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools for the maintenance of the vehicle

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William O. is a farmer and resident of the town of Nyamira in western Kenya.  He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years.  He produces milk, tea, maize, beans, and chicken that he sells locally.  He has two temporary employees.

William earns a salary of 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.  He has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow.  The loan will improve his family's earnings.

William hopes to expand his farm and rear more sheep.  His only challenge is a lack of farm inputs due to their high cost.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kulun

texts.en:
Kulun K. is 62 years-old widow with eight grown children.  The youngest son, in accordance with ancient kyrgyz tradition, lives with her and helps in the household.  In order to find means of subsistence for her large family, in 1991 Kulun started her business in livestock breeding and cultivating of beans. She has worked hard  developing her farm and today has two cows, two horses and twenty five sheep.  Her business generates a profit of 7,500 Kyrgyz Soms a month through selling milk and meat products.   Now Kulun plans to use the loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her business by purchasing 29 sheep. With the revenues from this investment, Kulun plans to reconstruct her house.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey S. is from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. He is 35 years old. Jeffrey is single. To make a living, Jeffrey owns & operates a furniture-making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture such as beds to local businesses and community members. Jeffrey has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jeffrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeffrey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Jeffrey is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jeffrey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

location.town: Port Area, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Touba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe groupe de solidarité TOUBA est créé depuis la mise en place du Banc Villageois, il y a de cela plus de 8 ans. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent le même village et ont le même centre d'intérêt qui est le développement de terroir. 

Madame Fatou M., à gauche de la photo, levant main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle vend des produits divers tels que des céréales et des produits d'artisanat 

Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The Touba solidarity group was created when the Banc Villageois was set up, more than 8 years ago. The group is made up of 13 women who live in the same village and have the same main interest - development of their land. 

Madame Fatou M., on the left in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. She has a small store, where she sells various products such as cereals and craft items. With the profit, she helps her husband in managing the family.

loans.use: To develop and market her small business

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy A. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 20 years old. Mary Joy is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Mary Joy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years.

Mary Joy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Joy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Aleyda Del Pilar

texts.es: Esta señora es maestra desde hace 31 años, fue directora del centro donde hoy labora que es el Instituto señor de esquipulas telica, tiene un edad de 54 años es madre de 2 hijos una mujercita que esta casada y un varon que es el que tiene a su cargo, es originaria de esta localidad de telica, sus familiares tanto paternos como maternos son reconocidos por sobresalir como artistas y como personas educadas, trabajadoras, esta señora ha trabajado con la empresa ceprodel desde el año 2003 hasta la fecha, obteniendo financiamientos tanto para desarrollo familiar y mejoramiento de vivienda el cual le ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia, ha mantenido la fidelidad con la empresa en cuanto a la continuidad de sus solicitudes.
texts.en: Aleyda del Pilar has been a teacher for 31 years. She was previously the director of the school where she now works, the Señor de Esquipulas Institute in Telica. She is 54 years old and a mother of two. Her daughter is a young married woman and her son is still in her care. She is originally from Telica and both her paternal and maternal relatives are known for excelling as artists, educated individuals, and hard workers. Aleyda del Pilar has been working with Ceprodel since 2003. She has obtained loans both to help her family develop and to make improvements to their home, in order to improve the quality of life for her and her family. She has maintained the trust of the organization in regards to continuing to request loans.

loans.use: school expenses and dental work

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is a dairy farmer from Litein town in the Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been in the farming business for ten years and sells his milk through Brookside Company. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which is sold locally.

He has requested a loan of 40,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to improve his dairy farming. The extra income from this loan will help him expand his business and improve his family's livelihood. He says that his biggest challenges have been diseases and the fluctuating market price of milk.

Japhet is 28 years old and single.

loans.use: To improve his dairy farming.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo, y con el tiempo se ha convertido en su fuente de ingreso indispensable. Es así que trabaja todos los días, a horas de la madrugada, para dirigirse hacía sus campos y cuidarlos, asimismo posee animales, como: ovejas, vacas y cerdos, que los lleva a pastar en el campo. Su trabajo lo realizan en comuna con toda su familia, y en donde su esposo es participe también, así juntos aseguran tener los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Se siente muy satisfecha de seguir adelante por lo que ha decidido  mejorar más en sus cultivos con semillas mejoradas ya que en la actualidad  su cosecha han compensado el esfuerzo que ha realizado, aunque siempre exista el riesgo de pérdida de sus cosechas por condiciones climáticas. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono, así como contratar jornaleros para que le ayuden a remover la tierra para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en: Rayda is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and their children in her own house. Since she was very young she has been working in the fields, and with time she has turned her work into an indispensible source of income. Thus she works every day and into the night, driving out to the fields to look after them. She also keeps animals, including sheep, cows and pigs, which she takes to the fields for pasture. She works alongside her whole family, and when her husband is involved, between them they are assured of having the income to support their family. Rayda is very satisfied at their continuing progress. She has decided to further improve their crop with better seed, however, because although the harvest so far has repaid the work they put in, there is always the risk of losing a harvest through bad weather. This is her first loan from [field partner] MFP. She is very happy in the knowledge that she can access such financial support, and is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible people who will stick together. She is also grateful to the lenders who will come forward to offer the money she is looking for, because it will be very useful in progressing her work. The loan she is seeking will be invested in buying sacks of fertilizer, and in employing casual labourers to help till the earth for the next planting.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer and employ day labourers

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio, de 60 años. Es un hombre trabajador, se separó de su esposa hace algunos años; a pesar de ello sigue adelante cuidando de sus 4 hijos, quienes juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). “El trabajo constante”, es su lema; ya que hace 40 años viene dedicándose tenazmente a la agricultura. Sus principales cultivos constan de plátanos y café, productos que cuida, fertiliza y limpia constantemente. Como la cosecha de café es una vez al año; Eugenio contratará personal para que le apoyen en la extracción del grano. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el empeño y esfuerzo que le da y se ve reflejado cuando cosecha y comercializa en su totalidad. Hace poco con las ganancias obtenidas abrió una tienda de comestibles, donde pueda vender productos de primera necesidad obteniendo ganancias diarias. Ahora desea incrementar sus ingresos con la mejora de sus cultivos; pues desea brindar un mejor futuro a su menor hijo Juan y su nieta Araceli, quienes son aún niños. Él pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el progreso de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde agradece la confianza recibida. Eugenio, se está preparando para la cosecha de sus granos de café. Por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono asimismo comprará productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 60 years old.  He is a hard-working man who has been separated from his wife for some years.  In spite of this, he continues to get ahead in life and care for his 4 children who live in their own home in the town of Unión Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle).  "Constant work" is Eugenio's motto since he has been working tenaciously in the field of agriculture for 40 years.  His main crops are bananas and coffee, products that he cares for, fertilizes and weeds constantly.  As his coffee harvest takes place once a year, Eugenio hires staff to support him in extracting his beans.  What he most likes about his work is the determination and effort that he puts in which is clearly reflected when he harvests and sells all of his crops.  A little while ago, he used his profits to open a grocery store where he sells essentials.  This makes him daily profits.  He would currently like to increase his income by improving his crops so that he can provide his younger son Juan and his granddaughter Areceli with a better future (they are both still children).

Eugenio is a member of the "Desarrollando para el Progreso de Prisma" community bank and this is the first loan that he has had from MFP.  He is grateful for the trust that has been placed in him.  Eugenio is preparing to harvest his coffee crop.  He is planning to use this loan to buy several sacks of manure.  He will also buy essentials to stock his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure and also products to stock his store

loans.name: Norma Narcisa

texts.es:
Norma Narcisa T. C., tiene 34 años de edad, es casado, vive con los 2 hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Norma se dedica a la crianza de animales como cerdo para tener dinero para la alimentacion de los hijos.
Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar balanceado para los animales, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es ampliar el negocio.

Los desafíos las enfermedades de los cerdos y la competencia. Le gusta hacer deporte y bailar en las fiestas.
texts.en:
34-year-old Norma Narcisa T. C. is married with two children, and she lives in Tangara, San Miguel Canton, Bolivar Province, Ecuador.

The credit window to which Norma belongs, Campesinos Unidos, is located in Tangara, 15 minutes from the San Miguel Canton. (Note: a canton in Ecuador is similar to a county in the USA.) The members of this credit window work in agriculture and trade. Norma raises animals such as pigs to be able to pay to feed her children. She buys her products in San Miguel, and sells them in the market of the same canton.

She is applying for this loan to buy feed for her animals; the credit will allow her to produce more in her family business and pay off the debt in a timely manner. Her dream is to grow her business.

Norma's biggest challenges are illnesses her pigs might catch and competition from other vendors. She likes to play sports and dance at festivals.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Saidaan's Group

texts.en:
