Saidaan is a housewife as well as a working woman. She is a professional seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and provides good quality services to her clients. She has been living in the city of Pakpattan (known for its agriculture) in Pakistan for the past 15 years. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he is a watchman by profession.  

Saidaan is the mother of two sons; one is adopted by her and he is the elder one. He operates a business selling fish feed. Saidaan’s two biological children are illiterate and stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her adopted son's business. He wants to buy larger quantities of fish feed for resale. He has a good deal of experience in his business and Saidaan is confident that an investment will be a productive one for him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She paid her installments on time in the previous loan year and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Saidaan.

loans.use: To buy fish feed for resale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. is from the village of Romarate, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old. Jocelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Whenslause Simiyu

texts.en:
Whenslause, who has been in the transport industry in the town of Naivasha for the last two years, is 32 years old, married to Edna Bosibori, and the father of one child. Introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, this will be his second loan after having repaid his first one well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to open a cloth store.

In the future, Whenslause hopes to buy a pickup truck to transport goods to and from the market

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water bills.

For the past 4 years, Gladys has been operating a boda boda (motorcycle) business.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also has a dressing making business which provides her with another source of income. Gladys faces a major challenge in delayed payments by creditors in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 20,000,  Gladys wants to purchase bundles of clothes and Safaricom mobile air time scratch cards to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and cell phone airtime cards to resell

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 44-year-old housewife, married to Muhsin who has retired from working at Jordan University. They have four children to raise. 

After her husband's retirement, and because she wanted to devote herself to her kids, Najah helped her husband to open a store for selling cosmetics and cleaning products in their neighborhood by taking their first loan.

Now, since their business is successfully running, Najah is applying for another loan to buy more cosmetic products for their humble store. Because Najah is a conservative person, she suggested that her husband appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products for their humble store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 31-year-old businesswoman.  She is married and has no children.   In 2000, the borrower   established her business selling  Maggi cubes, cooking oil, canned tomato sauce, rice, and sugar. She began her business because she  started to help her mother in the market and her mother  encouraged her to start selling  for herself. 

Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. The borrower requires a loan in order to improve her  business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, she plans to improve herself and the income of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy  Maggi cubes, cooking oil, canned tomato sauce, rice, and sugar for her business inventory.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 29 years old, married to James and blessed with three children. She has a transport business and a gym that she has been running for four years. She earns a monthly income of about 20,000 KES which she uses to take care of her family and pump back into her business.

Florence is being loaned 80,000 KES, her first loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use the loan to purchase modern equipment for her gym.

Florence plans to use the anticipated profits to purchase another matatu (vehicle) and pay for her children’s higher education. In the future, she hopes to purchase a plot of land and develop it.

loans.use: to purchase modern equipment for her gym.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has owned a cattle farm in his town since 2008. He has good number of cows on his farm. He takes good care of the animals in order to get a good quantity of milk. His fresh products are all sold to local markets. He helps his father in collaboration with his brothers to provide better living conditions for the family. 

Today, Marwan is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fodder for the cattle to increase his milk productivity. In the future, he is hoping to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for the cattle.

loans.name: Zoraida Felipa

texts.es:
Zoraida, habita en la ciudad de León, esta casada, es madre de dos hijos, tiene 52 años de edad. Ella es comerciante se dedica hacer y vender pan. Tiene su panadería en  su casa de habitación donde elaboran pan simple y pan dulce inicio en este negocio hace mas de 18 años con capital que su esposo puso y han venido los dos trabajando juntos hasta lograr poner la panadería, ellos distribuyen su producto en los barrios aledaños a la  cuidad de León. 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar materia prima como harina, aceite, levadura, manteca, azúcar para elaborar pan. Esta inversión le ayudara a tener material para producir almacenar para resistir un poco el alza de los precios. En sus próximos planes esta comprar un horno industrial, también adquirir un microbús para repartir pan, quiere hacer crecer su negocio, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Zoraida lives in the town of León, she is 52 years old, she is married and she is the mother of two children. She is retailer engaging in preparing and selling bread. She has set her bakery in her house, where she prepares salty and sweetened breads. She started this activity more than 18 years ago thanks to her husband’s money, and they have been working together until they were able to open the bakery. They distribute their products in the adjoining neighborhoods of the town of León.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic ingredients such as flour, oil, yeast, butter and sugar. This investment will help her gaining the ingredients to produce and store [bread] in order to face a little the rising of prices. Her future plans involve buying an industrial oven, as well as a minibus to distribute bread. She wants her activity to grow in order to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, yeast, butter and sugar to make bread.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, who is 52 year old, works as a farmer along with her husband. Their income is 2 USD per day. The couple has two children, ages 22 and 25, who work in a factory and each earn 2 USD daily. Every month, Touch spends 40 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, 10 USD on rent, 20 USD on transportation, and 20 USD on other expenses. 

Touch is requesting an 800 USD loan to buy a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she plans to raise chickens at home because she is getting old and doesn’t have much energy for farming. Touch also wishes to send her children to study and learn a skill so they may have their own careers in the future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Angélica Yomaira

texts.es:
Angélica de 23 años vive en una localidad suburbana con caminos de tierra (Fortín en Guayaquil), decidió empezar haciendo comida para vender ya que en la zona no había competencia para ella. Su negocio lleva el nombre de su hija Diana. "Restaurante Dianita", aquí ella hace comidas rápida y almuerzos. 
Ella es madre soltera por lo que lucha sola con sus 2 hijos uno que tiene 5 años y el segundo 4 ambos estudiantes de primaria. 
El negocio lo mantiene en las afueras de su casa. Ya tiene su clientela definida y conocidos.
No ha tenido ninguna dificultad al momento de desarrollar sus actividades, se levanta muy temprano para limpiar el lugar y ordenar los alimentos.
Ella desea un préstamo, para comprar, cemento, arena y bloques para terminar de construir su negocio. Su sueño como toda madre es ver a sus pequeños hijos todos unos profesionales.
texts.en: Angélica is 23 years old and lives in a suburban town with dirt roads (Fortin en Guayaquil). She decided to make food to sell as there was no competition in the area. Her business is named "Restaurante Dianita" after her daughter Diana. She makes quick meals and lunches here. She is a single mother who struggles to raise her two children aged 2 and 5, both of who attend primary school. The restaurant is located outside her house. She already has a specific and known clientele. She has not encountered any difficulty in developing her business. She gets up very early to clean the place and order food. She wants the loan to buy cement, sand and building blocks to finish building her business. Her dream as every mother is to see her two young children grow up to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks.

loans.name: Ermina Marilin

texts.es:
ErM. de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es vendedora informal de artículos de hogar en diferentes calles de Guayaquil. Comenzó sola trabajando para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ya que tienen 4 hijos. Poco a poco fue incrementando la mercadería y su capital de trabajo. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere mejorar su mercadería con mas artículos de hogar como ollas, planchas, vajillas con el préstamo. En el futuro tiene proyectado mejorar su hogar y darle una mejor economía a sus hijos y así poder terminar de construir la casa.
texts.en:
ErM. is 28 years old. She is a hardworking woman and she is an informal seller of items for the home in different streets in Guayaquil. She started working in order to help her husband with the family expenses since they have 4 children. Little by little she has been increasing her merchandise and her working capital. 

She has many ambitions for her business, so she wants to improve her merchandise with more articles for the home, such as cooking pots, irons, and dish sets. For the future she plans to improve her house and provide her children with a better family economy and finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy cooking pots, irons, and dish sets

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 3 children.

Merlyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of  5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Merlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Juan Manuel le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior y terminar las escalera para la segunda planta.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material que es (cemento, arena, pintura especial para el exterior de las vivienda y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora) ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora antes de que empiece el invierno y así proteger a su familia de enfermedades. 
Don Juan Manuel planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de carga, su esposa la señora Magdalena se encarga del cuidado y atención de sus dos hijos que estén bien en los estudios. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel’s house still needs exterior finishing touches and to finish building the stairway to the second story.  He asks for a loan to buy building materials and supplies (cement, sand, special exterior paint for the house and to pay the person who will do the work) since at present he does not have the needed funds to carry out the work before winter starts and to keep his family safe from diseases.

Juan Manuel plans to repay the loan with the salary he earns as a truck driver.  His wife, Magdalena, cares for their two children who are doing well in school.  He wants to improve the family’s assets.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.ru: Орифчон молодой энергичный предприниматель. Он женат. Жена домохозяйка. Ранее он занимался торговлей обуви и вот уже три года как занимается торговлей  тканей для женской одежды. Орифчон содержит свою семью и хочет расширить обороты своего товара. Он желает получить займ  и добиться еще успехов  в своем предпринимательском деле.
texts.en: Orifjon is a young and energetic businessman. He is married. His wife is a homemaker. Earlier he used to sell shoes and as of three years ago he sells fabrics for women's clothing. Orifjon supports his family and wants to increase the turnover of his inventory. He wants to get a loan and achieve even more success in this business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics with the purpose of renewing the inventory.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with 2 school aged children. She also has one additional family member. 

She sells bananas on a wholesale basis at the market.  Edith has been in business for over ten years.  She works seven days a week.  Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation.

Edith has requested a loan of 2000000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas.  

Her goals and aspirations are to go to farmers for bananas, buy a motor van to ease transportation and to build rental houses. 

She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sofa, kitchen utensils, bags and sheets to sell

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 27 years old and has 2 children ages 4 and 6. She is married to a businessman. She has been selling pesticides for 2 years. Seraphine would like a loan to buy pesticides for growing onions and tomatoes. She would like to use any profits to buy a motor bike which will help grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more pestcides for sale.

loans.name: Altanbagana

texts.en:
Altanbagana is a 33-year-old man who lives with his two children and wife in an outer ger district without basic infrastructure in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He works for a local company while his children attend secondary school and kindergarten. His wife stays at home to look after their children. 
Last year, Altanbagana bought a new plot of land for 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). He is planning to build a new house on this plot next spring, so he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials. 
Altanbagana is a trusted client of Kiva partner Transcapital Company Ltd.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Bol

texts.en:
Bol is 30 years old and is a married woman with four children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business selling food in a stall in Bor South Sudan for five years.

Bol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase  beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 49 years old. She lives in the village of Ilemi, West Georgia. She has a family that includes her husband Murman and her 12-year-old daughter. 

Murman works as a cook in a village restaurant. Maya is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of the income for them. In particular, the family owns two milk cows. Maya produces and sells on average 30 kg of cheese per month. Also, they have 50 hens and sell eggs and chickens. Along with the above-mentioned businesses, the family has a vineyard with 500 vine trees. Murman produces wine and sells it on local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris. 

Maya requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. She will increase production and sales of cheese. It will increase the income of the family by 20%. Maya will use it for purchasing additional household goods in order to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more meat.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda es casada y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa está ubicada en la zona Rió Abajo de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas cultivando flores de toda variedad para posteriormente venderlas en los mercados por cantidad y también a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra  de  semillas mejoradas de rosas, tulipanes y otros,  ya que desea aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Arminda es construir su casa para tener más comodidad.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Arminda is married and has one child of school age. They live in their own home of two rooms with adobe walls and a dirt floor. The house is located in the Rió Abajo area of the city of La Paz.

She currently works more than eight hours growing flowers of all types to sell later at markets for wholesale and she also buys and sells cattle vaccines. 

She needs the loan to buy better rose, tulip, and other flower seeds as she hopes to increase her income and improve her quality of life. Arminda's dream is to build a house for more comfort. This is her second time working with IMPRO and her first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy better rose, tulip, and other flower seeds to offer her customers and to improve her income.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice aged 39 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 7 and 16 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Damai's Group

texts.en:
Damai is the simple lady standing to the right hand side of the photograph.She lives with her husband and two sons in a village of Koraput district,Odisha,India.She is a farmer and cultivates paddy from last 5 years in order to supplement her family's income and provide a better standard of living to her sons.Her husband helps her in the field to harvest the paddy and they lead a very contended life.

Damai along with her group member is requesting for a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase compost and fertilizers to adequately maintain her crop. 

With this,Damai hopes to improve her production and offer a better quality product to her customers. This will allow her to get greater earnings, improving her quality of life and that of her family.

Damai is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers to adequately maintain her crop

loans.name: Radostin

texts.en: Radostin T. lives in Bourgas. He is 40 years old and has graduated a construction specialized school. Several years he has worked in a construction company but this work was not attractive for him so 8 years later he decided to start a business. Radostin has always liked rock music so he found a live performance rock club in Bourgas and named it “Party Club” The bar is situated on the main street of the town and lots of young future rock stars have their first participation on its stage. Radostin T. needs this $ 2 000 loan to make repairs on his bar to prepare it for the winter months.

loans.use: To make repairs on his bar

loans.name: Heydi Jakeline

texts.en:
My name is Haydi Jakeline and I am a merchant, I have a store with clothes, shoes, lotions and other items, which I sell as a traveling saleswoman and also by commission. I have been working in this field for 2 years, which creates an income to cover family expenses and to take care of other obligations. Thanks to this business I can care for my family and tend to my customers, making enough income to improve our standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre es Haydi Jakeline, soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa, calzado, lociones y otros los que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, cuento con 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, gracias a este negocio puedo anatender a mi familia y a mis clientes generando ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: To purchase women's wrist-watches,bracelets, rings, shoes, jeans, men's and women's shirts, lotion and other items.

loans.name: Dante  Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel V. has 20 years of experience making and selling sandals. He inherited his shop from his father and remembers working in the shop as a boy. Over time he had a family of his own and started a business in masonry with the help of his wife and children. Unfortunately, Daniel’s father passed away, and he is now responsible for managing both businesses. Mr. V. reports that he has been able to earn enough to feed, clothe, and educate his family, but he has grander visions for expanding his two businesses. This hard-working entrepreneur opens up shop every day a 8 am and closes at 8 pm.

Daniel is a 38-year-old married man from Guayaquil, Ecuador with three beautiful children. Daniel’s wife mainly takes care of the children and the house, but she does a fair share of the work at “Sandalias Daniel.” Daniel’s goal is to become a large distributor of sandals in Ecuador by consistently expanding his business and advertising his products by word of mouth.

Daniel is looking to take out his second loan with Kiva and Mifex. His operation has grown bigger since he received his first loan. He now has a workshop where he, his wife, and two of his brothers manufacture sandals. His investments in raw materials proved worthwhile, as he was able to increase his production and profits. He has been saving some extra money with the thought of renovating his home, but he has been focused on investing in the business and continuing to expand it. He will continue to buy raw materials and tools for his shop.

loans.use: Invest in raw materials and tools

loans.name: Wanjiru

texts.en: Margrate is married, mother of 4 children who are in school. She is an active member of Kandara moonlight women group. She has a textile shop which is the only source of her income. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. She sews ladies clothes and school uniforms. Margrate would like to buy textiles items to add stock on her clothing shop. She is applying a loan to be able to buy morematerials and repay her loan on monthly basis

loans.use: Margrate would like to buy ready made clothes and textile materials

loans.name: Bertha Alicia Mireya

texts.es:
Bertha is a married mother of three, two sons ages 26 and 25, and a 19-year-old daughter. Her husband works for a local business. His salary couldn't cover household expenses on its own, so four years ago she started selling desserts and pastries to her family, friends and neighbors. Little by little, she was able to keep making advances and now her products are offered at neighborhood shops and offices. She has been able to help her family economically and wants to continue.

Bertha is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase ingredients and cooking utensils to satisfy the increasing for her goods. She plans to repay the loan within six months. Bertha and her family are grateful for your support in helping them grow this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Bertha es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijos, dos hombres de 26 y 25 años respectivamente y una mujer de 19, su esposo es empleado en una empresa, y ella empezó con su negocio por que con el sueldo de su esposo no podían cubrir los gastos del hogar, por eso hace 4 años, ella empezó vendiéndole postres y pasteles a sus vecinos, familiares y amigos y poco a poco comenzó a salir adelante ya pudiendo ofrecer sus productos en negocios cercanos a su domicilio y en algunas oficinas, ella ha podido ayudar en lo económico a su familia y desea continuar con su negocio.

Bertha esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 1,200 para poder comprar materia prima y utensilios para su negocio y así poder cubrir mejor la demanda que tiene de pedidos de sus productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and cooking utensils

loans.name: Euralie Bouh

texts.en: Euralie M. is a 34-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. She lives with her family in Attecoubé, a populated suburb in the northwest of the Abidjan district. Euralie's husband is unemployed. Euralie sells various crop products such as palm grains and fish. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. Euralie's revenues from this business are actually the unique revenue resources of her family. She is very dynamic and an excellent performer. She takes cares of her 3 children, who are all going to school. She joined the AE&I microcredit program 2 years ago and has been able reimburse all her loans in a good manner.

loans.use: Euralie Bouh Makeu will use the loan to purchase stock of palm grains and grilled fish

loans.name: Alternativa 1 Group

texts.es:
Rosa is 38 years old, married, with 5 children. Together with her husband she grows flowers that she sells in San Cristobal and in the flower shops in Tuxtla Gutierrez, who always ask for their products. They hope to buy seeds, liquid fertilizer and insecticide, which will enable them to have a good crop. The other members of the group are artisans who create items such as shawls, napkins, table cloths, and blouses that they sell to the tourists that vist the area, and they are also street vendors to community members who live in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

ROSA TIENE 38 AÑOS , CASADA CON CINCO HIJOS JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA COSECHA DE FLORES LAS CUALES COMERCIALIZAN EN SANCRISTOBAL Y EN LAS FLORERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE TUXTLA GUTIERREZ QUIENES SIEMPRE SOLICITAN SUS PRODUCTOS.ELLOS ESPERAN COMPRAR SEMILLAS , LIQUIDOS FERTILIZANTES E INSECTICIDAS QUE LES PERMITAN UNA BUENA COSECHA . LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SE DEDICAN A LA CONFECCION DE PRENDAS DE ARTESANIA TALES COMO , CHALES , SERVILLETAS, MANTELES, BLUSAS LAS CUALES VENDEN ENTRE LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA Y ALGUNAS VIAJAN A SAN CRISTOBAL Y LAS COMERCIALIZAN EN LAS CALLES COMO VENDEDOR PUBLICOS ENTRE LOS HABITANTES DE LA ZONA

loans.use: They will buy material for their artisan work and flower fertilizer.

loans.name: Netty

texts.en: Netty, 56, is a mother of 3 grown-up children. Her husband, A., is no longer working, so Netty has to support her family by herself. She produces and sells fresh food at her house, earning US$10.5 a day. Netty needs a loan of US$75 to expand her business. As a member of MBK, she promises to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Kamwokya D Group

texts.en:
Ayoa N. is a 35-year-old mother of four children in Kamuli, Uganda. She runs a small pharmacy, while her husband is a teacher. Ayoa hopes to expand her business; with the extra profits, she plans on meeting basic needs, such as home repairs, mandatory school fees for her children, and clothing.

Ayoa has applied for a loan of $1,300 U.S. dollars along with four other women. Ayoa has taken out a loan before and paid it back on time, so she is confident that she will be able to repay this one as well. In this type of group loan, the money is divided among each woman to invest in her own business. They guarantee each other's loans, so that if one woman can't repay it, the others will cover her share. Fidah M. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to expand it, while Lydia A. hopes to buy a fridge for her bar. Asiya N. grows matooke, or green bananas (a popular food stape in Uganda), and wants to buy more supplies to plant more crops. Lastly, Ayoa N. wishes to buy more stock for her food-selling shop.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine for a local pharmacy

loans.name: Ndifakulya West D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Rose is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a forestry guard. She has 4 children ranging from age 3 to 9 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for her children.

Rose is joined in her small group by Lamulati B., Aisha K., Mpenensi N., and Jane T.. Lamulati B. has a business in timber sales and wants to increase inventory. Aisha K. is currently operating a business selling potatoes and wants a loan to re-invest in her business. Mpenensi N. operates a business roasting and selling maize and wants to increase her capital stock. Jane T. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase in bulk.

loans.use: To increase clothing purchases

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
When her husband made the decision to leave the city to work for a well-known business in their country, Yrma decided to begin working in embroidery at her beloved mother's workshop. With eagerness, and with the important help and advice of her dear children, little by little, she has been able to improve her technique and color combinations for her beautiful embroidery. Thanks to this initiative, business has increased, and she has moved her own workshop into her humble abode where her main associates are her two small children. With this loan of $775, she would like to buy cloth and thread for a her shop, to give work to many mothers who, like her, wish to put their efforts toward creating beautiful pieces.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

A raíz de la decisión de su esposo de salir de su ciudad para prestar servicios en una empresa reconocida de su país, Yrma decidió iniciar su labor de bordados en el taller de su querida madre, con mucho ahínco y con la importante ayuda y consejos de sus queridos hijos día a día ha ido mejorando su técnica y combinaciones de colores para sus bellos bordados, gracias a esta iniciativa las solicitudes se han incrementado y se ha mudado a su taller personal en su humilde morada en el que sus mejores socios son sus dos pequeños hijos. Tiene en mente instalar en el una fábrica para dar trabajo a muchas madres que como ella desean plasmar su buen gusto en bellos fustanes.

loans.use: Purchase of large quantity of materials, cloth and thread, for improving embroidery.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman S. has been in the business of tailor since 8 years ago. She gets the job orders from her regular customers and nearby garment businesses which usually gives her orders with big quantity. From this she can help her family financial needs and she can even saves some money for IDR 5,000 - IDR 10,000/ day (Around USD 0.5 - USD 1/ days).

She hopes to get the loan to enable her to buy more cloth/ fabric and thread/ yarn.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman S. sudah menekuni usaha ini sejak 8 tahun yang lalu. Sehari-harinya dia menerima pesanan jahitan dari pelanggannya yang sudah sering menjahit ditempatnya ataupun dari garmen yang memesan dalam jumlah banyak. Dari hasil usaha ini S. dapat membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga sehari-hari dan bisa menyisihkan tabungan sebesar Rp.5.000 – 10.000 per hari. S. mengharapkan diberi pinjaman yang nantinya akan dipakai sebagai modal membeli kain dan benang untuk bahan jahitan.

loans.use: to add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a very enterprising woman who forges her future with her own hands daily. She has watched her family progress, little by little, using her talents in the kitchen to generate a stable income that grants her the opportunity to fulfill the desires of her beloved family. Her husband, on the other hand, is dedicated to selling meat in the market and both desire to improve their work spaces to improve their earnings and as a result the quality of life for their children.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

Julia es una mujer emprendedora que con sus manos forja diariamente su futuro y ha conseguido poco c poco que su familia progrese utilizando el talento que tiene en la cocina para generar un ingreso estable que le otorgue la posibilidad de colaborar con el cumplimiento de los deseos de su amada familia. Su esposo por otro lado se dedica a vender carne en el mercado y ambos están deseosos de mejorar sus espacios de trabajo a fin de incrementar sus ganancias y en consecuencia la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

loans.use: Capital to improve daily work space.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina A., 50, is married with 8 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the village and public people 5 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately $145 USD).  SPBD loans are Lina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will be used for the business.  Her husband also helps out with the business.

loans.use: Fishing canoe, goggles and spears

loans.name: Freedom 2030-5 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Santuke D.. She is currently in the business of selling bread from home and is requesting a loan to expand the business. She is 40 years old and her husband is a businessman. She has three children, ranging from age 9 to 17, who are all in school. Each week, Santuke makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Santuke is joined in her group by Mary A., Rose A., Anite P., and Rose N.. Mary has a business selling local brew and wants to open a bar. Rose operates a business selling bread and wants a loan to expand the business. Anite operates a business of selling beans and rice at the hotel and also wants to expand the business. Rose sells local brew at the bar and is requesting a loan to expand the bar.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Martha Adela

texts.es:
Martha inició el negocio porque deseaba tener un ingreso extra para la familia y de esta forma ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus hijos que estaban estudiando. Comenzó en 1998, cuando un hermano empezó su negocio de gorditas de maíz cerca de la Universidad de la localidad y le fue muy bien, el la animó a que pusiera su propio negocio en otra zona ya que en ese entonces le ayudaba a él en su negocio, lo cual llevó a cabo y le fue muy bien ya que pudo instalar dos puestos en diferentes puntos de la ciudad. Después del crédito anterior que recibió a través de KIVA pudo abrir un tercer puesto de gorditos en su casa, para el cual acondicionó un lugar en el patio y le ha ido muy bien allí.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 5 meses para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de las gorditas de maíz que vende y mantener satisfechos a los clientes que regularmente le compran.
texts.en:
Martha started her business because she wanted to earn extra income for her family and, in doing so, help her husband support their school-age children. She began in 1998 when one of her brothers started a business selling "gorditas de maíz" [corn flour biscuits] near the local university; the business was very successful. As Martha was then helping her brother with his business, he encouraged her to establish her own business in another neighborhood. She did so, and since then it also has been successful, seeing she has established two selling points in different parts of the city. Since receiving her previous loan from Kiva, Martha has been able to open a third "gorditas de maíz" selling point in the specially adapted courtyard of her home. This also has been successful. Martha needs a loan of $575 -- which she will pay back in 5 months -- to purchase basic ingredients for making the "gorditas de maíz" she sells. This will keep her loyal clients happy.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic ingredients

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is a teacher by profession but he owns a phone booth for making calls from which he also sells rechargeable phone cards. He has been in this business for the past three years. Dennis is 41 years old and married with five children. Dennis and his family live in the state of Lagos. Dennis is seeking a loan of 850 USD to buy more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He says thank you!

loans.use: To buy more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en:
Nurali is a divorced man with 4 kids. He and his kids live with his parents. He has been in agrobusiness for many years. He grows wheat and grapes and sells these products at the market. He wants to take a loan for purchasing fertilizers and wheat seeds for the coming season while they are still cheap.

Unfortunately he had gone to the field and so we took a picture of his son selling raisins and brooms at the market.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers, wheat seeds for planting

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 61 años, es soltera y vive sola, ya que no tuvo hijos. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas de forma ambulatoria en su triciclo, en el cual ofrece una cantidad variada de galletas, golosinas, gaseosas, etc. Ella realiza su trabajo desde hace 30 años para poder cubrir sus necesidades económicas, gustándole mucho, ya que es su única fuente de distracción, le agrada interactuar con los niños y la gente que compra sus productos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es el tener que permanecer durante casi todo el día sentada ofreciendo sus golosinas, pero a esto ella ya se ha acostumbrado, viendo más bien las cosas positivas que le trae su trabajo. Este es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para aumentar la venta de su negocio y así poder asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Juana is 61 years old, single, and lives alone since she never had children. She sells candy and snacks from a 3-wheeled cart. She offers a wide variety of cookies, candies, soft drinks, etc. She has been doing this work for thirty years in order to be able to cover her living expenses. She really enjoys it, and it is her only form of entertainment. It makes her very happy to interact with the people who buy from her, especially the children. The hardest part of her work is that she has to stay seated in one place almost all day while she sells her merchandise, but she has gotten used to this and stays focused on all of the positive things that her work brings her. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money, Juana will purchase more candy and snacks to increase sales and thereby enable her to save for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy and snacks to increase sales

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Солиева Малика заёмщица в возросте 39 лет по специальности врач в городской поликлинике Костакоза.Она имеет 3 детей , муж водитель маршрутного такси.Малика очень любит ухаживать за скотом.Каждые три месяца Малика с мужем выводит скот на рынок и продав подороже сразу покупают подешевле.Вот так они и продолжают свой бизнес по откорму скота.Малика подала заявку на 1600 сомони чтоб купить две коровы , т.к. сейчас скот дешевле чем в другие месяца.
texts.en:
The borrower, Malika S., is 39 years old and a doctor at the Kostakoz town medical center. She has three children, and her husband drives a commercial passenger van. Malika really loves caring for cattle. Continuing in their business of fattening cattle, every three months, she and her husband put their cattle up for sale, and immediately afterwards purchase more at a cheaper rate. Malika has applied for a loan of $475 (1600 somoni) in order to buy cattle, which are cheaper now than at other times of the year.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Puits De Jacob Group

texts.en: Gabi provides fresh fish to women to sell at different markets in Kinshasa. He likes this business because it gives him opportunities to know many different women. Gabi started the business in 2005 with a capital of $100. He has worked very hard to increase his profit. His business makes 80% of profit for each sale. He purchases his fish at Kalemie at Tanganyika Lake in Eastern Congo and ships them to his customers in Kinshasa. Gabi would like a loan to buy more fish. He has been Hope’s faithful client since April 2008. Gabi is 28 years old and single. His dream is to make more business travels throughout the world.

loans.use: To purchase more fish in order to generate more profit

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Latifa K. from Mbarali. She is married with 2 children, between the ages of 7 and 13. Latifa has been running a beauty salon since 2007. Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by 1 employee. Latifa currently earns about 300USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 475 USD in order to purchase cosmetics and makeup for her salon. In the future, she plans to to start a new business. Latifa thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and makeup

loans.name: Bihosiyat

texts.en:
O. Bihosiyat has been our client since 2007 when she applied for a business development loan. Bihosiyat lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan but she comes every day to Khujand to trade in the crowded local bazaar “Panjshanbe”. She has been a fruit trader for 12 years. She works directly with a supplier so she can offer lower prices than the bazaar prices. She has repeat customers because she is an honest trader and customers respect her as a person. She finds time to communicate in the common language with customers.

Bihosiyat asks KIVA for a business support loan of 1200 TJS for 4 months to pay for the new fruit importing charge that permits her to increase the business turnover in summer time.

loans.use: To pay for the new fruit importing charge

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos L. tiene 39 años de edad, el es residente de la aldea Caucara, el vive en union libre con su compañera de hogar, con la cual ya procreado 2 hijos 1 de 11 y el otro de 5, los dos estan estudiando en primaria y kinder.
los dos salen adelante con su hogar, ella trabaja en una empacadora de camaron y el se dedica a vender botellones de agua purificada, estos los vende en diferentes aldeas y caserios ya que hasta esos lugares no llegan a vender este tipo de producto.
el necesita el credito para poder comprar mas botellones ya que este producto lo tiene que comprar de contado y los botes son bien caros. 
el desea en un futuro comprar otro carro y asi poder extenderse mas en otros lugares ya que este negocio es muy bueno.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos L. is 39 years old and lives in the village of Caucara. He lives with his significant other, and together they have two children who are 11 and 5 years old. The children are in elementary school and Kindergarten. The couple is able to keep up with their home. She works at a shrimp packing plant, and he sells bottles of purified water. He sells them in several villages and small settlements because no one else offers that type of product in those areas. He needs a loan to buy more bottles of water. He has to buy them with cash and they are very expensive. In the future he wants to buy another vehicle so he can reach more places since this is a very good business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bottles of water

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thảo  32 tuổi, chị  tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996.Thời gian đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, đến năm 2007 gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn để mở cửa hàng  bán bia hơi, nước giải khát. Hiện tại kinh doanh cũnglà công việc đem lại nguồn thu chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
.Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua sắm các loại mặt hàng nước giải khát , tủ bia, tủ lạnh phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 32 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 1996. Initially she borrowed money to raise pigs. In 2007, her family invested money to open a shop selling draught beer and soft drinks. Currently, this is the business that brings the major source of income for her family, at VND4,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 20,000,000 to buy additional soft drinks, beer storage, and refrigerator for her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy additional soft drinks, beer storage, and refrigerator

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, el señor Oscar M. se dedica a laborar con mucho ahínco con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que ha comenzado a mejorarla ya que había estado en malas condiciones desde hace mucho tiempo.

Hoy en día ha adquirido un panel solar porque en su vivienda no se cuenta con energía eléctrica y este panel le permitirá tener acceso a energía y logrará iluminarse y así beneficiar a su familia. Para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para el pago del panel solar y de esta forma salir adelante en su labor.
texts.en:
In the Telica municipality in the city of León, Oscar M. very eagerly works to improve his living conditions. He has started to improve his house, which has been in bad condition for quite some time. He has acquired a solar panel for his house, which does not have electricity. The panel will give him access to energy and allow him to illuminate the house, which will be beneficial to his family. For this reason he has come to Ceprodel to get a loan to pay for the solar panel. This way he can get ahead in his task.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for solar panel

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and a resident of Barangay Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. She is married to Ferdinand P. and blessed with five children. Her two youngest children are still studying in high school and elementary school. She hopes that someday she will be able to send them to college to earn degrees for their future.

Josephine sells AVON and Cooler Life products in her village. She is requesting her second loan for PHP 18,000 to use as additional working capital. She earns her income through commission. She wants to improve her current 25% commission to 30% by purchasing more products from the companies. She hopes to use the extra income to pay for her children to acquire a higher level of education.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
B. Nguyễn THị (708070237) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has three school-aged children.

B. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month.

In 1998, B. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

B. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 12th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Llaque Reyna

texts.es:
La señora LLaque Reyna, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 28 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas  en el patio de su casa donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende diariamente  por las noches  y durante el día combina esta actividad con el servicio de transporte urbano utilizando su motocarro. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos como: arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Reynita,  se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Llaque Reyna belongs to the La Paz II Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 28, married, and has two dependent children. The fighting spirit that has always characterized her and the desire to get ahead by her own means have served her well to set up her own business. She sells meals on the patio of her house. Little by little she has become very well known among her customers. The business is currently going very well for her. She continues with the same business. She sells every evening. During the day she combines this activity with an urban transportation service using her motorcycle cart. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she wants to buy supplies like sacks of rice, eggs, and chickens to make her ‘juanes’, a dish traditionally eaten in the Peruvian rainforest. It’s made from chicken, rice, olives, and eggs and wrapped in a special leaf. She will also buy gutted chicken for her “anticuchos” (kebobs). For herself, she will buy kitchen utensils to offer quality service. Reynita feels peaceful and happy with what she does. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for meal preparation (rice, eggs, chickens)

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has two kids. Currently three of them are in school. Through hard work, Gifty is supporting them in school.

Gifty is a food vendor who has sold kenkey in her neighborhood for the past eight years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kinds of soup and fried fish or meat. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Gifty wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. It is her dream to save more for taking care of the family.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Ngalla Sona

texts.fr: Ngala Sona S. est une mariée de 54ans, mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend des rafraîchissants à domicile et à l’école à proximité de chez elle. Elle prépare aussi et vend le petit déjeuner. Les revenus générés lui permettre de régler ses factures d’électricité et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ngala Sona S. , age 54, is married and the mother of 3 children. She sells berverages at home and in a school near her home. She also prepares breakfast to serve as part of her business. The income generated will enable her to pay her electricity bills and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling berverages and preparing breakfast to serve

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 34 years old. She is married and has one child who is currently in elementary school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in their town. 

She is a trader, selling cassava and cereals such as maize, beans and gari. Georgina buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells these items in the market square in her community. She is a supplier for food vendors and retailers. She has been in this business for eight years and requests a loan to buy goods in bulk. Georgina aspires to expand her business and sponsor her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy cereals in order to fund her child's education

loans.name: Erika Suleima

texts.es: Erika Suleima G. D. F. vive en Chiltiupan en el departamento D. La Libertad.  Erika vive con su madre quien es comerciante y su hermana D. 16 años D. edad estudiante D. básica. Erika tiene tan solo 19 años D. edad, pero ya es una mujer responsable y trabajadora tiene dos años D. haber montado su negocio, una sala D. belleza donD. ofrece varios servicios en cosmetología y también venD. variedad D. productos D. belleza;  en la zona donD. Erika posee su negocio no hay ningún otro D. este rubro por lo tanto Erika tiene una clientela muy estable. El crédito que Erika solicita es para invertir en su negocio con materiales utilizados en su salón y así también surtir D. más variedad su inventario en productos D. belleza.

loans.use: Compra de productos para salón  de belleza

loans.name: Señor Del Milagro Group

texts.es: El grupo " Señor D. Milagros" esta representados por la señora Maria y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales se encuentran comprendidos entre los 20 a 55 años son personas dinámicas y activas como lo han ido demostrando en sus anteriores ciclos. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. distintos productos abarrotes, comida, cosméticos, pan y la presidenta se dedica a la costura D. prendas D. vestir. En cuanto a la competencia las socias saben como controlarla gracias a su experiencia y a su clientela Leal. El destino del crédito es para hacer crecer sus negocios, aumentar su capital, adquirir material para agrandar sus negocios y generar mas ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mayor oportunidad en al vida. Dentro D. la Institución van cursando su Segundo ciclo sin ninguna dificultar demostrando tener ganas para sacar adelante sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familia que es su razón para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The group "Lord of Miracles" is represented by María and composed of 13 members who range from 20 to 55 years in age. These people are dynamic and active, as they have demonstrated during their previous cycles. A majority of the members sell various grocery products including food, cosmetics and bread, and the president is a seamstress. As for the competence of the members, they know how to run things thanks to their experience and loyal clientele. The purpose of the loan is to help their businesses grow, increase their capital, acquire materials to increase the size of their businesses and generate more income in order to give their families better opportunities in life. Within the Institute, they are currently in their second cycle, and they have had no difficulty in demonstrating their desire to move forward with their businesses, since the sustenance of their families depends on it and is their reason to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Florepes

texts.en:
Florepes O. is a new member of ASHI aspiring to bring her family out of poverty by having a strong economic base. She has ten children to raise and nurture, therefore making her aspiration real. She needs a productive role to be able to augment her husband’s income as a farm laborer.

Through the loan Florepes is requesting now, she will be starting up a rice buy-and-sell business. Rice is the most common product of their town; therefore, it would be helpful to the people and to the municipality’s economy if she becomes a means to market it.

The profit she will be making from her business will be used to support the daily needs of her children. She hopes that, someday, she will be able to grow her business and be able to send all of her children to college until graduation.

loans.use: To buy rice for her rice-selling business

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta A. is a 31 year old married woman and a mother of two children, a girl and a boy. She considers herself a family person. She says this is defined by her zeal to keep everyone in the family on their toes to know the importance of determination in life.

Benta runs a charcoal business which she started in the year 2004. Benta would like a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, which she says will go to restocking of her charcoal business in time for the Christmas holidays – peak time sales, as she puts it.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy P. is a villager in Chhrey village in Takeo province. She is 45 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, two of whom are construction workers, and two of whom are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

Savy P. and her husband, Mr. P. Phon, are pig middlemen. Since their business is going well, they want to expand it by purchasing ten more pigs to support their business. They hope to increase their income and improve their family's standard of living with this loan.

loans.use: To buy ten more pigs to support their business

loans.name: Osas

texts.en: Osas is 42 years old and married with five children. She is a focused, hard worker. She sells groceries and cooked foods. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members. She hopes to own a restaurant in the future. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael has a restaurant where he sells cooked foods and drinks. He loves cooking and that is why he commercialized his cooking skills. His clients love his cooked foods and the demand for them is high. Michael is 28 years old and is single without children. He is a LAPO client. He hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders. About LAPO: Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to achieving the goal of economic empowerment of its clients through access to affordable financial services delivered in a cost-effective and innovative manner.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun T., 20, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. She is a garment factory worker and typically makes about US $2 of profit a day, while her husband, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver and makes US $4 every day. This couple has two young children. Chhun T. would like to take out a loan of US $300 as her husband needs to replace an old and unreliable motorbike.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Franz

texts.en: Franz is a self-employed truck driver who was referred by a friend. He drives locally, picking up and delivering empty boxes to leave at train stations. Franz came to ACCION USA for a loan after he incurred an extra household expenses due to his wife's premature labor. This caused a shock to their household financials. He needs a loan to cover some repairs on his truck, which is a 1982 model and needs to be repaired frequently. Franz and his family depend upon his business entirely and this loan will impact his business tremendously. Learn more about Franz in this Spanish language interview: “Franz-- A micro loan recipient at ACCION USA”. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy new tires, drums, brakes, and a radiator for his truck

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao M. (pictured here), 39, and her husband, Mr. Norng Chea, 33, were married in 2000 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school and the other two are still young. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sreymao has been a silk weaver for 15 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a fisherman for 20 years. Sreymao is asking for her first loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, de 47 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa Elizabeth (46) y sus dos jóvenes hijos; Cynthia (21) y Miguel (17).
Desde hace un año se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi en su ciudad, le gusta mucho esta actividad porque interactúa con toda clase de personas, además se distrae bastante. Como su auto es propio obtiene regulares ganancias; su dificultad son las constantes fallas que presenta su auto y muchas veces ha perdido buenos clientes por este motivo. Adicionalmente, vende cervezas en su casa, le va muy bien, ya que no tiene competencia en la zona donde vive. 
Para el futuro, tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles donde pueda también ofrecer sus cervezas.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser muy responsable en el pago de todas sus cuotas, ya que no quiere dejar mal a su grupo. Luis tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en el mantenimiento de su auto, además de comprar llantas nuevas para seguir trabajando sin problemas.
texts.en:
Luis, 47, lives in his own house with his wife, Elizabeth, 46, and their two young children: Cynthia, 21, and Miguel, 17. For the last year he has provided taxi services in the city. He enjoys his work very much because he interacts with all kinds of people; besides, it amuses him. Because he owns his car, he makes regular profits. His obstacles are the constant mechanical problems the car has which have caused him to lose good customers often. In addition, he sells beer from home. He does well in that he has no competition in the area where he lives. For the future, he plans to set up a grocery store where he can also sell his beer. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion because he does not want to disappoint his group. Luis plans to use the funds for vehicle maintenance. He will also buy new tires in order to continue to work problem-free.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle service and maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cocoa

loans.name: Virginia Patricia

texts.es: Virginia Patricia tiene 50 años, está casada, y tiene cuatro hijos. Todos los hijos trabajan respectivamente. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza con Fundación León 2000. Doña Virginia más de 30 años con esta actividad, ella inicio este negocio desde que era muy joven ya que sus padres ejercían esta actividad. Es una persona muy responsable pues aprendió muy bien este oficio que ahora es su medio de trabajo. Es por este motivo que ella decide realizar este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima pues actualmente tiene muchos encargos. Su deseo es tener un taller en su casa de habitación y proporcionar trabajos a las personas que quieran salir adelante.
texts.en:
Virginia Patricia is 50 years old, married, and has four children. All of her children work. This is not the first loan that she has taken from Fundación León 2000. Virginia has been in this line of work for more than 30 years; she started the business when she was very young, since her parents also worked as tailors. She is a person who is very responsible who learned this trade very well, and now it is her medium of work. For this reason she decided to carry out this financing to buy raw materials as she currently has many orders. Her wish is to have a workshop in her home, and provide jobs to people who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy raw materials for tailoring

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the town of Benito Soliven. She is 50 years old. Evelyn is the leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Evelyn is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business that raises livestock, primarily pigs for breeding. Evelyn has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
---------------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Harold Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Mejía A. trabaja como asalariado en INATEC.
El va a utilizar el crédito para cubrir gastos personales ya que tiene enferma a su esposa y necesita comprar medicamentos, además quiere comprar ciertos electrodomésticos que son útiles para su hogar. 

El Sr. Mejía ha tenido 6 créditos con la Institución los cuales han sido cancelados, y a la vez nos dijo que está muy satisfecho con todas las atenciones que se le han hecho por parte de la Institución CEPRODEL, ya que cuando el ha tenido problemas lo han sabido comprender.
texts.en:
Mr. Mejía A. is a salaried worker at INATEC. He will use the loan to cover personal costs as his wife is sick and he needs to buy medicine. Also he wants to buy certain household appliances that will be useful in his home. Mr. Mejía has had 6 loans with this institution all of which have been canceled, he told us that he is very satisfied with the attention the institution CEPRODEL has given to him, and when he has had problems they have been able to understand.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses and to buy household appliances

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed F. is 33 years old and married. He is from Beit Lahya, Gaza.  His family consists of five members, two of whom go to school. 

Raed has a chicken farm that he wants to improve and develop. This loan will provide working capital and allow him to buy some equipment, like fans and heaters, which will help to increase productivity. This in turn will increase Raed’s income and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fans and heaters

loans.name: Ulfat Rani's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat rani is a wife of Y. M. and they live in a city named Borewala, (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small two-roomed house that she has been living in with her family for over 15 years. She is a mother of two sons. Her elder son works in a factory on monthly wage. The younger one is a motor mechanic and works in a motor workshop. Her husband is a driver, by profession. He drives his own vehicle named “Shahzore” which he uses for delivering different item, such as fruits & vegetables, from one place to another. He has been in this profession for the past ten years.  

Ulfat is a caring mother and a caring wife. She stays at home and manages the household work. She also cooks delicious food for her family. 
She has successfully completed her first loan from Asasah. Now she is applying again for a loan for her husband so he can repair his vehicle and it will be in working condition.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle named "Shahzore".

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita D. is from the village of Brgy. Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 29 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised pigs.

In 2009, Rita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr: Monsieur Demba D. est reporter, photographe et cameraman depuis longtemps. Il est marié et est âgé de 43 ans. Il compte sur ce business pour gérer sa famille et est trés connu dans sa ville où il compte de nombreux clients. Il sollicitait un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour continuer des travaux de construction de bâtiment entamés, il y'a longtemps.
texts.en:
Mister Demba D. has been a reporter, photographer and cameraman for a long time. He is married and 43 years old. He relies on this business activity to support his family and is well known in his town where he has many customers. He has requested a loan of 150,000 CFA francs to continue construction work launched long ago.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction work

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma J. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Norma is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Norma operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including different varieties of fish and shrimp, in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ayde Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; La  socia vive en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Ayde; ella tiene 31 años de edad y La socia es natural de San Jerónimo,  ella es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,  vive con su pareja su hijo y sus padres, ella es docente de profesión y su conyugue es obrero, maestro de obras, La socia desea poder mejorar su casa y comprar algunos artefactos, ella está pensando en priorizar en algunos que le hagan falta de inmediato, ella comprará tal vez, una lavadora o una nueva cocina. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar un artefacto está pensando entre una nueva cocina o una lavadora.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite mejorar su calidad de vida, ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
