She will buy groceries to stock up her store, but will also buy scales, display boards and construction materials to improve the store itself. Cira Cecilia dreams of expanding her store and of growing as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock and construction materials.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 42 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace más de 15 años se dedica a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, empezó a dedicarse a esta actividad por medio de haber obtenido en herencia los terrenos de sus padres y por de los padres de su esposa. Desde ese entonces, labran la tierra incansablemente año tras año, de acuerdo al calendario de la siembra y la cosecha. Paralelamente a esto, Lorenzo se dedica a la ganadería, ya que tiene 4 vacas en su establo, de ellas extrae la leche para su consumo propio y para venta. Para Lorenzo y su familia dedicarse a las tareas agrícolas es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen porque no solo les genera recursos económicos, sino que también les provee de alimentos básicos para su hogar. Es la segunda vez que Lorenzo está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y es de su agrado trabajar con sus propios vecinos, los cuales forman parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora requiere lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizante para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 42, lives with his wife and 4 children in his own home. For more than 15 years he has been working in agriculture and with livestock. He got started in this work because he inherited some land from his parents and from his wife’s parents. From then on they have been working the land tirelessly year after year as they follow the schedule for planting and harvesting. Along with this, Lorenzo has livestock. He has 4 cows in his stable. He milks them for his family’s use, and he sells the rest of the milk. The agricultural work is the only source of income for Lorenzo and his family. This work not only generates economic resources, but it also provides them with basic foods for their home. This is the second time that Lorenza has asked for a loan with MFP. It is his pleasure to work with his neighbors who form part of his community bank. He will use the loan to buy bags of fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria C. B. ella es Originaria de la Comunidad de Juchanep actualmete ellas de dedica a la confeccion de playeras, Blusas y otros y la cual los entraga en diferentes puntos de ventas, la cual nesecita hoy en dia de un credito para poder compra algunas piezas de las maquinas y telas para poder producir un poco mas y con la idea de buscar otros nuevos mercados con el objetivo de mejor el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maria C. B. is originally from the community of Juchanep. She currently makes T-shirts, blouses and other items, which she delivers to different retail locations. Now she needs a loan to purchase machine parts and materials to increase her production. She is looking to find new markets in order to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
The man in the picture above is Mr. Sam C.. He is 32 years old and has been selected as the group leader by the other four women in the group loan. Sam C. generates his daily income by driving a motor taxi, and earns around $2 per day. He uses the profit to manage his family's daily expenses. He is married with two teenage children, who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is a staff member at a restaurant in Siem Reap province. He has been trying to build his house since past few months, but the construction has been halted due to lack of money. Therefore, Sam C. has decided to seek a loan to complete his house construction. 

There are other four borrowers in the group loan: Mrs. P. is a grocery seller seeking a loan to buy more items to sell. Mrs. P. is a fish catcher who is asking a loan to purchase more tools for fishing. Mrs. E. is applying for a loan to expand her grocery item selling business. Mrs. L. is involved in fishing at Tunle Sap Lake; she requests a loan to buy a boat for fishing. All the borrowers live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To complete house construction

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid is 43-year-old married man with three children, living in Keter Maya, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a car service and maintenance shop since 2003. Today, Walid is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es:
El señor Baltazar vive con su esposa la señora Cristina y un pequeñín. 
El labora para el tribunal de justicia como jefe de oficiaría de partes desde hace 9 años. 
Y su esposa la señora Cristina es coordinadora de guarderías en el Instituto Medico, mas reconocido del país, donde tiene una antigüedad y experiencia de 28 años. 
Son una familia muy estable económicamente, pero sobretodo se apoyan mutuamente y están muy consolidados. 
Por el momento están tramitando este crédito ya que como están construyendo el segundo piso en su casa, todos los gastos de construcción los han realizando en efectivo, 
Pero les esta haciendo falta la colocación del techo de madera, motivo para esta solicitud.
texts.en:
Señor Baltazar lives with his wife, Señora Cristina, and their little one.

He works for the judicial court as head officiate and has been for nine years. His wife, Señora Cristina, is the daycare coordinator at the most well-recognized Medical Institute in the country, where she has seniority and 28 years of experience.

They are a very economically stable family, but above all they support each other mutually and are very strong.

For the moment, they are arranging this loan because they are constructing the second floor of their home. All the construction costs they have paid with cash, but they still need to lay the wooden roof, which is their reason for this request.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a wooden roof on the second floor of their home

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: El señor Jose Carlos tiene la edad de 55 años, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casado y con  cinco hijos de 14, 17,19, 21, 25 dos  de ellos  trabajan y los otros estudian.  Su negocio es la venta de ropa, electrodomésticos  y productos plásticos, que desde hace diesiciete años vende, el cual comenzó con ahorros y  liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Con este crédito va a comprar ropa, y electrodoméstico para ofertar a sus clientes. Sus planes es poder aumentar inventario para tener mejores utilidades y poder apoyar a sus hijos con la universidad que es muy costosa, es por eso su empeño de trabajar y vender. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo de los préstamos ya que este es su décimo crédito y se ha beneficiado para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Jose Carlos is 55 years old. He lives in the neighbourhood called Villa Reconciliación. He is married and has 5 children, of 14, 17, 19, 21, and 25 years of age. Two of them are working, and the others are studying. His business is the sale of clothing, domestic electronics, and plastic products. He has sold these things since he was 17 years old, when he began with his savings and by liquidating his previous business. With this loan, he wants to buy clothing and domestic electronics to offer to his clients. His plans are to increase his inventory in order to be of greater use and to be able to help his children with university, which is very expensive. This is why he began working in sales. Thanks to the institution for the help with the loans, this is already his tenth loan and he has benefited by investing in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and domestic electronics

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
Emelina S. hails from the town of Jala-jala, Rizal province, in  the Philippines. She is determined to break down  the wall of poverty that stands between her family and success. She is 44 years old and mother of two sons.  Emelina is married to Guillermo, who is 47 years old.

In 1999, Emelina joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc., an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines), hoping to have access to capital for her fishing business. The business appeared sound and worthy of being continued. Now on her fifth loan, Emelina is seeking 25,000 pesos to pay for bundles of nets and payments for labor to prepare fishing gear.

She is hopeful that with the opportunity given by ASHI and KIVA, she can bring her family out of poverty. She dreams of building her own house, sending her children to college and to find jobs, so that her children do not experience the same life that she has.

loans.use: To pay for bundles of nets and payments for labor ito prepare fishing gear.

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: Edith est née vers 1977 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Edith est mariée à Amorin, mécanicien-moto de formation et vendeur des postes récepteurs. Edith et Amorin ont un seul enfant et il est scolarisé. Edith a été à l’école mais elle s’est arrêtée au cours primaire. Ensemble avec son mari, Edith supporte les charges de la famille. C’est des condiments de cuisine que Edith vend ainsi que des sachets d’emballage mais comme activité secondaire.  Edith achète ses produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C’est à son domicile que Edith vend les condiments ; les sachets, Edith les vend de façon ambulante. C’est depuis six ans que Edith est dans ces deux activités. Edith est à son quatrième crédit avec ALIDé et a toujours bien remboursé ses crédits. Les activités d’Edith connaissent plus ou moins d’évolution mais toujours est-il qu’elle rencontre la mévente de temps à autre. Edith souhaite bénéficier de l’appui financier d’ALIDé pour agrandir ses activités et les diversifier à la vente de fournitures scolaires.
texts.en:
Edith was born around 1977 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to Amorin, a motorbike mechanic by training and a seller of radio receivers. Edith and Amorin have one son, who attends school. She attended school, but she stopped in primary school. Together with her husband, she is meeting family expenses. Sauce condiments are what she sells, as well as baggies for packaging, as her secondary business. She buys her goods in Dantokpa, the international grand marketplace of Bénin. She sells the condiments out of her house; the baggies are sold door-to-door. She has been in these two businesses for six years. Edith is on her fourth loan with ALIDé and has always repaid her loans. Her businesses are more or less improving. Yet it’s true she experiences a loss in sales from time to time. She wishes to benefit from financial support from ALIDé in order to expand her businesses and to diversify them by selling school supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags for packaging and school supplies

loans.name: Diene

texts.fr: Diene N.   est horticulteur  fleuriste  il est âge 27 ans  marié et père de deux (2) enfants  .Sans formation professionnelle il a su se faire un nom dans le domaine du jardinage  par l’aménagement des maisons et de espaces publiques  dans la zone touristique de saly située à 80km de Dakar la capital sénégalaise. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille. Avec le prêt il compte acheter de nouvelles plantes ornementales pour préparer les fêtes de fin d’année.

loans.use: ACHAT DE MARCHANDISE

loans.name: Alan Víctor

texts.es:
Alan tiene 24 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 2 años de edad en casa de sus padres, a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Santa Rosa.
 
La necesidad de trabajar por su familia le ha llevado a crear un pequeño negocio de venta ambulante de pescado, usualmente trabajaba durante la noche como ayudante en una panaderia de la zona y desde hace seis meses también trabaja vendiendo pescado fresco en los pueblos del distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 10 minutos del lugar en donde vive.
 
El va muy temprano al terminal pesquero del lugar a comprar pescado de tres a cuatro veces por semana, luego viaja hacia Monsefú y vende su mercadería, llega a su casa por la tarde, descansa y después va a la panadería a trabajar; los ingresos generados por estas actividades le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia y también para apoyar a sus padres.
 
Alan desea juntar el dinero suficiente para crear su propia panadería, ya que disfruta mucho de esta actividad y dado el tiempo en que estuvo trabajando ha aprendido ya todo respecto a este oficio, pero es consciente de que debe seguir vendiendo pescado para continuar ahorrando su dinero, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 900 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para mantener su negocio.
 
Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno y construir su casa, Alan es muy conocido y respetado por sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo que lo consideran un joven cariamático, responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Alan is 24 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year old daughter in his parents’ house, located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo in the Santa Rosa district. The need to work to support his family led him to start a small business selling fresh fish on foot. He usually works at night as an assistant in a bakery in the area. For the past six months, he has also been working selling fish in the towns located in the Monsefú district, which is ten minutes from where he lives. He goes very early to the docks to buy his fish, and then travels to Monsefú to sell his product. He arrives home in the afternoon, rests, and then goes to the bakery to work. The income he generates through these activities helps him get ahead in supporting his family and his parents. Alan wants to gather enough funds to start his own bakery, since he very much enjoys this activity and has been learning the trade for some time. However, he is conscious that he must continue selling fish in order to save money. For this reason, he is approaching Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 900 soles. He thinks he will invest these funds into the purchase of more merchandise to strengthen his enterprise. His dream is to buy some land on which to build his own house. Alan is well-known and respected by his neighbors and workmates, who consider him a charismatic, responsible and hard-working young man.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Besilia

texts.en:
Besilia is from the village of Calamagui San Pablo, Isabela. She is married to Romeo, a mechanic in their village and they have six children. Their youngest is already 16 years old and still studying. Besilia is hoping that their youngest will finish her study since her five children did not finish their studies.  

Besilia is helping to maintain their vulcanizing shop business.  Aside from that, she also manages a hog raising business for extra income.  For them to pursue their two businesses, she is now asking for a loan from the KIVA lenders of PHP 7,000.  With this amount, they will have the support needed for their business.

loans.use: Additional capital for their vulcanizing shop business

loans.name: Ismael Mohammed

texts.en:
Ismael is 36 years-old and is married. His electronic business is located at Likuyani market in Likuyani area, Eldoret. He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a business partner. With the loan Ismael intends to add electronic products to his shop such as cables. His future dreams is to open a big electronic shop and to be able to manage his family well.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy electronic goods.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra H. lives in Russey Srouk village in Takeo province. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children who attend the local school. She is a Khmer cake seller.

Her husband, Mr. Chey Kakada, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a pig breeder. Since his pig breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it.

In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Ra H. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase three more piglets and a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family’s living with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Bramwel

texts.en:
Bramwel is a 40-year-old father of six children, three of whom are attending school.

Bramwel has a retail shop, selling mattresses and cushions. He's been in business since 2007 and employs two people. He previously worked at a foam mattress company. He describes himself as ambitious and says he would like to build a better life by working hard and expanding his business.

Bramwel has successfully completed one loan of Kes 20,000 through Faulu. This loan is for Kes 40,000 and he will use the funds to open a similar business in two different new locations.

loans.use: To open in two new locations

loans.name: Nkiru

texts.en: Nkiru is 35 years old, married with 5 children. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist and he also supports the household. She sells firewood at retail prices to her customers. Her greatest joy in her business is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more firewood to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna D. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Rosanna is single and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosanna owns & operates a business buying and selling coconut in the local community. Rosanna has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosanna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosanna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosanna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosanna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El señor Oscar Danilo M. S., tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y su esposa trabaja como camerciante asi mismo le apoya en la agricultura y de esos ingresos aporta a los gastos de la casa, ellos tienen 2 hijos y es por ellos que la familia M. desea trabajar ardudamente para poder ofrecerles mejores condiciones en su vivienda, ellos se dedican al cultivo de la piña y por este trabajo desean invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y fungicidas que aseguren un mejor cuido a los cultivos, esto les traeria grandes beneficios debido a que podran vender la cosecha de forma rapida y podran recuperar lo invertido, este proceso les traera beneficios y podran planificar a un corto tiempo la reconstruccion de su hogar y poder ofrecerles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo M. S. is 32 years old and married. His wife works as a storekeeper as well as helping him with farming and these incomes take care of the living expenses. They have two children and it is for them that the M. family wishes to work hard so that they can provide them with better housing conditions. They grow pineapple and it is for this work they wish to invest in fertilizers and fungicides that will allow them to provide better care to the crop. This will bring them big profits due to the fact that they will be able to sell the crop quickly and will be able to recover the investment. This process will bring them profits and they will be able to plan in a short period of time the rebuilding of their home and be able to provide their children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricutural material for the care of the crop

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong N., 47, and her husband, Mr. Nhaun Kheav, 48, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, They were married in 1983 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. The oldest son works in a garment factory and the others attend school.

Kong has been selling vegetables and meat for more than six years; she buys it from Phnom Penh for resale in the village. Her husband has been a construction worker for more than ten years. Besides the business, he is also a motorbike taxi driver. Kong is requesting a loan of $1,200 to repair the motorbike. She will also use part of her loan to buy more vegetables and meat for resale.

loans.use: To repair a motorbike and to buy vegetables and meat for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Gladys es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Gladys tiene cabinas de Internet, negocio que esta ubicado en la casa de su mama, además vende golosinas, recargas telefónicas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermano.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mas maquinas.
Los sueños de Gladys son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Gladys is member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which in Quechua means "harvest." She lives with her partner, is 27 years old, and has one son. Gladys owns an Internet booth or cybercafé, which is located at her mother's house. She also sells candy and phone cards with her brother's help. Gladys needs a loan of PEN 1,500, which she will use to buy more computers. Gladys' dream is to buy a car and land to build herself a house.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying computers for her cybercafé.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying millet and soy beans

loans.name: Isabel Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 56 años y  vive con una de sus hijas en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 7 años, se dedica a la venta de comida que prepara en su casa, por las mañanas adquiere los ingredientes frescos y durante la tarde, luego de cocinar, sale a vender sus comidas ya que sus clientes son los comerciantes de la  localidad donde vive. Su negocio de venta de comida es muy rentable ya que el pago es  al contado y sus ganancias se ven reflejadas  a diario, además durante los fines de semana  prepara diferentes platos típicos de su región y los vende en la carpa que arma en la puerta de su casa. Para el futuro planea instalar  un local o cafetín en una escuela para  preparar mayores cantidades de comida.Es el 17ava vez  que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al préstamo que le permitirá continuar progresando.El dinero que Gloria solicita lo invertirá en  la compra, al por mayor, de ingredientes como sacos de quinua, azúcar, además de vasos descartables, para abastecerse bien y seguir trabajando sin problemas.
texts.en:
Gloria ia 56, and she lives with one of her daughters in her own house. For seven years she has been selling food that she prepares in her house. She gets fresh ingredients in the mornings, and after cooking she leaves to sell her food in the afternoon. Her customers are the merchants in the area where she lives. Her business of selling food is very profitable because she is paid in cash and she gets daily earnings. Also, on the week ends she makes different dishes that are typical of her region. She sells them in the tent that is set up at the door to her house. In the future she plans to set up a place or a small cafe in a school in order to make greater quantities of food. This is her 17th loan with MFP. She is very grateful to all of the people who make it possible for her to get a loan that will allow her to continue progressing. Gloria will use the money she is requesting to buy wholesale ingredients like sacks of quinoa, sugar, and disposable glasses. She will do this to be well stocked and to keep working without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients wholesale in order to stock her business

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
"Brigida S. is a 58 year-old woman living in the town of Brgy II Siaton, Negros Oriental.  She is married and has 7 adult children.  To making a living, Brigida owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Brigida has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 Php a month.

Brigida joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Brigida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19500 Php from NWTF. Brigida is now requesting a new loan of 19500 Php to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be her 7th from NWTF.  Brigida plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.
------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon."

loans.use: Purchase additoonal products to sell.

loans.name: Johany Jackely

texts.es:
Johany tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de La Unión, perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la crianza y venta de aves de corral: ella cría patos, gallinas y pavos en la parte posterior de su vivienda para venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona y a sus vecinos. Este negocio le brinda ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

Johany siempre da lo mejor de si para mejorar la calidad de sus animales de modo que estos tengan buena acogida y pueda percibir mayores ganancias, por ello piensa ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas aves de corral así como de alimento balanceado de modo que su desarrollo se acelere y pueda lograr su objetivo rápidamente. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera ves a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Johany es una joven responsable y con grandes planes para el futuro, ella sueña con seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder instalar una granja. Sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una joven trabajadora y que siempre ayuda cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Johany is 21, single, and lives with her parents. They live in the La Unión district, which belongs to the Piura province in the region of the same name. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For one year she has been raising and selling poultry. She raises ducks, hens, and turkeys in the back of her house. She sells them to the business people who visit her area and to her neighbors. This business provides income to pay her personal expenses and to help with the household economy. Johany always gives the best of herself to improve the quality of her animals. She does this so that they will be well received and she will be able to get greater earnings. She plans on expanding her business by purchasing more poultry. She will also buy balanced feed to speed up their growth and achieve her objective quickly. That is why she is requesting, for the first time, a loan for 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Johany is a responsible young woman who has big plans for the future. She dreams of continuing to grow as a businesswoman and being able to set up a farm. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high esteem. They consider her to be a hard-working young woman who always helps when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry and balanced feed to expand her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen R. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old. Helen is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she is currently engaged in a business where she buys bananas from the neighboring village and then sells them in the city. Helen has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $105 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. 

Helen is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more bananas to sell. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina. a married mother of two grown children, works at a small market in Zaporozhye, selling clothing and bed shirts, a successful business she has operated for 10 years. Valentina enjoys it very much, her kindness, experience and openness attracting many clients to her kiosk. She would now like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase her assortment of bed shirts, hoping to earn additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of bed shirts

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sophorn P. lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is 39 years old and works as a farming laborer to earn a little income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Hun Thoeurn Yos, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he grows crops to sell. Unfortunately, her husband’s field is infertile and it has a lot of insects. To improve production, Mrs. Sophorn P. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the others are enrolled in local public school.  Her husband is pictured in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growth of cultivatable surface and purchase of grain

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn N. is a 37-year-old mother of three. She raises pigs and grows rice as part of her daily routine. Besides the profit earned from her farming, she relies on her husband's business of climbing palm trees, and fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. The family includes three children, and one of them is enrolled in primary school. 

The coming rainfall is good for growing, however, Thorn N. requires additional capital to use on her farm. So, Thorn N. is requesting a loan to use towards planting rice crops.

loans.use: To use towards planting rice crops.

loans.name: Justino

texts.es: El Señor Justino tiene un taller de costura, desde hace seis años, trabaja junto con su esposa, actividad donde confeccionan poleras, chamarras, deportivos, actividad donde les va muy bien le realizan pedidos y también su esposa entrega a los distintos puestos de venta del mercado de la ciudad, este crédito es para la compra de telas e hilos, tiene un pedido de  poleras para un sindicato. Tiene casa propia, tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, es su primer crédito con emprender, el señor es garante de un cliente antiguo, según referencias indican que es responsable y muy trabajador, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Justino has had a tailor shop for the past six years. He works alongside his wife. They make jackets, t-shirts and athletic wear. They do well in that they get orders to fill and his wife also distributes product among various market stalls in the city. The loan will be used to buy fabric and thread because he has a pending order for t-shirts for a labor union. He owns his own house and has three school aged children. This is his first loan with Emprender. He acted as guarantor for a long-standing client and, according to his references, is responsible and very hard working. He is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him upon granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To carry out home improvements.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em N., 63, lives in Kouk Roka village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhorm Chhay, are farmers who own a four-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Their field's soil is infertile and has a lot of insects. To improve rice production, Mrs. Em N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline. She is the mother of two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Rosa viaja los días sábados y domingos a la feria del Distrito de Tambo en donde vende frutas, canchas y de allá compra cereales que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Rosa tenia una tienda de lubricantes en local alquilado, negocio que dejo de realizar porque termino el contrato de local, pero aun sigue vendiendo sus productos a pedido, Rosa tiene proyectado construir un local propio para vender sus productos. Rosa solicita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de maíz y frutas.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and has 4 children. On Saturdays and Sundays she goes to the Tambo District market to sell fruit and corn nuts (roasted corn kernels). From there she brings back cereals to sell in Ayacucho’s wholesale foodstuffs market. Rosa used to have a vehicle lubricants store in a rented space but she left it when her rental contract for the location expired. However, she continues to sell these products by special order. Rosa plans to build her own structure to sell her products. She needs a 900 sol loan to buy corn and fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and fruit.

loans.name: Lorena Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Lorena esta en su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado por las facilidades que le han dado para obtener  los créditos. Tiene 27 años y esta casada hace 8 años, de  esta  relación tiene 3 hijos todos son menores de edad, los dos mayores  están estudiando en la escuela.
 
Ella junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, trabajan desde la madrugada hasta la tarde, ella vende en su casa ya que tiene un pequeño puesto y su esposo recorre la ciudad de Manta en un triciclo los martes jueves y viernes, ella dice que antes acompañaba a su esposo en sus recorridos pero ahora que sus hijos están en la escuela no puede porque tiene que ayudarlos y cuidarlos, los productos los compran en Portoviejo, porque allá se consiguen más baratos.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas verduras y otros productos para su negocio y el de su esposo.

Sus sueños son terminar su casa y poner una tienda.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Maria Auxiliadora meets at the Sequita church parrish part of Montecristi a prosperous Manabí canton full of hard-working dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parrish whose members are honest and all they know is work and family. Lorena is in her fifth term with the communal bank and she has enjoyed it due to the ease of obtaining her loans. She is 27 years old and has been married for 8 years, a marriage that produced 3 children. All her children are minors and the two eldest are in school. She and her husband own a business selling fruits and vegetables and they work from sunrise until dusk. She sells from home where she has a small stand and her husband sells all throughout the city of Manta on a tricycle every Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday. She states that she used to accompany her husband on these runs but can't now that her kids are in school because she has to help them and look after them. They purchase their produce in Portoviejo because they are cheaper there. She will use this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables and other products for their business. Her dream is to finish her home and set up a store.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oranges, bananas, papayas, mandarines, tomatoes, ettuce, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie Z. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 24 years old. Eddie is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Eddie catches and sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Eddie has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Eddie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eddie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment and tools for boat maintenance. Eddie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tools for boat maintenance and for working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Eddie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools for boat maintenance and for working capital

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel tiene 22 años, tiene 1 hijo. La ubicación del negocio es de manera ambulante ya que recorre las calles para ofrecer sus productos. La actividad económica de ella es la venta de artesanía hace más de 6 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, ya que surgió porque a Maria es una mujer que le gusta trabajar fuertemente y es así como decide vender estos productos. Ella es una mujer humilde que disfruta de hablar con sus clientes y de ofrecerles buena calidad en productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar los materiales necesarios en sus productos y en comprar mayor cantidad. Los sueños de Doña Maria son de establecerse en su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 22 years old, and has one son. Her work is selling handicrafts, which has been her business for more than 6 years. She walks around the streets to offer her wares. She has been successful at it because she is a woman who enjoys working hard and decided to sell her products this way. she is a humble woman who enjoys talking to her customers and offering them good quality products. The loan she is seeking is to buy the materials needed in her products, and to buy them in bulk. Maria's dream is to establish a home for herself.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Katikko Small-Scale Farmers Association-Mityana Group

texts.en: 48-year-old K. George has had his fish-selling business in Katikko landing site-Mityana for 12 years. Previously this married father of 12 operated a retail shop. George, who belongs to the Katikko small-scale farmers group, says success has always been within his grasp given the dedication he puts into his work. George has an amiable disposition and that has endeared him to many of his customers. George also ekes out side profits from agriculture, poultry, pig husbandry and cattle. His weekly profits are about 60,000 shillings. George says that with this loan, he is looking forward to purchasing nets and a boat. He envisages better prospects for his business.

loans.use: The purchase of fish nets and a boat to improve his business.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 35 years old and is married with four children. He does dairy farming in Kiambu. To earn extra income, James is employed as a matatu (public service vehicle) driver in Kiambu. He is hardworking and God fearing and hopes to be self-employed in the future. In five years, James plans to be a prosperous dairy farmer. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow to add to his already existing livestock.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en: San K. is 50 years old and lives with her parents.  She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land where she cultivates rice and different vegetables for a living. However,she does not have some needed farming supplies. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline. There are twenty one members in this village loan group. They are located in Trabaek Pok village in Kandal province. This village loan group selected San K. as the village bank president. Each member of this village will use their portion of the loan to support different purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita L. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Cristita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling a variety of viands like fried fish and chicken adobo in the local community. Cristita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cristita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cristita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Liz Ayde

texts.es: Liz Huamán tiene 29 años de edad vive en el distrito de Lurigancho Chosica, ella se dedica a la realización de eventos sociales  y a su  vez estudia en la universidad educación primaria, el cual decide estudiar ya que a los 18 años comenzó trabajando de auxiliar de educación en un pequeño colegio cerca a su casa, de ahí emprende este desafío  por la educación, el cual es una carrera que la apasiona y la llena de alegría. En el futuro el gustaría culminar con sus estudios  y poder tener su propia escuela. Con el presente préstamo lo invertirá en los pagos de sus estudios ya que recién va cursando el cuarto año de estudios. Liz Huamán es una mujer con mucha iniciativa y con grandes proyectos  a futuro y tiene una dedicación especial con los niños que son el motivo de sus estudios.
texts.en: Liz Huamán is 29 years old and lives in the district of Lurigancho Chosica.  She works organizing social events and studies elementary education at the university as well.  She decided to study this because when she was 18, she began working as a teaching assistant at a small school near her house.  There, she undertook the challenge of education, a career which she is passionate about and fills her with joy.  In the future, she would like to finish her studies and be able to have her own school.  She will invest this current loan in her school payments because he is just starting her fourth year of college.  Liz Huamán is a woman with a lot of initiative and has big plans for the future.  She has a special dedication for children who are the reason for her studies.

loans.use: For her monthly university payment

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson, a member of Highrise Star group in Faulu Kenya, saves his money on a weekly basis and can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya because the group members guarantee each other's loans.  He joined the group as an entrepreneur who runs a retail shop and distributes bread.  Wilson opened his retail shop eight years ago and hopes to expand it into wholesale in the future.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to add a stock of cereals to his shop.

loans.use: To add stock of cereals

loans.name: Agripina Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Agripina Maritza; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de bisutería, ella vende aretes y collares en forma ambulatoria y también trabaja como cocinera  en un restaurant turístico, ella vende la bisutería en las mañanas desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de bisutería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artes y collares al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "El Molinito II". The bank is located in the Cusco district, which is in the province and department of Cusco.
The member's name is Agripina. She is 24 years old and single. She alternates her household work with a business selling costume jewelry. She sells earrings and necklaces in the street and also works as a cook in a tourist restaurant. She sells jewelry during the day, from 7:00am until 3:00pm. She wants to expand and improve her jewlery business so she is requesting a loan to buy necklaces and earrings in bulk. 
The member is happy to have the loan and promises to abide by the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy earrings and necklaces in bulk.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A. is from the village of Samay, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Lourdes is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & toothpaste in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods & junk foods.

loans.name: Ivania Francisca

texts.es:
IVANIA FRANCISCA B. M., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA COMO SECRETARIA EJECUTIVA, TIENE TRES HIJOS Y ESTOS YA NO DEPENDEN DE ELLA.
DOÑA IVANIA ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, BLOQUES PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN MURO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION Y QUE SU FAMILIA CUENTE CON MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIVIENDA.
AGRADECE A CEPRODEL POR EL FINANCIAMIENTO YA QUE ESTE A YUDAR A QUE MI CASITA ESTE MEJOR.
texts.en:
Ivania Francisca B. M. is from Managua. She is employed as an executive secretary. She has three children but they no longer depend on her. 

Ivania has approached the offices of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) to request a loan to improve her house. She will invest in the purchase of materials such as cement, sand, and construction blocks to build a wall in her house. 

These home improvements are to provide her family with better living conditions.

She is thankful to Ceprodel for the loan because it will improve her little house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier tiene 32 años, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte de taxi. Hace más de 5 años, que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio con esfuerzos propios, por lo que tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, el se encarga de proporcionarle lo más necesario a toda su familia. Pues sus inicios fueron muy duros ya algunas veces como no tenía el capital suficiente su automóvil no presentaba las condiciones necesarias. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de llantas, batería entre otros artículos. El sueña con tener otro vehículo que presente mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Francisco Javier is 32 years old, and his activity is to offer taxi services. He has been engaging in this activity for more than 5 years; he started it by his own means as he has 1 child whom he is responsible for, and he takes care of providing his family with what they need the most. At the beginning it was very hard for him, as sometimes, not having enough money, he could not keep his car in the ideal conditions to work. This is why he is requesting a loan: he will use it to increase his working capital and to buy tires and a battery among other items. He dreams of owing another vehicle in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy tires, a battery and other items for his car.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, de 45 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Miguel, esta casada con Efraín de 49 años de edad y tienen 03 hijos; juntos viven en su casa propia en la comunidad situado en el distrito de Santa Rosa. Con mucho esfuerzo Blanca y su esposo han logrado remover sus tierras para volverlas muy productivas; ella es agricultora se dedica a cultivar plantas de cacao, café y hojas de coca; que son productos sostenibles para su economía. En tiempos de cosecha tiene que contratar jornaleros para extraer con rapidez los frutos de las plantas. Viene trabajando 21 años en la agricultura y es siempre ha demostrado responsabilidad y dedicación con su trabajo. Lo que más le gusta es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que depende de eso el ingreso de su economía; considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por cada producto. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos de cacao y café, por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará  semillas de cacao y café. Este su octavo crédito de con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro crédito con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café.
texts.en: Blanca is 45 years old and is a native of the District of San Miguel.  She is married to Efraín who is 49 and they have three children.  They live together in a house that they own in a community located in the District of Santa Rosa.  Through a great deal of effort, Blanca and her husband have been able to turn over their lands to make them very productive.  She is a farmer and works growing cacao plants, coffee and coca leaves, all of which support her income.  During the harvest, she has to hire laborers to quickly pick the fruits from the plants.  She has been working in agriculture for 21 years and has always proven to be responsible and dedicated to her work.  What she likes most is caring for her crops, as her income depends on this.  She considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products from the farm to the city of San Francisco, where they pay her more for each product.  In the future, she wants to buy new land to increase her cacao and coffee crops which is why she will purchase cacao and coffee seeds with the loan requested.  This is her eighth loan with MFP and she knows that if she makes her payments on time, she will be able to obtain another loan more easily and without causing problems to her communal bank.  With the 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will buy cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Sari Kencana Group

texts.en:
Jro  Nyoman T. and all members of this group agreed to continue borrowing from MUK. Because Jro  Nyoman T. already has a local type of Bali sow,  this time her loan will be used to buy a superior piglet species with a price of Rp.350,000 per pig, which will be maintained for six months. She will buy 2 piglets.

Her husband, I Gusti Ketut Raka, strongly supports the work done by his wife, because it can help the family income.

 She has a hope that the business of pigs that has been undertaken will increase profitably. She also has a  dream that her children can continue their schooling to a higher level and have a better future.

loans.use: To buy  superior piglets.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is 37 years old and is married, with two children.  He has been a mechanic for thirteen years.  He has grown his business with the loans from Faulu Kenya.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has also developed a saving culture.  Besides being a mechanic, he also sells spare parts so as to boost his income.  He hopes to expand his business within five years and employ more people.  He wants 40,000 Kes to buy copper wires, parts, and auto bearings.

loans.use: to buy copper wires, rectifies and auto bearings.

loans.name: John Njenga

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years. He is 39 years old and married to Alice Wambui. Together they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan on time. He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seed and pay for labor.

In future, John hopes to become a leading dairy farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed and pay for labor

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya qui  sont toutes des femmes mariées ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, sous préfecture de Fana; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de sel de cuisine de cuisine, du lait et des condiments alimentaires.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire, le premier ayant été correctement remboursé.                                                                        
 MAH compte acheter du sel de  12 sacs de cuisine avec les revendeurs du marché de Marka-Coungo. Elle effectue sa vente quotidiennement au village de Massoukou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 13 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are all married women who average 37 years of age and three children each. They live in extended traditional families in the village of Massoukou, subprefecture of Fana, in thew Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell cooking salt, milk and condiments.

The Danaya members are on their second group loan, having correctly repaid the first one.

MAH intends to buy 12 bags of cooking salt from resellers at the Marka-Coungo market. She conducts her sales daily in the village of Massoukou, for cash and credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 13,000 FCFA, which she will use to make loan repayments and to pay contributions to social ceremonies. Any remainder will be reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: to buy cooking salt

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with 4 children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 15 years, Bakari has operated a bicycle spare parts shop, selling to his local community neighbors. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation of charcoal from the market place to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming a big supplier of spare parts in the future.

With the 60,000 KES, he wants to purchase bicycles and motorcycle spare parts for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bicycles and motorcycle spare parts for sale

loans.name: Lonah Nyanduko

texts.en:
Lonah is 32 years old and married to Stephen. The couple has two children. Lonah has been farming for six years and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Lonah is requesting a loan to rent more land for farming. This will be her fourth loan with KADET. She has been a good client and has a good repayment record. Lonah will use the profits from her loan to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to rent land for farming

loans.name: Josephat Kibaya

texts.en:
50 year old Josephat is a coffee farmer in Bushenyi in western Uganda. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. Before that, this happily married father of five was mostly doing odd jobs in Bushenyi Town. Farming has extricated him out of his adversity, and for that reason he devotes most of his time planning how his business can gain stronger ground. 

The fact that coffee sells highly on the markets in western Uganda has been giving him further motivation to work hard at establishing a bigger niche. Proceeds from his coffee sales have been used to purchase high grade manure for his farms. Weekly his coffee sales profits total 450,000 Ugandan shillings (~$180), quite a substantial amount of money by Ugandan standards. 

Josephat says with this Kiva loan, he will be empowered to purchase more high grade manure for his coffee farms. He says he does not have much manure at present. Over time he anticipates better coffee yields. Depending on the stability of coffee prices on the local and international markets, better yields will mean better sales profits for him.

loans.use: to buy better and high grade manure for use on his coffee farms.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (orphans). 

Hajara has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Hajara sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale trade. Hajara has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. 

The main business challenges for Hajara include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease transportation costs and also to educate her children up to university. Hajara lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Esther De Garates Group

texts.fr:
Ronald est le coordinateur de son groupe Esther de Garates. Il n’est pas marié il n’a  d’enfant.

Ronald habite dans la ville de GARATES d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Ronald a dirigé son business pendant les 3 dernières années. Ronald voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du bois. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres d’ESTHER ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.

Ronald dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmentation du bussiness. Ronald vous remercie pour votre soutien.
texts.en:
Ronald is the organizer of his group, Esther de Garates. He is not married and doesn't have children. Ronald lives in the city of Garates in Haiti, where electricity is scarce and water access very limited.

Ronald has been managing his business for the past three years. He would like to use this loan to invest in buying timber. He hopes that this loan will help him grow his business.

Some of the other members of Esther need a loan for such trades as coal, rice and fish retail.

Ronald says that his main objective is to grow his business. Ronald thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: Jesusa Saluta Group

texts.en:
Jesusa has a grocery store that sells soap, toothpaste, canned goods, noodles, etc. She has had this business for 15 years. Jesusa is 63 years old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with eight children. 

Jesusa has been a member of PMPC for three years. She requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Jesusa hopes to have a bigger grocery store and plenty of grocery goods to sell.

Jesusa is the leader of a three person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Maria Virginia; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de verduras como zapallos, zanahorias, pepinos, lechugas y tomates, ella vende en el mercado, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como zanahorias, zapallos y pepinos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “IMASUMAC I”. It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco

The member's name is Mrs Maria Virginia. She is 38 years old and has 5 children. The member divides her time between daily activities and her vegetable business. She sells squash, carrots, cucumbers, lettice, tomatoes and the like in the market. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. The member wants to expand and improve her vegetable-selling business. She is asking for the loan in order to buy vegetables such as carrots, squash and cucumbers in bulk. 

The member is happy to be receiving the loan and agrees to make the repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as carrots, squash and cucumbers in bulk.

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona is 49 years old and is a widow with four children.

Leona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Leona has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for a year and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Leona aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and lives in Tubod Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with 9 children. 
To earn a living, Elizabeth has a business selling food, such as hotcakes, puto, bibingka, soman, etc.  She earns about PHP 600 each month doing this type of work. Elizabeth has requested a loan of 6,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending.
Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for 4 months.  In the future, Elizabeth would like to have a food stall near in her house.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending

loans.name: Pacifica Gregoria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 21De Julio.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gregoria, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos vive en su casa ya que es especial y requiere de sus cuidados. Su esposo trabaja en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí.

Doña Gregoria es una mujer muy abnegada y trabajadora que para generara sus propios ingresos trabaja como asesora comercial de un campo santo en la ciudad y también se dedica al comercio, vende bisutería y zapatos por catalogo, realizar sus ventas en sus ratos libres y fines de semana, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Recién empezó su negocio hace tres meses y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar bisutería y zapatos pues tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque no piden tantos requisitos como en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the “21 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks.

We met Gregoria, 52, here.  She’s married and has three children who are all adults.  The youngest one lives at home because he has special needs and requires care.  Her husband works at the Manabí Technical University.

Gregoria is a very self-sacrificing, hardworking woman who works as a commercial advisor for a municipal cemetery to earn her own income but she also is a merchant: she sells costume jewelry and shoes via catalogue in her free time and on weekends.  She sells on credit and collects payments every weekend.  She started the business recently, three months ago, and is doing very well.

She will use this loan to buy costume jewelry and shoes because she has several pending orders to fill.  This is her first cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because they don’t ask for so many requirements like other credit institutions.  Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry and shoes.

loans.name: Tabitha Wanjiru

texts.en:
Tabitha, age 30, describes herself as determined and focused. She operates a furniture-making business where she sells such items as tables, beds, couches, wall units, and wooden doors. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a rural area. 

She and her husband have three children, whose ages range from five months to six years.

Tabitha describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy timber, nails, and wood furnish. Her business goal is to improve the quality of her end products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will become a dealer and a renowned businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails, and wood furnish

loans.name: Esse Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ESSE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Roselyne Larissa est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Roselyne Larissa est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Roselyne Larissa est mariée à un militaire du nom de Franck. Le couple a un enfant qui vit avec eux. Roselyne Larissa et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Roselyne Larissa a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Roselyne Larissa vend depuis cinq ans des tissus et des glacières de façon ambulante. Roselyne Larissa s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Roselyne Larissa sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ESSE, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
The ESSE group is composed of three persons who reside in the same neighborhood. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé, to raise the level of its business activity. The representative of the group, Roselyne Larissa, is the one raising her hand in the picture.

Roselyne Larissa is 27 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a soldier named Frank. The couple has one child living with them. She and her husband share responsibility for household duties.

Roselyne Larissa stopped attending school when in high school. To meet her needs and those of her child, she has been an itinerant merchant of fabrics and coolers for the past five years. She gets her supplies in Benin.

In the quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her income and turnover, Roselyne Larissa (together with the other members of ESSE) is requesting a second credit loan.

loans.use: Buy fabrics and coolers.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
“Time is gold” is a quotation that Vicenta applies in her life. She is 46 years old and married to Fernando, who is a farmer. Together, they have three children. Farming is the main source of income for their family. In order to provide for the growing needs of their family, Vicenta and her husband decided to start a hog raising business.

Vicenta would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 22,000. She will use the loan for the maintenance of her hogs and to buy enough feed for their growth. She is also planning to purchase new piglets for additional income. She is very patient in raising the hogs because she knows that raising them is a big help in meeting her family's needs in a sustainable manner. Vicenta believes that by using her time wisely in her business, she will become successful.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and piglets for her business.

loans.name: Calleb

texts.en:
Calleb is a farmer in the Murang'a area and has been in farming for 3 years. He produces maize, beans, and rabbit for the local market. He is 32 years old and single.

Calleb has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy pesticides for his beans and maize produce and to construct a rabbit unit (a bigger and better housing unit) for his growing number of rabbits. He adds that the income will improve his living standards and create a good foundation for his family.

Calleb states that price fluctuations and climatic changes are the main challenges in farming.

loans.use: to construct a rabbit unit and purchase pesticides.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is married and blessed with a three-year-old child who is in school. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. She runs a cosmetics shop to make a living. She has been in this business for the last seven years. 
Since Pauline joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. With her loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings, she plans to buy body lotions and hair weaves for resale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy body lotions and hair weaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy children’s outfits, dresses, pants, jeans

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is 38 years old and married with five children. She earns a living from a rice grains retail business in the Philippines. Sherly is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Sherly has been for in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 39 years old. She is married to a business man. She has six children between 6 and 19 years old, and all of them are enrolled in school. 

She has been running a boutique for the past three years. She wants the loan to buy more items such as sugar, rice, soaps and salt to sell. 

With the profits, she plans to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of owning a big boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en:
Sinuon (in the photo), age 49, is a weaver and does farming when farming season come. Her husband, Sotheavy, age 46, is a house constructor. They live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have six children-two sons and four daughters. Four are married and live separately, one is a garment worker and another one is a hairdresser.  

Sinuon is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy more materials for her daughter’s beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her daughter’s beauty salon.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 34 years old and is married with 8 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, yams, and taamu that she can sell to the community. Naomi is requesting a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, bush knives, fertilizer, weed killer, and other items for her garden.

Naomi has been a  member of SPBD since 2011, joining to gain access to financial stability. Naomi hopes to use her earnings to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, and fertilizer

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine aged 26 years. She is married with 2 children aged 1 and 4 years. Not yet go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 3 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to pay school fees of her children to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is a 24-year-old farmer from Macaresti village, Ungheni. She is married and has two nice children. Her husband Pavel works as a border police inspector.
