Natalia has got about one hectare of land and grows corn, vegetables and grapevines. Selling of agriculture goods is a good addition at family income. But work land manualy is difficult and take more time. So what Natalia decided to purchase a mini tractor. Using it, the agriculture works will be easier and Natalia will have more time for her children.
This loan will help Natalia to purchase a mini tractor and as result the level of life of his family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a mini tractor

loans.name: Sii

texts.en:
Sii has had four loans through SPBD having started with an ST 750 (USD 300) loan two years ago. She has used her loans to help finance her plantation business which she started with her husband, home improvement and with her last recent loan she helped her husband set up a car repair business. She has also made and sold snack food at the local primary school.

Her plantation has grown with SPBDs assistance and now included taro, bananas, tamu and vegetables. The next loan will be used to buy fertilizer, weed killer, spraying equipment and seeds. Sii is an example of an SPBD member who has not stood still and who manages her businesses with her husband and family.

She has two sons who are currently at school but she is hoping they will go on to secondary education.

loans.use: Buy weed killer and fertiliser, tools and equipment, spray for bananas

loans.name: Francis Dinorah

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Francis. I have run a business in the center of my community called Variedades Francis (Francis' Variety) for a number of years, selling clothing and accessories. It generates income to help me cover family expenses and also arrange deals from suppliers. Currently my sales volume has been growing and I don't have the sufficient funds to satisfy the demand. I need to expand my inventory so I can offer my clients a wider variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es francis, mi actividad es el comercio, cuento con un negocio en el centro de mi comunidad, llamado Variedades Francis, cuento con varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastod de mi familia y demas conpromisos con proveedores, actualmente el volumen de venta ha crecido y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda existente necesito ampliar mis inventarios y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: Buy undergarments, towels, sandals, men's shirts, blouses, T-shirts, pants, hats, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of a hair dryer and other utensils such as scissors, tweezers, etc. Part of it will also be invested in the maintenance and expansion of the location.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.es:
Business Description

Glenda has had five years of experience in the commerce business. She used to live in a different province and her sister had the initiative to start selling cosmetics. Her husband helped her with the capital. She moved to Guayaquil and set up a cosmetics and imitation jewelry shop. She's been doing really well with her business. She works every day of the week from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. She has two people that help her with sales. She works and lives in the same place, which she is currently renting.

Loan Use

She would invest the credit on purchasing more cosmetics, imitation jewelry, jewelry and gifts. Demand for her product has augmented due to the quality of her services.

Personal Information

Glenda is married. She is 30 years old and has three children. Her children are currently living with Glenda's mother in a different province. She travels every 15 days to visit them and give them what they need. Her husband is a wood salesman. He travels often to deliver the material. Glenda's wish is to be able to save in order to purchase a terrain where she can build her own house and have hew own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Glenda tiene una experiencia de 5 años en la actividad del comercio. Ella vivía en otra provincia y una hermana incentivo a vender cosméticos. Su esposo le ayudo con el capital. Vino a vivir acá donde puso un local de venta de cosméticos, bisutería. L e ha ido muy bien con su negocio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Tiene dos personas que le ayudan con las ventas de sus productos. Actualmente ella vive alquilando. Donde también tiene su local.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de cosméticos, bisutería, joyas y regalos. Gracias al servicio que ella les ofrece su demanda ha aumentado.

Información Personal

Glenda es casada. Tiene 30 años y 3 hijos. Sus hijos están viviendo con su mama en otra provincia. Ella viaja cada 15 días a visitarlos y darles los que ellos necesitan. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de madera. Pasa viajando entregando el material. Su deseo es poder ir ahorrando. A futuro comprar un terreno donde edificar su casita y tener su propio local.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, jewelry, imitation jewelry and gifts

loans.name: Maria Angélica

texts.es:
Hard-working, enthusiastic and optimistic are how we can describe Maria Angélica. Five years ago she and her husband separated, and she receives no support from him at all, so she has had to work very hard to bring up her small son. That's why she decided to found her own business selling cosmetics. A little after, thanks to the savings she had been able to accumulate, she bought cleansing products and began selling them, getting very good results.

At this time, Maria needs a loan of $275 dollars that she will use in the purchase of merchandise to cover the demands of her clients so her business will continue to grow. She is offering to pay back the amount in four months. Choose to help Maria; she needs it, and thanks you for the support that you can bring her.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

Trabajadora, entusiasta y optimista es como podemos describir a Maria Angélica, desde hace cinco años ella se separó de su esposo y no recibía ningún tipo de ayuda de su parte, por lo que ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo, así fue como decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, poco después gracias a los ahorros que pudo acumular, compro productos de limpieza e inició su venta, obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

En este momento Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Decídete a ayudar a Maria, ella necesita y agradece mucho el apoyo que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and toiletries

loans.name: Irsa Mendez

texts.en: Irsa is a forty-one year old single mother with two children.  She is the only entrepreneur in her community who specializes in designing pieces for decorating furniture, including shams and other coverings.  She began her textile business three years ago to support her two children.  Her son is seventeen years old and her daughter, who will soon start school, is six years old.  With her loan, Irsa plans to purchase a new weaving loom for her fabrics.  She hopes that someday the textile work she does in her home will become her “own company.”

loans.use: Investment in a new weaving loom.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Check out that warm smile. That’s the real thing! Edward is the proud owner of the Glory Hardware Store in Lugazi, a village half way between Zampala and Jinji, the source of the Nile. Lugazi is one of those special places where life doesn’t go too fast and everyone knows everyone. You can walk down the middle of the street and the only thing coming your way will be children and other pedestrians.

In his well organized hardware store, which he has operated for six years, Edward sells cement, nails, paint, chain, rope, wire, etc. He has a very good location, smiles and laughs easily, and is very friendly to everyone. He is married with 4 children and he also cares for 3 orphans. With his loan, he plans to buy more cement and hardware for his store. There are no concrete trucks to deliver large quantities of concrete, so cement in bags is mixed with sand and gravel to build even large commercial buildings. So, hardware stores can sell large quantities of cement.

loans.use: Edward plans to use his loan to buy more cement and hardware for his store.

loans.name: Sarian

texts.en: Sarian is 38 years old and has been a SMT client for 3 years.  With her previous loans she was able to build her own capital and reduce the amount of goods she purchased on credit.  She made a good profit that has improved her family income and living status.  Married with 3 children, she would like to supplement her stock with the latest female fashion clothes. She would like to access a $525 loan from Kiva.

loans.use: She would like to add a variety of the latest female fashions to her clothing shop to attract new customers

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina O. is 48 years old, married with 7 children, and hails from Iba Area in Lagos State.  She has been in the business of selling foodstuffs in her community for 4 years. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more food items for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene U. runs a phone booth and also sells clothes. She is single and 25 years old, and she comes from Edo State. She has been in business since 2002. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra has a snackbar where she sells fried foods prepared in different ways. She began the business 3 years ago. At first, she helped a friend sell tostadas. Bit by bit, she saved what she made until, 2 years ago, she had saved enough to start a business of her own at home. She's married with 3 children, 10, 8, and 5, and her husband is a "comerciante" (merchant or shopkeeper, perhaps). She wants to help her husband with household expenses and so provide a better quality of life for their children.

She's now applying for a US$400 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy new merchandise that her customers have asked for such as cold drinks and sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Sandra tiene un snack, donde vende frituras preparadas de diversas formas,, esto empezó hace 3 años, al principio le ayudaba a un a amiga a vender tostadas con este dinero poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta que hace 2 años junto el capital suficiente y decidido iniciar el negocio ella sola en su casa. Es casada tiene 3 hijos de 10,8 y 5 años, y su esposo es comerciante. Ella desea apoyar a su marido en los gastos familiares y así brindarles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 3 meses para comprara mercancía nueva que sus clientes les están solicitando como refrescos y dulces.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing wood so that she can complete her furniture orders

loans.name: Vali

texts.en: Vali K. was born in 1960 in the J.Ismoil region of Tajikistan. He is married and has five children. For the last 30 years, he has made a living raising livestock. He also works in the local collective farm, but this is not his main occupation. Mr. K. has three brothers, all of whom also raise livestock for a living. Mr. K. has a good herd which consists of three cows and one bull, and would like to try the business of raising and selling rams. He has applied for a loan, which he will pay back in six months, to make this possible.

loans.use: to buy rams

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeurn P. sells Khmer noodles in Roka Tong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Him Nao (pictured, on the right), is a rice farmer and sells firewood. They have eight children, one of whom also sells firewood and another who helps in the rice field. Four are attending the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study.

Usually Mr. Him Nao hires a laborer with cows to plow his rice plantation, but now he would like to start working the field himself, which is more economically viable. Thus, Him and Yoeurn decided to apply for a loan to buy buffaloes to use as draft animals.

loans.use: To buy buffalo to plow her rice field.

loans.name: Lidija

texts.en:
Lidija is a young woman from the village of Tekucici, near the town of Doboj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is married and her husband is a military officer. Lidija opened a small hair salon a few months ago and is very busy with it now.

Lidija is asking for this loan because she needs to buy more supplies and equipment for her salon. It is her goal to help build up her business by attracting more customers and offering more types of services to her current clients.

loans.use: To buy more beauty supplies and inventory

loans.name: Sarwar's Group

texts.en:
Sarwar N. K. is the wife of N. K. and lives in the Walton area of Lahore City, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last 25 years. She has one daughter, named Rakhshanda, who runs a beauty parlor. Her husband is a government servant. Sarwar baji works as a maid in several houses. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy materials (cosmetics, creams, machines, etc.) for her daughter's beauty salon.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Anwar S. H. wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motorized vehicle). Salma A. M. wants a loan to buy construction materials (cement, sand, etc.). Tariza S. M. wants a loan to buy candies and sweets to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and supplies for her daughter's beauty parlor

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.  Her husband, Mr. O. is an artist and owns a gallery. They have four children. 

Victoria sells provisions and has been in this business for the past eight years. She needs the loan of $850 to purchase more products to sell in her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana sells candy, bakery and sweets in a local market called “Progress” in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Her small vending kiosk is located very favorably in a nice part of the marketplace busy with potential customers. Oksana launched this business 5 years ago. Currently, she already has 18,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about 3,000 Grivnas.

Oksana’s business can boast high profitability. Groceries always sell well in any season and are always in high demand among customers. Oksana is dreaming about growing her business and eventually opening a whole network of small locations selling sweets and candy in different markets of her town. She is requesting a loan of 6000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: Increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en: Mr. Chanthol T. is 57 years old and a truck driver. He has a truck to provide transportation service and deliver merchandise to his customers' houses. He currently earns approximately $5 per day. His wife, Mrs. Shiyat Soun, is 51 years old and has two children. Shiyat makes a living by selling Khmer Fritters in her home. Chanthol is concerned about his truck, which is often broken. Hence, he decided to request a $500 loan for repairing his truck and to buy ingredients for his wife to makes fritters to sell.

loans.use: To repair his truck and to buy ingredients for his wife's khmer fritter business

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunita M. is a 31-year-old tailor in the town of Kritipur. Her husband's name is Anil M., and he works in private office. In addition, she has two daughters: one is 13 years old and is in grade 8 in school, while the other is 11 years old and is in grade 5.

She opened her tailoring shop 3 years ago, and she notes that she specializes in making custom-fitted ladies dresses (e.g., Kurta Sulwar, which are very popular with Nepali women). Before she started her own business, Mrs. M. completed a 6-month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her home.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $225 in order to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. In turn, she expects to generate an increase in her shop's income, which she will use to improve her family's living conditions and to pay for her daughters' educations. In Nepal the cost of a good education is increasing, so Mrs. M. is saving her income to provide her daughters with such an education.

loans.use: To expand and improve her tailoring business by purchasing additional raw materials

loans.name: Khao

texts.en: Khao S. is 29 years old and lives in Siem Reap province with her husband and four of her children. She has a business selling soup and roast beef from her home and is able to make around US$ 4 a day. Her husband, Sok S., 42, grows and sells rice and makes about US$ 2 a day. Mrs. Khao S. is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase fertilizer for her husband’s farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enhtsetseg G. lives with her husband and daughter in a rental apartment. Her husband owns a second-hand car and uses it to work as a taxi driver.  Since 1998, Enhtsetseg has been renting a 10-square-meter section of a local hairdressing salon in a residential district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She cuts hair and does other beautician services in that small place.

Enhtsetseg has 11 years' experience in this line of work. Now, she wants a Kiva loan to expand her small business by buying a tattoo machine. Her dream is to have her own bigger beauty salon in the future. Now, she is accumulating savings from her own and her husband's earnings and planning to buy a condominium for her family.

loans.use: buying a tattoo machine

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Толиб Темиров очередной раз получает кредит на животноводство.Сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2007 года. Ему необходима эта сумма также на покупку жмых (корм скота).  Толиб купит несколько голов скота по дешевой цене, и продаст осенью подороже, что и приведет к увеличению прибыли. Планирует  научить сына этому бизнесу, поэтому и хочет кредитоваться и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
It's not the first time that Tolib T. has received a loan for cattle farming. He has been a Microinvest client since 2007. He needs a loan for buying fodder and more cattle at a lower price. He would resell this cattle at a profit in the fall. He plans to teach his son to do the same trade and he will apply for more loans in the future.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Asuncion Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Asunción del Carmen Z. tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella tiene estudios superiores, tiene 3 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Asunción tienen como negocio la venta de perfumes y un pequeño botiquín (medicamentos), como su casa esta en construcción traslado su negocio a la casa de su suegra, presenta sus productos en una vitrina. Es la empresaria quien se encarga de la venta de sus productos.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco “Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de perfumes y mostradores.
Con el crédito de 300 soles , que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza, así como en ropa de bebe y continuar implementando su botiquín.
Asunción tiene como sueño, concluir con la construcción de su vivienda, así mismo alquilar un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Asunción del Carmen Z. is 39-years-old and lives in the Salaverry distrtict of Trujillo province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She has a higher education and 3 children who depend on her financially. Asunción sells perfume and basic medications. Since her house is under construction, she moved her business into her mother-in-law’s house where she sets out her products in a display case. She’s in charge of sales. She invested her first loan of 300 soles, which she received through “Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II” Communal Bank, in the purchase of perfume and display cases. She’ll use this loan of 300 soles, which she’ll repay in 4 months, to purchase cosmetics, baby clothing and to stock her mini-pharmacy. Asunción dreams of completing construction on her house and renting a space for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, baby clothing and to stock her mini-pharmacy.

loans.name: Anicia

texts.es: Anicia tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos quienes cursan estudios técnicos y la apoyan mucho. Tiempo atrás se dedicaba a la crianza de pollos, pero a razón de no serle muy rentable, decidió vender bebidas en un espacio que acondicionó en su domicilio, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 4 años, donde también cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y que los mismos se sientan satisfechos y contentos de comprar en su negocio, así regresan y la recomiendan. Este trabajo, además le es muy rentable, ya que lo que ofrece son productos que tienen mucha demanda, en especial helados, por encontrarse en una ciudad de la selva peruana donde la temperatura es muy alta, y las personas siempre buscan cómo refrescarse y satisfacer su sed. Para más adelante, Anicia quiere mandar a construir un local apropiado para su negocio, y así dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más bebidas, tanto cervezas, como gaseosas.
texts.en:
Anicia is 50, and she lives with her husband and her two children who are pursuing technical degrees. A while back she raised chickens, but that was not very profitable. She decided to sell drinks in a space that she set up in her home. She has been doing this for 4 years. She receives support from her children and her husband. What she likes about her work is taking good care of her customers, having them feel satisfied and happy to buy from her, and having them return and recommend her. This work is very profitable because the products she offers are in much demand, especially ice cream. People in a Peruvian jungle city, where the temperatures are very high, always look for ways to refresh themselves and satisfy their thirst. In the future Anicia would like to build an appropriate space for her business in order to give her customers a better welcome. This is her first loan with MFP. She will use the loan to buy more drinks like beer and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Don Jesús A. V. y la señora María del Carmen, son casados y viven en la colonia Acoros, de la ciudad de Piedras Negras; son padres de tres hijos.
El tiene su propio negocio llamado “3 hermanos “donde realiza proyectos relacionados  a la herrería tales como portones, puertas y ventanas, etc. 
Desde hace 7 años, teniendo ya una  cartera de clientes  extensa; pero en estos momentos esta requiriendo de la compra de una maquina de soldar, porque la anterior que tenía se descompuso y tiene ya empezados algunos pedidos,por esto es que esta tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Jesús A. V. lives with his wife María del Carmen in the Acoros neighborhood in the city of Piedras Negras. They have three children. He has his own blacksmith business called “3 Hermanos” (“3 Brothers”), where he makes products such as gates, doors, windows, etc. Jesús has had an extensive client list for the past 7 years. Right now he needs to purchase a new welding machine, since his old machine broke and he currently has some orders to complete. That is why he’s applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a welding machine

loans.name: Rayno

texts.ru:
Раъно Салимова родилась в 1960 году. Замужем, проживает с 3 детьми. Место жительства город  Истаравшан.
 Клиентка занимается животноводством у себя дома уже около 15 лет. В откорме скота ей помогают сыновья Равшан и Джасур. 
 Дополнительный источник дохода это работа Равшана таксистом, а сама Раъно работает в школе преподавателем родного языка и литературы.
 К сожалению, заработная плата учителя  невилика, и поэтому Раъно приходиться подрабатывать животноводством. Для откорма скота Раъно запрашивает сумму в размере 200 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rayno S. was born in 1960. She is married and lives with 3 children in Istaravshan. Rayno teaches Tajik language at a local school. Unfortunately, the teacher's pay is low and, to supplement her income, Rayno has been farming cattle at her home farm for almost 15 years. Rayno's sons Ravshan and Dzhasur help her feed the animals. Ravshan earns additional income driving a taxi. This loan, Rayno will use to purchase food for her cattle. She plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock food

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles K. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur. He is an ex-soldier of the JWTZ (Tanzania People's Defence Force), where he served as a doctor. He is married and has three children, the youngest of whom is in form six.

He runs a pub and guesthouse business in the Yombo Kilakala ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells a variety of both soft and alcoholic drinks in his pub. The income from this business has allowed him to be able to pay school fees for his three children.

He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to boost up his business.

loans.use: To boost up his business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa B. makes a living from providing transportation services to local community members. She is 47 years old, married and has six school-age children. They are from the town of Lopez Jaena. Rosa has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: La señora Silvia C. tiene la edad de 42 años, reside Naydayosi no-2 carretera vieja a león, desde muy joven comenzó a laborar para apoyar a su esposo el se desempeña en la construcción, su trabajo es de responsable de recursos humanos, con este crédito que esta solicitando es para hacer mejoras a su vivienda va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer una pared de concreto con esto espera poder tener una vivienda digna. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo que se le esta brindando ya que solo mediante préstamo se puede lograr vivir un poco mejor ya que todo esta caro.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia C. is 42 years old. She resides at No. 2 Naydayosi Old León Road. From a young age, she began working to support her husband, who is a construction worker. She works in human resources.

Sra. Silvia is applying for a loan to make improvements to her home. She will purchase materials to build a concrete wall in hopes that it will make her house more livable. She thanks the institution for offering its support by providing this loan. She hopes her family will be able to live a little bit better since everything is expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a concrete wall

loans.name: Frances

texts.en:
Frances A. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Frances owns & operates specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling electronic cellphones to local community members. Frances is just starting this business.

Frances joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Frances is requesting a new loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (or about $125 US). This will be used as additional working capital, and is the first loan Frances has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To generate additional working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies of sewing material such as linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Adilia Waleska

texts.es: La señora Adilia Waleska López Hernández , tiene la edad de 23 años , habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos de hogar , ellos tiene  un hijo de tres años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Adilia desde hace dos años tiene su negocio de variedades , eventos y decoraciones , durante este tiempo la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ya que la demanda de sus clientes , su capital de trabajo no lo cubre , los planes hacia su negocio es expandirse dentro del sector , ella inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos y el apoyo de su esposo . Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales y accesorios para las diferentes actividades a si como ropa. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible su incremento en las ventas.
texts.en:
Adilia Waleska López Hernández is 23 years old and lives in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla with her husband, who works and supports her with the household expenses. They have a 3-year-old son. Her plan for her family is to improve their quality of life. Adilia has had her variety, event, and decoration shop for the past two years. During this time, the biggest difficulty is the lack of financing, as her working capital does not cover her customers’ demand. Her plan for her business is to expand it within the sector. She began this business with her own efforts and the support of her husband. With this loan, she will buy materials and accessories for the different activities, such as clothing. She thanks the lending institution for making her increase in sales possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothing

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is a member of the Dodoma Road borrower group in kihesa, Iringa. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 17,12,4 years old.

Suzana has owned a clothing business for 8 years, she works 4hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Suzana first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to  buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Suzana hopes to save more money an expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is twenty – eight years old. She is married and has give birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Doris is a trader. She runs a provision store. She buys from Kumasi and sells in a shop by the road side. Doris has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 54 years old and already a widow.  She was left with seven children, six of whom are already married. Her youngest child, her son Christopher, is still single. Four member of her family lives together at Sta.Cruz, Alicia, Isabela, a rural and plain area. Their house is along the national highway.

Dolores has been managing a retail store for almost six years and her weekly net income is Php 800.00 (~ $17 USD). She wants a Php 15,000 (~$325 USD) loan from Kiva to buy grocery items to sell, and to buy hog feed for her hog-raising business. She works continuously to improve her business and to increase her daily income so that she can meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and hog feed

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mr. Sen S. lives in Ta Daul II village in Kandal province. He is 62 years old and a widower with a child, a rice miller who owns a rice mill which is hired by the villagers.

Mr. Sen S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a rice middleman.

Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to resell to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her arable area and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Lhagvadorj

texts.en:
B. Lhagvadorj is 39 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His wife currently manages a meat trading business. His oldest three children all attend the local secondary school and his youngest will soon start kindergarten.

Lhagvadorj operates a taxi service in his town using his car. He transports local residents to and from various points in the province. He started his business in 2007 and has had success as a driver over the last two years. Lhagvadorj is a very hardworking person and is known by his customers for his good character. For the future, he hopes to continue his success as a driver and use his earnings to help his wife grow her meat trading business. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase machinery parts for his car and meat for his wife's business.

About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase car parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lowelyn

texts.en:
Lowelyn D., age 46, is from the village of Salvador Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Lowelyn is married and has a child in school. To make a living, Lowelyn operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as bread, candies, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Lowelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lowelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her purpose was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Lowelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Lowelyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lowelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 23 years old, is single, and she takes care of two dependents who are from members of her family. She lives in Nyaruguru, in the Southern Province of Rwanda and has been in the business of selling foodstuffs including beans, wheat etc since 2006. The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Marine is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing additional foodstuffs like rice, peas etc. Through accessing this loan, if her expansion plan is successful, Marine will be able to continue working as a self-employed businesswoman with a successful business.

The savings from her additional profits that are not reinvested in her business will allow Marine to take even better care of her two dependents and make big progress in her business.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Juntas Si Podemos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Juntas si Podemos, inicia su segundo ciclo con 15 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comidas, abarrotes en general, ropa, bebidas, verduras, frutas y servicios D. transporte, renovadora D. calzados, salones D. belleza.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Aydee que es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 1 hijo, Aydee viaja a los diferentes pueblos en donD. venD. ropa variada y también pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Aydee necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra pantalones, chompas y polos.

Mientras que Alicia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Alicia venD. ropa D. manera ambulatoria en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, además Alicia tiene un carro que realiza transporte publico. Alicia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. blusas, chompas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, 1050 soles  haciendo un total D. 8,850 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. chompas, polos, blusas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, bebidas, verduras y frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son levantar el segundo piso D. su casa, implementar su negocio en su casa, tener una tienda D. abarrotes por mayor y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
The Juntas Sí Podemos Communal Bank is starting its second cycle with 15 members. The members have different businesses like selling food, general groceries, clothing, drinks, vegetables, and fruits. Some proviD. transportation services, fix shoes, or have beauty salons. That is the case with Aydee. She is 39, in a common law marriage, and has one son. Aydee travels to different villages to sell various clothes and deliver her customers’ orders. Aydee needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy pants, sweaters, and shirts. Alicia is 30, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Alicia is a street vendor, and she sells clothes at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Also, Alicia has a car, which is used for public transportation. Alicia needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy blouses and sweaters. The members need different amounts of loans like 300, 600, 750, and 1,050 PEN. The total amount of the loan for the communal bank is 8,850 PEN. Their loans will be used to buy sweaters, shirts, blouses, rice, sugar, oil, drinks, vegetables, and fruits. The members’ dreams are to raise a second floor on the house, start a business in the home, have a wholesale grocery store, and buy a car to transport their products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters, shirts, blouses, rice, sugar, oil, drinks, vegetables, and fruits

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 48 years old, married, and he has 3 children. His youngest child is 5 years old. His children are still young and they attend school. His wife sells hair extensions to help support their household. Amos loves his family very much and he is determined to lift his business and family above poverty. 

Amos is in a unique business: he is a key fabricator. He has a machine that he uses to fabricate keys for his customers. The demand for his services is high and he hopes to purchase an additional machine. He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase a machine to fabricate keys. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to fabricate keys

loans.name: Manuel Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Emilio G. O., tiene la edad de 26 años vive en el Barrio de Santa Lucia es casado y su esposa vende frutas y verduras, ellos tienen dos hijos de las edades de 5 años y 8 meses de edad, el desde hace 7 años es despachador y dentro de los propositos de vida de la familia esta la mejoría continua de las condiciones de vida.

Uno de los principales inconvenientes a los que se ha enfrentado ha sido el nacimiento de su hijo, el sufre de una seria enfermedad y por él se han hecho gastos económicos que les ha obstaculizado la inversion hacia nuevas fuentes de ingresos, es por el bebe que él solicita un prestamo par la compra de materiales de construcción y poco a poco ir reconstruyendo su vivienda para brindarle mejores condiciones a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel Emilio G. O., 26, lives in the Santa Lucia neighborhood; he's married and his wife is a fruit vendor. They have two children, who are 5 years and 8 months of age, respectively. For the last 7 years he has worked as a dispatcher. Among his life goals is to continue to make improvements to his home. One of the main challenges he faces stemms from the birth of his son; he has a serious illness, which has caused the family to incurr significant medical expenses and has prevented investment into new sources of income. It is because of the baby that he is asking for funding to buy building materials and supplies so that he can gradually rebuild his home thereby offering better living conditions to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy S., age 39, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in the business of selling vegetables at a local market in the province, earning an income of USD 4.60 per day to help cover the family expenses. She also raises cows at home to do farming on her own plot of farmland. Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver, earning an income of USD 2.60 per day. Their standard of living has improved since S. and her husband have had these businesses. S. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase fruits to sell. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Ghieliza's Group

texts.en:
Ghieliza J. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena. She is 34 years old. Ghieliza is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ghieliza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ghieliza owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fresh fish in the local community. Ghieliza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ghieliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ghieliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC. Ghieliza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used additional capital for fish vending. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ghieliza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide for the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilú tiene 37 años, ella esta separada de su pareja, solo vive con sus hijos Katerin de15, Milagros de 13 y Álvaro de 04 años. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 meses se dedica la venta de comida, en un pequeño puesto que se encuentra ubicado en la parte exterior de su domicilio, ofreciendo gran variedad de platillos como anticuchos, parrilla de pollo, salchichas, entre otros. Es así que su buena sazón es degustado por sus fieles clientes que la visitan frecuentemente a su establecimiento. En un inicio repartía almuerzos a domicilio, pues los clientes le solicitaban de su servicio, sin embargo tuvo que dejar este ritmo de trabajo por la falta de capital. Ahora este negocio le resulta muy gratificante puesto que solo de dedica durante las tardes hasta las 10 de la noche, dándole tiempo en las mañanas para dedicarse a las labores del hogar. En un futuro Marilú quiere hacer crecer su negocio, como tener un restaurante, pero sabe que para eso aún le hace falta más capital y una mejor infraestructura, por no dejará de trabajar arduamente con tal de conseguir su meta. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar algunos utensilios de cocina que le hacen falta e ingredientes para preparar sus paltillos.
texts.en:
Marilu is 37 years old. She is separated from her partner and lives alone with her children, Katerin who is 15, Milagros who is 13, and Alvaro who is 4. They all live together in their own home. It has been 5 months since she started selling from a small stand outside her house, offering a variety of dishes such as kebabs, grilled chicken, sausage and others. It is so well seasoned that it is much enjoyed by her loyal customers who frequently come to visit her establishment. In the beginning she offered home delivery of lunches, because the customers asked for this service, however she could not continue working at this pace due to lack of capital. Now her business is very gratifying because she only has to work in the afternoons until 10pm, giving her time in the mornings to perform household chores. In the future Marilu want to make her business grow so as to have her own restaurant, but she knows that she needs more capital and a better infrastructure, but she will not stop working hard to reach her goal. This is her fourth loan cycle with MFP and she is committed to being punctual with her payments. With the loan, she wants to buy some cooking utensils that she needs to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and ingredients to prepare menu items.

loans.name: Vanessa Jireh

texts.en:
Vanessa Jireh C. lives in the town of Sto. Niño. She is 20 years old and has a one-year-old child. She and her husband Joemar have been married for a year, and she makes a living as a farmer. She has been in this line of work for more than two years, and sells her produce in the local market. 

Last year, Vanessa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from CEVI, and is now applying for a new loan for 12,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to use on her farm

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna R., from the village of Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya, is a married 36-year-old mother of five young children. To make a living, for over six years she has been raising pigs for breeding, earning approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase breeding livestock, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 7000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Myrna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr:
Mariée et âgée de 39 ans, Madame Maréme S. évolue dans le petit commerce depuyis 2 ans.Elle a débuté par la vente de produits de dépigmentation qui étaient très prisés par les jeunes femmes. Mainteneant, elle vend du parfum, de l'encnes et des laits de beauté. 
Membre de U-IMCEC, Madame S. souhaitait un crédit de 100 000FCFA pour s'approvisionner en produits.
texts.en:
Ms. Madame Maréme S., 39 years old and married, has been working in small-scale commerce for two years. She started by selling depigmentation products, which are very popular among young women. She now sells perfumes, incense, and beauty lotions. A member of U-IMCEC, Ms. S. wishes to obtain a loan of 100,000 francs CFA to stock up on products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat operates a mixed farm in the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He has been farming for ten years and produces tea, tree seedlings, vegetables and maize which he sells locally. He also owns and operates a spare-parts shop in the same area (he is pictured outside his shop).

Josephat is 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of 3 and 13. Four of the children are currently attending school.

Josephat has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, having successfully completed his second loan. He has requested this loan of KES 50,000 to construct a dairy unit and purchase a water tank to store water for his dairy cows. He believes that, from this investment, he will be able to get more yield from his dairy cows and hence more income that will enable him pay school fees for his children.

Josephat’s biggest challenge, however, has been diseases and pests which affect his animals and crops. He would like to purchase more dairy cows in future, which will increase his milk production. He is also requesting Juhudi to continue offering and facilitating training for farmers on agribusiness management.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and purchase a water tank for his cows

loans.name: Diocelina Isabel

texts.es:
Diocelina C., es una mujer que toda la vida ha tenido negocio, ella es comerciante  y fotógrafa profesional desde hace mucho tiempo, por eso tiene contratos con instituciones educativas, grupos musicales y participa en eventos como grados matrimonios, revistas deportivas etc. Vive en el popular barrio Villablanca, con sus dos hijos en las edades de 30 y 32 años, muy cerca de una arteria principal de Barranquilla llamada la calle Murillo, donde  contrasta el comercio al pormenor, el deporte, los espectáculos culturales y la convivencia pacifica de muchas  familias que allí habitan. 

Diocelina inició su negocio desde hace 30 años, porque se puede decir que toda su vida ha sido comerciante, trabaja 12 horas diarias y  hasta lo fines de semanas en eventos especiales de celebración,  como grados, matrimonios, primeras comuniones, actividades educativas colegiales y como si fuera poco acompaña a grupos musicales como mariachis cuando brindan serenata, pues ellos la contratan para el registro fotográfico pertinente.
Diocelina ha recibido  8 créditos a través de  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos ha logrado nuevos y mejores ingresos y hoy su nivel de vida es diferente. Su sueño siempre es progresar para ayudar  económicamente a sus familiares, por eso no deja de trabajar duro y parejo. Diocelina va a comprar con su credikiva una cámara fotográfica digital de mayor tecnología para mejorar sus registros, una impresora y mercancías variadas para fortalecer su negocio como comerciante al detalle.
texts.en:
Diocelina C. is a woman who has wanted to have her own business her entire life. She has been a merchant and professional photographer for a long time. She has contacts with educational institutions, musical groups and participates in graduations, weddings, sports magazines, etc. She lives in the popular Villablanca neighborhood with her two children who are 30 and 32 years of age near one of Barranquilla’s main thoroughfares, called Calle Murillo, which is noted for its retail businesses, sports, cultural events and peaceful coexistence of the many families that live there. Diocelina started her business 30 years ago because it can be said that she’s been a merchant her whole life. She works a 12 hour day and even on weekends at special celebratory events like graduations, weddings, first communions, school educational activities. As if this weren’t enough, she goes along with musical groups, like mariachis, when they go out on serenades because she’s hired to photographically record the pertinent moments. Diocelina has gotten 8 previous loans through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. They have helped her attain new and better earnings and today her living standard is different. Her dream is to always continue progressing in order to help her family financially. This is why she never stops working hard and steadily. Diocelina will use her Kiva credit to buy a technologically advanced digital camera to attain better photographs, a printer and assorted supplies to augment her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a technologically advanced digital camera to improve her photos, a printer and assorted supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy staple grains, soft drinks, vegetables, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som P., 57, works with her husband to hire out tables, chairs and other wedding equipment to the local people in Kampong Cham province. She is married with one child, who is employed as a worker. 

Som P. and her husband, who is pictured here, earn the most during ceremony season (November to April). She typically makes about US$ 4 each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$ 1000 to purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables to rent out

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía D. su madre, D. su hijo mayor, su nuera y su nieta, todos muy unidos habitan en un populoso barrio al norte D. la ciudad. DesD. hace 1 año esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta D. mueble D. madera como estantes, vitrinas, camas, y esta ubicado en la parte D. afuera D. su casa. Dice que se le ocurrió instalar este negocio, pues la zona por donD. vive es muy comercial en este rubro, lo que le ha permitido captar buenos clientes en poco tiempo. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues lo considera tranquilo y rentable, porque aunque atienD. sola cuenta con la ayuda D. su hijo o nuera. Cada vez tiene mayor variedad D. muebles que ofrecer a su clientela que la visita con frecuencia, por el buen acabado y calidad D. su mercadería. Además como es una mujer emprendedora que tiene muchos planes en mente, para más adelante quiere ampliar y acondicionar un ambiente D.  su casa para tener mayor espacio, D. esta manera espera ofrecer más cantidad D. muebles. Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere defraudar la confianza que depositaron en ella todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero  que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Dolores tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. juegos D. mesas y sillas, ya que tiene varios pedidos por cumplir, y así calcula que  obtendrá mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dolores lives in her own home with her mother, her oldest son, her daughter-in-law, and her granddaughter. They resiD. together in a very crowded neighborhood located north of the city. For the past year this enterprising woman has been selling wooden furniture such as shelving, cabinets, and beds. Her business is located just outsiD. of her house. Dolores says that since starting her business, the area where she lives has experienced more commercial activity, which has allowed her to attract good customers over time. She greatly enjoys her work because it is peaceful and profitable. Dolores manages the business by herself, but she also has the help of her son and daughter-in-law. She always has a wiD. variety of furniture to offer to her customers who visit her frequently. The merchandise she sells is of good workmanship and high quality. Being an enterprising woman, Dolores has many plans in mind. Later on she wants to expand and equip her house so that she can have more space in hopes of offering more furniture.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. Dolores promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to lose the trust of everyone who maD. this loan possible so that she can continue working. She has plans to invest the funds in the purchase of a large quantity of dining sets (tables and chairs) since she has several orders to fulfill. This will allow her to generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dining sets (tables & chairs) to complete her customers' orders

loans.name: Ketty Viviana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces.

La señora Ketty tiene 30 años de edad y está casada hace 13 años de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 12 y una linda niña de 5 años los cuales son su razón de vivir y salir adelante, el esposo es vendedor ambulante de aguas aromáticas en Manta.

Vende bisutería, ropa en general e interiores de damas, sale a recorrer con sus productos los fines de semana de cinco a seis horas, los otros días trabaja con su esposo en Manta. La mercadería  compra en Guayaquil, ciudad a la que viaja una o dos veces al mes de acuerdo a la demanda que tenga de sus productos. Lo que mas vende es interiores y ropa de damas.

Este crédito lo va emplear justamente en comprar interiores y ropa de damas ya que tiene algunos pedidos.
 
Hace 4 ciclos es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la comodidad para pagar sus cuotas.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que viven en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Sequita belongs to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in the province of Manabí. Its inhabitants are hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. Ketty is 30 years old and has been married for 13 years. She has two 12-year-old twins and a beautiful 5-year-old daughter who are her reason for living and the reason she strives to get ahead in life. Her husband is a street vendor and sells aromatic waters in Manta. Ketty sells costume jewelry, clothing, and women’s undergarments. On weekends, she travels around for 5 to 6 hours selling her products. The rest of the week she works with her husband in Manta. Depending on the demand for her products, she travels to Guayaquil one or two times a month to buy merchandise. She sells mostly undergarments and women’s clothing. She will use this loan to buy undergarments and women’s clothing as she already has some orders. She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 loan cycles and likes the convenience of making her payments. Her dream is to have her own home as she presently lives with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy undergarments and women's clothing.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur S. is single and currently lives with his mother, brother, and sister-in-law. After having served in the Army, Artur needed to find his way in life, to make a stable living, to have his own place, and plan for a family. He decided to import elegant ladies clothing from the US. He is renting a shop in “Hayastan” trade center and has long-standing customers, offering them both good service and quality clothing. Artur has applied for a loan to purchase new inventory and expand his business.

loans.use: new clothing inventory

loans.name: Jessy Mabel

texts.es: La señora Jessy Mabel, es casada se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, además que distribuye de manera ambulante cosméticos, vestuario y calzado. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 5 años, ya que en ese tiempo no tenía un medio de ingreso ahora tiene su propio negocio. Empezó vendiéndole ropa y cosméticos a ciertas personas y poco a poco fue haciéndose de un buen inventario. Comentaba la señora, que algo que ella hace ahora es que solamente vende al contado, ya que muchas personas a las que les había otorgado crédito no le pagaron. Este préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra de  productos variados, principalmente para cubrir unos pedidos de cosméticos que actualmente posee. Su meta siempre ha sido tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Jessy Mabel is married and sells general merchandise; she’s also an itinerant cosmetics, clothing and footwear merchant.  She started the business five years ago because back then she did not have a source of income but now she has her own business.

She started out selling clothes and cosmetics to certain people and gradually acquired a good inventory.  She was telling us that something she does now is selling only for cash because many of the people she’d sold to on credit did not repay.

This loan will be used to buy assorted merchandise, especially to cover some pending cosmetics orders she has to fill.  

Her goal has always been to own a house.

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise, cosmetics in particular.

loans.name: Wilda

texts.es:
Wilda pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Wilda tiene 32 años, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con las del pequeño negocio de venta de comida. Hace varios años que empezó este negocio y con un poco de capital pero ahora, ella tiene un restaurante que está equipado con las necesidades básicas como por ejemplo una cocina, mesas, sillas y muchas cosas más. Wilda desprende una imagen de una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Wilda que espera recibir S/. 500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea pagar unas  cuotas del terreno que compro a crédito. 
 
Wilda se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Wilda belongs to the communal bank "Mosoc Killa," which is part of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She lives in the same city.  Cusco is an enchanting city that dates back to the time of the Incas which was built upon the base of an ancient Incan city.

Wilda is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children from this marriage.  She alternates her activities between caring for her home and for her small business selling food.  She started this business a number of years ago with a small amount of capital, but now she has a restaurant that is set up with all of the basic requirements including a kitchen, tables, chairs, and many other things.  Wilda comes across as a hardworking and responsible mother.  With her next loan, Wilda hopes to receive 500 Peruvian soles.  At this moment, she wants to make some payments on some land that she bought on credit.

Wilda is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and is therefore committed to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: she wants to make some payments on land that she bought on credit.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith O. is 38 years old and married to Kennedy Lukale. They have two children, aged 13 years and 9 years. They live in the Khiwisero area in Kakamega.

Judith has a business of selling second-hand clothes and has been in this business for the past year. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend. She wants to use the money to buy several bales of clothes to add to her stock. The profits made will be used to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to be able to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: Buy several bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of twelve people who live in Reang Dek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chea S., 39 years old, was selected as the village bank president by its members. All members of this village group will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Chea S. is a grocery seller in the local village. Since her grocery business is going well, she wants to expand it and so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries. She also breeds pigs at home. Her husband, Mr. Touch Bunthorn, 41 years old, is a motorbike repairer who is able to earn a small income to support his family. With their occupations, this couple is able to earn some profit to support their four children. One of the children helps with the mother's businesses and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat S. is 49 years old and widowed with one son. Rahat worked as a schoolteacher and is known as a very precise and hardworking person. In 2001, after the death of her husband, she became the only breadwinner for her small family. In order to find an additional means of subsistence,  Rahat started her own business in the reselling of fancies. 

She started with the initial sum of only 1,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) and managed to raise her floating capital to 15,000 KGS.  Now Rahat needs to develop her business and plans to use this loan of 30,000 KGS for widening her assortment of goods. It will allow her to broaden her business and pay for her son’s education. Also, Rahat is a very attentive daughter and revenues from this loan will allow her to support her parents with larger maintenance.  Rahat is a very optimistic person who sets a goal and makes every effort to reach it. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Fanni Jovita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ÑAUPASUNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fanni Jovita; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de bisutería como collares, aretes y pulseras, ella trabaja en forma independiente llevando a diferentes tiendas que venden bisutería, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de bisutería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los aretes, collares y pulseras.                     
                                  
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fanni Jovita is a member of the “ÑAUPASUNCHIS” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Fanni Jovita is 36 years old, single and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling costume jewelry such as necklaces, earrings and bracelets.  She works independently, taking her products to different stores that sell jewelry.  She would like to expand her jewelry business.  She is requesting this loan to buy materials for making earrings, necklaces and bracelets.

Fanni Jovita is pleased to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials for making earrings, necklaces and bracelets

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her clothes-selling business. She buys clothes from Faisalabad which is known for its textile industry and sells them in her local city. She comes from Okara, a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Faisal Mahmood for the past 8 years. Her husband works abroad. 

Azra has given birth to 3 children. Her eldest daughter is in class one while the others are too young to attend school. As her husband is abroad, all the household responsibilities fall on her shoulders. She is managing these responsibilities with great courage and playing her role as a mother and a housewife very well. 

She is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her business and she will be able to make more profits due to bulk purchasing that will allow her to offer her customers more variety. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Azra.

loans.use: To buy clothes for business

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Men K. L., 56, lives in the Preaek Andoung village in Kandal province, She is the group leader for this loan, having been selected by the other members. The members of this group will use their portions to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Men K. L. is single, and she is a farmer. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice that she sells to support herself. In order to support this farming, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide and to hire laborers to plow her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticide and hire laborers to plow her farm

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario T. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old. Apolinario is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Apolinario owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Apolinario has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Apolinario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Apolinario is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Apolinario from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Wilton Jose

texts.es: El Sr S. labora como cajero promotor  es  soltero, tiene un hijos a su cargo,   es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para  comprar materiales bloque ,cemento ,estribo, clavo, hierro y mano de obra, para construir  baño y servicio higiénico de  su vivienda para un mejor nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en: Mr S. works as a cashier and salesman.  He is single and has one child in his care.  This is the first loan that he has received from CEPRODEL.  He is grateful for the support that they are giving him with this loan which he will use to buy blocks, cement, braces, nails and iron, and to pay workmen to build a bathroom in his home.  This will improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To improve his home.

loans.name: Adith

texts.es:
La Sra. Adith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara II”, del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín. Está casada, tiene 52 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen D. ella y están estudiando.

Su gran habilidad para los negocios, su anhelo D. cumplir sus sueños y con la ayuda D. su esposo, empredió el negocio del comercio minorista, ofreciendo a su distinguida clientela desD. prendas D. vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, hasta libros y guías D. estudio. Nos cuenta que tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar.  En compañía D. su esposo, se trasladan por diferentes calles y avenidas a repartir y ofrecer sus productos, esta contenta y orgullosa por su trabajo.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará mercadería como: Libros, cuadernos, ropa D. 1ra y 2da mano, entre otros.

Adith manifestó que se siente con muchas fuerzas y aliento D. seguir adelante, le gusta mucho trabajar  y está  muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven, tanto como mujeres y pequeñas empresarias.

En la foto la vemos junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Sra. Adith is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Bárbara II” in the District of Tarapoto in San Martín Province. She is 52 years old, married, and has two dependent children who are in school.

With her good business skills and the help of her husband, Adith started a small retail establishment so that she could fulfill her dreams. She offers her distinguished clientele everything from clothes for women, men, and children to books and study guides. Adith says that she has established customers who come by her house on a daily basis to shop. Along with her husband, she travels along different streets and avenues to deliver and sell her products. Adith is very happy and proud of her work.

With this loan of 3000 PEN, she will buy merchandise such as books, notebooks, new and used clothing, and other products. Adith says she has a great amount of strength and encouragement to move forward. She enjoys her work and expresses her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop as both women and small entrepreneurs in the communities where they live. Both Adith and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase books, notebooks, new and used clothing, and other products.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: La Señora Genoveva y su esposo el Sr. Roberto viven en la zona D. kupini que esta ubicada a 30 minutos del centro D. la ciudad D. la paz. Ellos tienen un taller D. confección D. calzados D. cholitas y trabajan D. esta forma desD. hace más D. 20 años. Sus hijos ya son mayores y son independientes, así que ahora destinan los ingresos D. su actividad en la construcción D. su casa. Las señoras D. pollera esta ciudad utilizan este tipo D. calzado el cual está compuesto principalmente por plástico y charol con suela y una planta D. goma.                                                                                                         El Sr. Roberto realiza los calzados y doña Genoveva los venD. en distintos lugares D. la ciudad e inclusive tienen clientes en la cuidad D. el alto,     Ellos trabajan con emprender desD. varios años atrás y durante todo este tiempo demostraron ser clientes muy responsables y puntuales con sus cuotas D. pago D. sus cuotas, con el dinero del crédito compraran materiales  para la confección D. sus calzados como plástico y pegamento que es la clefa, está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
