texts.en:
Genoveva and her husband Roberto live in Kupini which is located 30 minutes from La Paz city center.  They have a workshop where they make traditional women's footwear.  They have been in this business for more than 20 years.  Genoveva's children are already grown up and live independently so she now uses the income from her business to build her home.

The ladies in this city who wear traditional, regional skirts wear this kind of footwear which is maD. mainly from plastic and patent leather with a rubber sole.  Roberto makes the shoes and Genoveva sells them in different parts of the city.  They even have customers in the city of El Alto.  The couple have been working with Emprender for several years and during this time they have shown themselves to be very responsible clients who are punctual in making their loan repayments.  They will use their loan money to buy materials for making their shoes such as plastic and adhesive (clefa).  Genoveva is very grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy plastic, PVC and 'clefa' (an adhesive)

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a twenty-eight year old hard working man and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in passion fruits for ten years. He started with a capital of 200,000 shillings and now has 900,000 shilling as working capital. His hardship is changes in market prices and his vision is having an orchard and having a family.

loans.use: to buy bags of passion fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He has been working as a construction worker since 2007, specializing in completing wall foliage jobs. He has eight years of experience in this field. His work is well-accomplished and prepared in modern ways. He would like to increase his income in order to better support his family financially. With his loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will buy construction tools and supplies. He will also invest in purchasing scaffolding needed in order to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 14 years. He is 51 years old and married to Monicah. They have four children who are all school going.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds, a dairy cow and fertilizer.

In the future, Joseph hopes to become a leading dairy farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pepper Sellers Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you members of the “Pepper Sellers” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Zainab is the leader of this group. Zainab is a 45-year-old, married woman with 5 children: 1 in primary school, 3 in secondary school and 1 adult. Zainab sells pepper, onions, salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She has been doing this business for 15 years now. Zainab is going to use her share of the loan to buy bags of pepper, bags of onions, and bags of salt to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of pepper, bags of onions, and bags of salt to add to her business.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Mrs. Sek is a 59-year-old woman, married to Mr. Chhoun; both of them work on their farm. They can use their farmland to produce crops at least twice a year according to the season (the rainy season or the dry season). The couple has  spent much time working in the field and is making an average of $5 per day to cover expenses such as food, education, utilities, and so on. 

They have four children, one of whom is employed in the sewing department of a factory. 

Mrs. Sek will be using part of her loan for her husband to buy a motor-trailer to provide transport for people who need to go to the market or elsewhere. With the remaining funds she will purchase several items for resale.

loans.use: to buy a motor-trailer and to purchase several items for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Mary is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 30 years. She employs 3 farmhands and sells her produce of bananas, vegetables and maize to the local market. She is married with 7 children, two of whom are currently attending school.

She has requested a loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her meet her family's basic needs. The fluctuating weather patterns and lack of stable market for farm produce have been her greatest challenges. She plans to acquire more dairy cows in future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Elekber

texts.en:
Elekber is a cattle breeder with 10 years of experience. He is married and has two children. He usually buys small calves to raise and fatten them. After five or six months, he resells the cattle at the local livestock bazaar. His monthly profit it 300 USD.  Cattle breeding is only one source of income for Elekber`s family. 

Lending services from AqroInvest CU have fostered the expansion of his small venture. Now he has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more cattle and increase his monthly profit. This will allow Elekber to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 52 years old and married to Samuel.  She supports four members of the family. Her husband helps her in farming, hence increasing the income for the family. Her children are  15, 13, and 11 years old, respectively. .She does farming and she has been in business for 26 years. Her monthly income from the business is KES 5,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit. This is her second loan and she successfully paid her previous loan.

Her dreams and hopes are to continue with her farming and to educate her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy seeds and  fertilizer

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, la señora Karla Patricia  se ha caracterizado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y se desempeña como secretaria ejecutiva en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace nueve años. Es soltero y con cuatro personas a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias a su familia. 

La señora Karla Patricia  ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tale como zinc, perlines y pago de mano de obra, para cambiar el techo que se encuentra en mal estado en su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Managua, Karla Patricia is known for being a very hardworking woman.  She works as an executive assistant in a state institution, which she has done for nine years now.  She is single and has four dependent family members for whom she provides all necessities.  

Karla Patricia has come to Ceprodel in order to ask for a loan to improve the condition of her home.  She plans to buy construction materials such as corrugated iron and roofing beams, and to pay for labor to replace the roof of her house, which is in bad shape.  This building work will allow her to offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mayleen

texts.en:
At her young age of 22, Mayleen has been blessed with two children ages three and four years. Mayleen's spouse is an institutional worker in a public hospital.

Mayleen is a hardworking mother and wants to help her husband with household expenses. She wakes up early and goes to the market to buy the supplies needed for her food-selling business. Then she starts preparing, cooking and selling street food such as fish, chicken and meat balls, hot dogs, and boiled eggs. She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. and at the same time cares for her children. With the income she generates from the business, she is able to pay electric bills and buy clothes for her children. 

Mayleen is asking for a loan of P11,000 to buy ingredients such as soy sauce, vinegar, and oil needed in cooking street foods and help boost her profit. 

Mayleen wants to educate her children and earn a degree for a brighter future someday.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as soy sauce, vinegar, and oil needed in cooking street foods.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Rocio; tiene 23 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad; la socia esta dentro del rubro de comerciantes minorista, la socia compra y vende ropa ella trae de la ciudad de Puno específicamente de Juliaca al por mayor de las fabricas y los vende de forma independiente a sus clientes y amistades. La socia tiene sus contactos y desea seguir creciendo para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa ella también viajara con ese dinero.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Rocio belongs to the “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life) Communal Bank.  It is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Custo department.  Rocio is 23 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage.  She has two children, ages five and three.

She is a retail merchant.  She buys and sells clothes that she gets wholesale from factories in the city of Puno, specifically from Juliaca.  She sells the clothes in an independent manner to her customers and friends.  She has her contacts, and she wants to continue growing in order to give her children a better quality of life.

She is requesting the loan to buy clothes.  She will also use this money to travel.

She is grateful for the support that she will receive, and she pledges to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy clothes and to travel.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebat, 35, is a transportation driver and lives with his two children and wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Kherlen town of Dornod, a province of Mongolia. He has been running a transportation business since 2001 and has gained a lot of experience. With the initial business earnings, he bought a small-sized land and a small, old house. But since past few years, his income has been declining due to fewer job orders.

Last summer, he started to rebuild his old house but couldn't finish due to lack of money to buy the building materials, specifically cement, bricks and iron-pipes. His previous house was very old and absolutely in unlivable condition. Erdenebat is trying to finish rebuilding his house before winter starts and hence is asking for a loan to purchase some building materials.

loans.use: purchase building materials to finish rebuilding his house

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is a high school graduate and never entered college due to her parents being poor. Right now, she is 44 years old and operating her sari-sari (variety) store. She was already married and blessed with five children. Though she suffers difficulty in sending them all to school, she still pursues working hard for the sake of their education.

She wants to save for her children, so she is asking for additional working capital amounting to 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy pepper, Vetsin (monosodium glutamate), salt, breads and soft drinks. She hopes that through this, she could earn higher profits to save. This might be a way to provide for the needs of her children in school. By then, they could finish their education and achieve their dreams. She hopes they will then help uplift their existing living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed in cooking -- pepper, Vetsin (monosodium glutamate), salt -- and breads and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sandra Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca y de allí su nombre.

En este lugar conocimos a  la señora Sandra, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre  de la cual tiene  4 hijos de 11, 9, 6 y 3 años de edad, el mayor este año empezó a estudiar en colegio y los dos pequeños estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer realiza fletes en su carro.

Doña Sandra con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, vende  productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja todos los días, ella aprovecha las mañanas cuando sus hijos están en  la escuela para realizar sus ventas y en las tardes se dedica a ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas de la escuela, deja a crédito sus productos y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva más de tres años dedicada a esta actividad comercial y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio del banco  y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos. 

Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The “Caminantes de Cristo” communal bank meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Portoviejo in a sector known as Las Piedras.  This place is known because it’s near a rock quarry, hence its name.

We met Sandra, 31, here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 11, 9, 6 and 3 years of age.  The eldest started secondary school this year and the two younger ones go to elementary school.  Her husband is a driver; he transports freight in his vehicle.

To earn her own income, Sandra is a merchant.  She sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume and accessories).  She sells door to door and works every day.  She takes advantage of mornings while her children are at school to do her sales and in the afternoon she helps her children do their homework.  She sells on credit and collects payment every weekend.  She’s been in this commercial activity for more than three years and she’s done quite well.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.  She’s been in the communal bank almost since its beginning and she likes it because of the help she’s been given with the loans.  Her dream is to see her children complete their schooling and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Sonunbubu

texts.ru: Сонунбубу – 51 год, вдова и имеет четырех детей. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1989 году Сонунбубу начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Сонунбубу смогла развить свое хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день 2 коровы, 10 овец, 10 коз и 2 лошади и приносящее ежемесячно около 5,000 сом. Прибыль Сонунбубу вложила в высшее образование для своих детей, сумев дать возможность приобрести профессию преподавателя английского языка и юриста для своих дочерей,  и военного офицера  - для сына. Ее младший сын Уланбек решил остаться с матерью и помогать ей по хозяйству, так как после смерти мужа Сонунбубу ее престарелая свекровь осталась жить вместе с этой семьей.    В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Сонунбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 133,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота в будущем.
texts.en: Sonunbubu is 51 years old, a widow and has four children.  In search of a source of income for her family, Sonunbubu started her own animal husbandry business in 1989.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Sonunbubu was able to develop her business to contain two cows, ten sheep, ten goats and two horses today and yielding about 5,000 som per month.  Sonunbubu invested the profit into the higher education for her children, enabling her daughters to become and English language teacher and a lawyer and her son to become a military officer.  Her youngest son, Ulanbek, decided to stay with his mother and help her with the business because Sonunbubu's elderly mother-in-law decided to continue living with her family after Sonunbubu's husband's death.  In order to further expand her business, Sonunbubu requested a loan in the sum of 133,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase bulls for fattening up and resale.  She plans to use the profit from this loan to increase livestock quantity in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is a 28 year old, married man from Gaza. Noor owns a supermarket in Gaza. He hopes that, through this loan, he would be able to expand the size of the store and improve it. He believes that this will help him live a better life, financially.

loans.use: to expand the size of the store and improve it

loans.name: Khwaka Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Khwaka Group in Western Kenya! Phylis is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Phylis takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Phylis had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Phylis was only able to harvest 3.5 bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Phylis and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Phylis will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of the Khwaka group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kounawolow Group

texts.fr:
Mme AWA SOPHIE  est la représentante du groupe KOUNAWOLOW. Elle est veuve  et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 16ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle est restauratrice et vend des layettes pour bébé et d’autres objets tels que : des ensembles plateau et verres de table etc. depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne à  la cité AN II et à Larlé en ville .Ses clients sont les voisins, les passagers, les invitations pour les fêtes ; baptêmes et mariages.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac  de riz de 50kg, 01 bidon d’huile de 05l, 02 grosse boites de tomate et charger sa bouteille de gaz pour la préparation.

 Avec ses bénéfices, elle prend soin d’elle même et aussi de son plus jeune enfant. Elle ambitionne construire une petite maison pour son activité et assurer la scolarité de son enfant pour lui assurer un meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
AWA SOPHIE is the representative of the KOUNAWOLOW group. She is a widow and the mother of five children. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 16 years old. One of her children attends school. She has two people to support.

She has a restaurant and, for the past 15 years, has been selling baby clothes and other objects such as sets of trays and glassware, etc. She gets her supplies from the AN II and Larlé sections of town. Her customers include neighbors, travelers, and invitations for parties, baptisms and marriages.

She wants to buy one 50kg bag of rice, one 5L can of oil, two large cans of tomatoes, and to fill her gas cylinder to prepare the food.

With her profits, she takes care of herself as well as her youngest child. She hopes to build a little house for her business and to send her child to school in order to ensure a better future for him.

loans.use: to buy one 50kg bag of rice, one 5L can of oil, two big cans of tomatoes, and fill her gas cylinder for preparation

loans.name: Madine

texts.en:
Madine is 34 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 14. Her business is clean and doing well. She sells various goods such as cooking oil, vegetables, tomatoes, etc. Madine has eight years experience in this business. Her business is open from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on Sunday.

Madine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as cooking oil, vegetables, tomatoes, etc. to sell. With any profit from the loan, Madine will expand her business. Madine hopes also to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cooking oil, vegetables, tomatoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maria Lucinda

texts.es:
María, vive con dos hijos de 19 y 16 años de edad, además vive con su esposo, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, trabaja a tiempo completo porque lo tiene instalado en su propia casa.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como azúcar, frijoles, huevos, sal, entre otros, esta inversión le brindara un crecimiento al negocio y mejorara su atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de María es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, para que se superen y tengan mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
María lives with two children who are 19 and 16 years of age; she also lives with her husband.  She runs a general store.  The business arose from her own initiative.  She works full-time because it’s home-based.

She is asking for a loan at present to buy merchandise like sugar, beans, eggs and salt, among others.  This investment will provide growth for the business and improve her customer service.

María’s hope is that her children stay in school so that they will improve themselves and have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, eggs and salt.

loans.name: Maelewano Zomboko Group

texts.en:
Chelestina, who is in her early 30s, is a divorcee with one child who goes to school. She has been running a pharmacy business since 2006. She works from 7:30 am to 9:00 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees and household expenses, pay for her plot of land, and increase her medicine stock. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan now to increase her medicine stock. Her dream is to one day be able to take her child to good schools.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Maelewano Zomboko," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Roi De Paix Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ROI DE PAIX est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Colette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, a très peu fréquentée l’école et à appris la coiffure. Colette est âgée de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Colette est mariée à un agent de sécurité du nom de Alain. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Colette vend à son domicile des produits divers, des produits cosmétiques, du charbon de bois et des cartes de recharges. de façon secondaire, Colette fait la coiffure. Colette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre

loans.use: Acheter des produits vivriers et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widowed woman , and has seven  children. She has owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a fruit  selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges perish ability in her business.
With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits like oranges ,water melon ,bananas, mangoes and avocados  for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits like oranges ,water melon ,bananas, mangoes and avocados

loans.name: Atamoglan

texts.en:
Atamoglan was born in 1960 in Salyan region Yenikand village,  has 5 children. He has his own business. He has been in this business for 5 years and it allows him to support to his family. He is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person.
He applies for a loan amount of $700 to buy the foodstuffs and the manufactured goods

loans.use: To buy the foodstuffs and the manufactured goods

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the five women of the Jappoo association, led by Rose N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“This business is located in the village of Yoff. It is managed by a group of highly motivated people who are active in the local trading business. The Jappoo group’s objective is to improve the living conditions of its members, to have the financial means to provide for their children’s education and health care … [We seek] the financial means which will allow us to buy cloth in countries such as Mali and Mauritania, and resell it in Dakar and in the other big cities of the country.”

Original French business description:

«Présentation du contexte du projet : Le projet se situ dans l’éco village de yoff. Il regroupe des personnes animées de bonne volonté qui s’activent dans les activités commerciales

- Objectif du prêt : Le groupement Jappoo a pour objectif, d’améliorer les conditions de vie des ses membres ; - de pouvoir avoir les moins d’assurer la scolarité de leurs enfant et de leurs prise en charge médicales.

-Activités : Comment comptez-vous les mener afin de pouvoir rembourser le prêt sans aucune difficulté : Notre activité principale est : le commerce ; il s’agit de trouver les moyens financiers nous permettant de pouvoir acheter des tissus dans les pays comme le Mali, La Mauritanie etc.…. Et les revendre à Dakar et les autre grandes villes du pays.»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of Bassin and Batik cloth from neighboring countries and transportation to market in Dakar

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Miss Phuong is 41 and her husband is 51 years old. They have 4 children between the ages of 16 and 9. Their 2 daughters had to stop going to school because they don’t have money to pay tuition for their children. Their family does not have any land for cultivation. Her husband, Mr. Duong, works as a daily laborer, but only has work for 6 months in the dry season. Miss Phuong sells bread and rice spaghetti at the local market. Average income is at low $8/person/month. She wants to borrow a loan of $50 for her selling and she will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Buy supplies to increase her business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is married, mother of three children who are in school. She is an active member of Rurii Mwimuto women group. She has a salon business which is the only source of income and she is able to educate her children through the income she generates. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. Elizabeth would like to buy varieties of hair chemicals and makeup materials for her salon. She is applying a loan to be able to buy them at once then she will be repaying her loan on monthly basis

loans.use: Gladys would like to buy beauty and hair products for her salon

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
Maria is a wife and mother to three children, and since she was a little girl, she has been helping her mother with making and selling pastries. Four years ago she began her own business in order to support her husband since he had been unemployed and they needed income to support their children. Since her husband didn't have a job, he began to help with the business and the sale of the pastries and they have very successfully increased their business.

Maria is asking for a loan of $375 USD to buy the primary ingredients for a term of six months to purchase and be able to go forward with her business and continue supporting her family, and thanks to the support of the loans she can do so.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es una mujer casada y tiene tres hijos, desde pequeña ayudaba a su madre a la elaboración y venta de donas y al crecer hace cuatro años atrás siguió su negocio de venta de donas por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo ya que se había quedado sin empleo y se necesitaban ingresos para mantener a sus tres hijos y como su esposo no tenia empleo empezó a apoyarla en el negocio de venta de donas para poder incrementar las ventas logrando con éxito incrementarlas.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 375 para la compra de materia prima en un plazo de 6 meses para pagar y poder seguir adelante con su negocio y poder seguir manteniendo a su familia, agradece el apoyo que le brindas para poder seguir adelante con el negocio.

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the interior appearance of her home

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is the treasurer for her lending group in the village of Lugazi. She is 46, widowed with 7 children, and she cares for 2 orphans. She has what is referred to as a mobile business and is also referred to as a hawker. She sells children’s clothes, door nets (many people do not have doors to their homes, just nets) and second hand clothes. As a hawker, she carries her wares around markets, taxi parks, and other congested areas, selling only what she can carry.

Edith has been in this business for ten years and a member of her lending group for 9 years. To get her inventory, she will travel one and a half hours to Kampala. She will go to the market where she will buy bales of used clothing. Bales would be like a gunny sack full or a wired bundle of hundreds of items of used clothing. She is not allowed to inspect, so she must know her contact. She will load up the bale, often strapped on the back of a matatoo, or taxi van, and head home. There she will sort and hang her clothes on a pole and head out to sell “on the street” of her village.

As Edith is getting older, she dreams of one day having enough money to pay the rent for a store front so that she can operate out of one place. For now, she plans on using her loan to buy more bales to sell as a hawker.

loans.use: Edith plans to use her loan to purchase bales of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elidia

texts.es:
Elidia is tenacious about getting ahead. She is a member of the community bank "Corazones Valientes II" (Courageous Hearts) in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo. She lives in the San Martín region in the province of San Martín. Her business is located on the street Jr. Grau, on the corner of Jr, Ramírez Hurtado, across from the Plaza de Armas. She works selling the fruits of the region, such as oranges, mandarins, papaya, bananas, chirimoya and cocona, both fruits indigenous to Peru, and other types of fruit.

With this loan of 1,000 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy fruit by the hundreds. With the capital she will continue buying little by little, to always have fresh fruit to sell during the 6 months in which she will be repaying her loan.

Elidia is 49 years old. She has worked tirelessly into the evening since she was 12, including tending to deliveries to her clients' homes. From her business she actively participates in the local Juvenile Patrol , working to fight delinquency in the area around the Plaza de Armas.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elidia es una mujer luchadora y socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones Valientes II” del Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo. Vive en la región San Martín, provincia de San Martín. El negocio está ubicado en Jr. Grau (esquina con Jr. Ramírez Hurtado y frente a la plaza de Armas). Se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales como naranjas, mandarinas, papaya, plátanos, chirimoya, cocona y otros.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará frutas en cientos y poco a poco con el capital que tiene seguirá comprando, porque sino se malogran las frutas durante los seis meses en el cual tendrá que pagar su crédito.

Elidia tiene 49 años, desde las 12 del día trabaja incansablemente hasta la noche, incluso atiende los pedidos a domicilio que le hacen sus clientes y también desde su negocio participa activamente el la Patrulla Juvenil del Cercado de Tarapoto resguardando de la delincuencia la zona de la Plaza.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy S. is 35 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Lagos State. She sells weavon, attachments and provisions. She has been in her business since 1987 and needs the loan amount of $775 to buy more attachments and weavon for sale.

loans.use: To buy more weaveon and attachments for sale

loans.name: Dania

texts.es:
Mrs. Dania lives in Laureles Norte, a poor, semi-rural neighborhood, where basic needs such as water are scarse. Many of the villagers are people with low socio-economic needs. Dania lives with her two children, 8 and 21 years old, and her husband who works as a driver. She works as a counselor at a bus depot where she is allowed to sell soda in order to support herself and her family. These parents have been improving the infrastructure of their home thanks to the financing they've received through. They have been able to improve their living conditions and improved their family's way of life. Their house does not have a floor, it is just bare concrete. For this reason Dania hopes to tile her living room floor, the local brick store will give her a wholesale price and this will help with her kids' health. She will also be happy because she will have a prettier looking house.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dania vive en los Laureles Norte, un barrio pobre, semirural, en donde existe escasez de los servicios básicos como el agua, los pobladores son en su gran mayoría de escasos recursos económicos. La señora habita con sus 2 hijos de 8 y 21 años y con su esposo, quien trabaja como conductor en una casa particular y ella se desempeña como conserje en una cooperativa de buses en donde le permiten vender gaseosas y refrescos para ayudarse, ambas actividades le permiten sobrevivir y mantener a sus hijos. Estos padres han ido mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda por medio de financiamientos que han obtenido y con lo que han ido elevando el nivel de vida de su familia. La vivienda no cuenta con piso, sino que es embaldosada con cemento, por lo cual la señora desea poner en la sala de su vivienda piso rojo nacional que es elaborado en un negocio conocido del barrio, el tener la opción de comprar a precio económico estos ladrillos le permitirá mas limpieza y aseo en su vivienda factor importante para la salud de sus hijos y realizara el sueño de ver su casita mas bonita.

loans.use: Purchase of bricks for her home's floor

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 32 years old and is married with 1 child, age 8. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 3. Angelina is a cloth and shoes seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 7:30 AM to 5:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Madeleyni

texts.es:
At 22 years old, Madeleyni is an enterprising and very responsible young mother. Since she was a teenager she has worked as a temporary cosmetics seller. But now that she is a mother and has more responsibility, she has decided to convert this business into her main source of family income. Currently she sells products to her neighbors, friends, relatives, and to anyone who wants to place orders for cosmetics. Because of her charisma and talents for persuasion, dedication and devotion, she has had the satisfaction of earning a considerable percentage for every product she sells. Madeleyni’s wish is to have more products in stock. She believes that making this investment will enable her to provide products upon request and thus improve her sales.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Madeleyni de 22 años de edad, es madre joven emprendedora y muy responsable. Desde adolescente se dedicó a vender productos cosméticos en forma eventual, pero ahora que ya es madre y tiene una gran responsabilidad ha decidido convertir este negocio en su principal sustento familiar. Actualmente ofrece sus productos a sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y a todas aquellas personas que desean adquirir sus cosméticos por pedidos, gracias a su carisma, don de persuasión, dedicación y entrega tiene la satisfacción de obtener un considerado porcentaje de ganancias por cada producto que vende.El deseo de Madeleyni es tener más productos en stock, ella considera que haciendo esta inversión podrá ofrecer sus productos al instante y así mejorar sus ventas.

loans.use: Additional capital for acquiring a greater quantity of products

loans.name: Munirahon

texts.en: Munirahon M. is 22 years old and has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004. When she started her business, she sold clothing door to door, but now she sells children's clothing at the local bazaar. She does very well there and has lots of customers because she imports her clothing from China, which gives her a significant cost advantage over her competitors.  Mrs. M.  has applied for a loan from Kiva to meet the demands of her customers and buy new seasonal apparel. She will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: to import new seasonal clothing

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov C. (shown in the picture with her daughter), 42, and her husband, Mr. Pich Pin, 36, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Their oldest daughter is a silk weaver and two of the children are in a local school.

Mrs. Sreypov has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Pich is a hairdresser in the village.

Sreypov is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material for her weaving business and to buy a hairdresser’s chair for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and buy a hairdresser’s chair for her husband

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru:
Nuriddin G. lives in the city of Yavan. He is married and has five children. He has been working in animal husbandry for two years. He buys young calves, fattens them up, and resells them at the market. This business produces an income, but additional financing is necessary to develop the business further. Therefore, he has decided to take out a loan for 12 months. Once he receives the loan, he can buy two more young calves for fattening and sell them in autumn.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Гафуров Нуриддин житель города Яван. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Уже два года занимается животноводством. Скупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на базаре.Бизнес дает доход , но для того , чтобы развивать бизнес ему необходимо дополнительное финансирование . Поэтому он решил получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Получив кредит он сможет купить еще двух молодых телят для откормки и к осени их продать.

loans.use: Purchasing livestock

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.en: K. Bibigul is 42 years old. She is divorced with a daughter age 16 who is in school. Bibigul started her business because she needed extra income to pay for household and personal expenses and to afford her home. She has been selling women shoes for ten years and enjoys her work.  She would like to add new seasonal stock to her inventory. She requests a loan of 4100 Somoni (1200 USD), which she is promising to repay over 10 months. With your help, she can earn more and to meet her only daughter’s school expenses. Bibigul would like to express her gratitude for everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to expand the business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Agée de 34 ans, dame A. Adjo est mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle a pour activité, la vente du charbon de bois et du bois de chauffe dans le quartier d’Agoè situé à 12km du centre ville de Lomé. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 6 ans et tire un revenu pour pouvoir accompagner son mari qui est un tailleur dans les dépenses de la famille.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 17 sacs du charbon de bois et 2 tas du bois de chauffe afin de reconstituer son stock pour mieux vendre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo A., 34, is married and the mother of four children, all enrolled in school. Her business is selling charcoal and firewood in the Agoè district, located 12 km from downtown Lomé. She has been in this business for more than 6 years and it creates income to help her husband, who is a tailor, with the family's living expenses.

She is asking for this, her first loan to purchase 17 sacks of charcoal and two heaps of firewood so that she can expand her inventory and make more sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Hagah

texts.en:
Hagah K. has a junior high education, she's married, and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a sprayer. Hagah has been selling groceries like Milo, milk, and others at Zion in Cape Coast since 2001.

Hagah uses her income to pay for school fees and utility bills. Hagah will use the loan ($700.00) to purchase a variety of groceries to fulfill her customers' needs. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hagah plans to help her husband pay for their children's education.

loans.use: Purchase groceries and sauce pans

loans.name: Avaz

texts.ru: Хайдаров Аваз житель Варзобского района. Недавно женился . Свадьбу сыграли во дворе у родителей. Живет у родителей.  Имеет высшее образование. По профессии экономист.Работает водителем микроавтобуса марки "Тангем".Планируемый кредит хочет использовать для ремонта микроавтобуса. Погасить кредит погасит в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Avaz H. lives in the Varzob district. Recently married, he lives at his parents’ home, where his wedding was also held. He has a higher education and is an economist by profession; however, he works as a driver for a Tangem shuttle bus. Avaz wants to use this loan to repair his shuttle bus. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shuttle bus repair

loans.name: Catana

texts.en:
Catana P. is 54 years old, and she lives in Basarabeasca district, Carabetovca village, in the Republic of Moldova. Her family has 2.64 hectares of agricultural land, plus an additional 0.5 hectares of agricultural land which belongs to her parents. She has been working this land since 2001, though she does not have technical agricultural skills; instead, much of the technical work is carried out by skilled workers from the village, even though she participates in much of the manual labor.

Next year she wants to plant many vine varieties. As a result, she is seeking a loan through MicroInvest in order to purchase vine grafts and cuttings.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing 700 cuttings of vines

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en: Sarun M., age 35, is married and lives with her husband and five of her children in Battambang province. She and her husband are fish sellers and make a combined income of around US $2.5 a day. Five of their children are students. Mrs. Sarun M. will use this loan to increase the quantity of fish that she resells at market.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of fish to resell at market.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is 50 years old and already a widow. She has three children: Evincent – 28 years old, high school graduate; Visie – 21 years old, also a high school graduate who works as a saleslady; and the youngest is Eduardo – 17 years old, a fourth year high school student.

Joselyn aims to send her youngest child to college but she worries if she can afford all his educational expenses so she decided to maintain her hog-raising business. She is thankful that her two children are supporting her financially in their household needs and an allowance for her son. Her family lives in the rural village of Paragu Tumauini, Isabela.

Joselyn would like to request a loan of PHP 4,000 to sustain her hog-raising business. She also intends to use the loan to venture into another business which is a rice-retailing business. She plans to buy one sack of rice and different kinds of vegetables and native snacks. She carefully budgets her income in order to support their family and her son's studies. She is hoping to improve her small businesses in their village. “Do not do unto others what you do not want others to do unto you”, this is the passage that motivates Joselyn to do good things for other people especially for her neighbors.

loans.use: To start a rice-retailing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To procure electrical goods.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Monica es soltera, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Monica junto a su mama tiene una tienda en un local alquilado, en donde ella realiza trabajos de impresiones, serigrafía en bolsas, papeles, de manera artesanal. Además Monica vende calzados a pedido.
Monica necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tintas, mallas.
Los sueños de Mónica son mejorar la calidad de producción, ampliar su negocio y brindar todo lo necesario a su hija.
texts.en:
Monica is a member of the “Florecer” (“To Flower”) cooperative bank. Monica is single, 29 years old, and has one child. Together with her mother, she tends to a store at a rented location where she provides services such as copying, screen- printing onto bags, papers, and handcrafts. In addition, Monica sells footwear on order. Monica needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest into the purchase of dyes, mesh. Monica’s dreams are to improve the quality of her product, to expand her business, and to provide for her daughter’s every need.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of dyes, mesh.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Mrs. Juliana D. is 47 years old, married and lives at San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She was blessed with only one child. Her husband is a carpenter. Their other source of income is from her “sari-sari” (general) store.  She also sells goods in front of elementary school. Being a member of Paglaum Multi-purpose cooperative really helped her especially in the capitalization of her business. She became a member last August 2008. The coop offers loans, savings and insurances. Now, she applies for PHP 4,000 to buy additional goods for sale. In the future, she wants to expand her “sari-sari” store into a grocery store someday.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for a general store

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Since 2007 Jemimah E. has worked as a fishmonger selling fresh and smoked fish at Ankwanda near Elmina. She is married with 2 children and received an education through Junior High School. While Jemimah works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a farmer. Her loan will be used to purchase additional fish for sale and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house for her family.

In the picture, she is standing where she smokes the fish.

loans.use: purchase additional fish for sale

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Абдулло живет в раоне Рудаки. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдулло занимается пчеловодством т.е. прожадей меда. Этим видом бизнеса занимется более 15 лет. Жена тоже работает швеей. Клиент хочет взять у нас кредит, для увелечения объема своих продаж.
texts.en:
Abdullo A. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 42 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Abdullo raises bees and sells honey. He has been in this business for more than 15 years. His wife also works as a seamstress. The client would like to take out a loan from us in order to increase the size of his sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Elda Maritza

texts.es: Elda Maritza B. M. tiene 32 años de edad. Es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos  a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por la necesidad de brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias, los comienzos de Elda no fueron nada fáciles porque empezó a trabajar desde muy joven, pero esto le ayudo a tener experiencia para su negocio y así mantenerlo hasta estos días. Ella recurre a Fundación León 2000 con la intención de facilitarle un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, calzado, ropa para niños y cosméticos. Elda tiene los sueños de obtener una distribuidora donde los precios sean muy accesibles.
texts.en:
Elda Maritza B. M. is 32 years old. She is a single mother of four children, all of whom are in school. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise, which she has done for more than five years to support her family. Elda's beginnings were not easy, as she started working at a very young age, but this helped her gain experience in the business and allowed her to maintain it up to now. She is returning to Fundación León 2000 to get a loan to buy clothing, shoes, children's clothing and cosmetics. Elda wishes to get a distributor where the prices are very affordable.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 30-year-old married woman with three children aged seven, four, and two years old.

Manal and her husband own a shop where they sell perfumes that they create from perfume essence. Her husband is currently managing the business since she is busy taking care of their children, but she spends some time in the shop selling to customers.

Manal and her husband recently opened this store, and it is their second branch in Ramallah city. They have a 50% share in the first branch while this second one is fully owned by the family. 

They approached FATEN for a loan of $3,000 to buy more perfume oil essence to expand their business since there is high demand during the summer.  This is their first loan. 

Manal appears in the picture with many perfume bottles behind her.

loans.use: To buy more perfume oil essence to expand their business

loans.name: Noel Kemf Group

texts.es: El grupo “Noel Kemf” esta representado por la señora Saida y conformada por 13 miembros que residen en el mismo bario Noel Kemf final radial 10 donD. todas se conocen desD. hace muchos años. La mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedica a actividades comerciales como la venta D. productos como comida, hielo, cosméticos por catálogos, ropa y al servicio en talleres mecánicos. La competencia en el ámbito comercial y D. servicios es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas D. trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias y mejoramiento D. su calidad D. vida. En lo que respecta a experiencia en grupos solidarios la mayoría D. los miembros del grupo obtuvieron financiamientos con anterioridad en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen los requisitos principales que son honestidad, responsabilidad y sobre todo ganas D. trabajar.
texts.en:
The group “Noel Kemf” is led by Saida and consists of 13 members that resiD. in the same neighborhood called Noel Kemf; they all have known each other for many years. The majority of the group members have businesses in the sale of food products, ice, cosmetics through catalogs, clothing, and mechanic garages. Competition in the commercial and services sector is high, but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and drive to work. The loan will be used to acquire materials, supplies, and tools that will help the group generate higher incomes; their families depend on this income and it will afford them a better quality of life. In respect to their experience in solidarity groups, the majority of the group members have previously obtained loans in entities similar to the Agrocapital Foundation, and they are familiar with the main requisites of these loans, which are honesty, responsibility, and above all a will to work.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to acquire materials, supplies, and tools).

loans.name: Servanda

texts.en:
Servanda I. is from the village of Mantique, San Roque Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 55 years old. Servanda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Servanda operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Servanda has been engaged in her business for more than 40 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Servanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Servanda is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Servanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Amatistas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Cascada, a este pertenece la asociación “Amatistas” formado por catorce  miembros que trabajan junto  a Pro-Mujer hace un año aproximadamente.
La mayoría de ellas son casadas y con familias numerosas. Existen varias actividades dentro el grupo, algunas tienen tiendas de barrio, otras de ellas  venden chompas y mantas tejidas a mano, Alfredo es cerrajero. La asociación amatistas necesita comprar mercadería para ampliar sus negocios, de esta manera generaran mayores ingresos para sostener económicamente a sus familias.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata S. est une femme de 49 ans elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a 2 ans et demi d'expérience dans son Banc Villageois et y a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle rembourse à chaque fois sans difficulté. Avec Son prêt elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide et de l'huile de palme. Elle soutien son mari pour la prise en charge de leurs 5 enfants et les autres charges familiales.
texts.en:
Aminata S. is a 49 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of 5 children. She has 2 and a half years of experience with her Banc Villageois (Village Bank) and has benefited from it with 5 loans that she reimbursed each time without difficulty. With her loan she will make and sell peanut butter and palm oil. She supports her husband in paying their 5 children's expenses and other family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married mother of five school going children.She is 40 years old and lives with her family in Kenya. She operates a retail shop along a busy highway. She started this way back in 2007 with a capital of 100,000 Kenyan shillings. Her husband, who is unemployed, helps her run the business. She sells commonly used items in the community such as cooking oil, flour, soap,  milk, bread, etc. She purchases goods in bulk at wholesale prices and sells at retail to her customers. She is asking for a loan of 30,000 shillings to add more stock.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Ivan Arturo

texts.en:
Ivan is 26 years old, single, and lives with his mother.  He lives in the Cercado Province of Cochabamba Department in Bolivia.  He runs a small shop where he sells various merchandise. The shop is not only a source of income, but also provides his family with their food.  Ivan also works as an auditor for a local construction company.  Work as an auditor is becoming tougher to find for Ivan, as more students graduate from university each year with qualified auditing skills.

With this loan from CIDRE, Ivan will purchase more merchandise for his shop.  He hopes to increase both the quantity and variety of products he sells.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony F. is from the village of Cabalantuon, Manticao. He is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Anthony owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from  raising and selling hogs in the local community. Anthony has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Anthony joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anthony is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional hogs. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and additional hogs to raise

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila J. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Lila owns and operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Lila is requesting a new loan of PHP 5,000 which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Shoimardon

texts.en:
Shoimardon K. is 49 years of age, married with 4 children, and lives with his family in Shahrituz, Tajikistan.

He is dedicated to agriculture, having 6 years of experience at this activity. Shoimardon has sown different kinds of vegetables and wheat. A part of his crop is destined for personal use and the majority he sells in the different markets of Shahrituz.

The income that he generates with this activity varies depending on the season in which the product is harvested. That is why his wife and elder sons support him in paying the household expenses.

The economic situation of the country has affected the acquisition of the supplies for productive work. The costs of fertilizers, supplements and insecticides have increased to the point where he needs a loan to be able to buy them.

For this reason Shoimardon is asking for a loan of 3400 TJS. You could become an important part of his family's life. Shoimardon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anyeri

texts.en: Anyeri J. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar. Anyeri is 22 years old and is married to a grinding-mill operator. She has two children who do not yet go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta V. is a woman with big dreams and the bravery to fight challenges in order to achieve her dreams. She is 59 years old and married to Alfredo V., 60, who is a fisherman. Her children have their own families with whom they live. Violeta lives in the town of Tanay, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. 

In 2004, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with a chance of having start-up capital for generating income. During her first loan in ASHI, she carefully invested it in her fishing business and it gave her a reasonable income. Now on her seventh loan, she requests 20,000 PHP for the revival of her fishing business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase a white fishnet, green fishnet, black fishnet, rope, bamboo and labor expenses. This loan will help her business, which was destroyed from a huge typhoon, ”Ondoy”. 

As a mother, Violeta dreams of sending her grandchildren to school and on to completing college degrees and finding jobs for a better living. She hopes that her business will expand for them so they will have savings for future use. She also enjoys seeing that the loan from ASHI will change their lives and accommodate her family's needs. Through the support of ASHI, Kiva partner, she will, step-by-step, realize her dreams.

loans.use: Purchase of white fishnet, green fishnet, black fishnet, rope, bamboo and labor expenses

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes H. is from the village of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.en:
Gerson S. is from the village of Camiguin Province. He is 22 years old. Gerson is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Gerson owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle services used to transport local community members. Gerson has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gerson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerson has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 7,000 from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Gerson is requesting a new loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gerson from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor S. is 52 years old and lives in Angk Ta Phouk village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Kosal Chhom, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. Mr. Kosal Chhom is also a village chief and earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. Nhor S. owns an old motorcycle which her husband uses to get to work. It uses a lot of petroleum so she wants to get a new one to reduce expenses. Mrs. Nhor S., therefore, decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorcycle. 

She is the mother of 2 children who are all employed in a garment factory. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband to get to work

loans.name: C2136 Abaticumugambi Group

texts.en:
Vestine is 30 years old, married with 3 children aged between 2 and 8. Vestine and her family live in the Gasabo district, Kigali province, in a village called Kabuga where her business is located.

Vestine owns a small business selling green bananas in her region which is a very important business because it is profitable. Vestine is the leader of a group which contains 5 members; all of them are women except one; all of them have the same business. Vestine who is the leader has an experience of 3 years in this field but her seed money is not enough to attract customers by having more green bananas. Now Vestine is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more green bananas to sell. With this loan Vestine hopes to earn more profits which will allow her to sort out some family problems.

loans.use: additional green bananas for sale

loans.name: Marcia Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Marcia se dedica a la venta de refresco, de forma ambulante desplazándose por todo el centro de la ciudad de León. Elabora su refresco en su casa de 6 a 8:00 Am. Luego se traslada a ofertar su producto hasta las 2:00 pm, el resto de la tarde se lo dedica a su familia y a efectuar las compras de los productos para la elaboración de refresco del día siguiente. 

 Este crédito que solicito es  para  comprar por mayor cantidad los  productos que vende  tales como: cacao, payana, azúcar, canela, frutas para elaboración de refrescos. Y  así tener mayor ganancia.

Cabe mencionar que la Señora López esta agradecida con los créditos que ha obtenido con ceprodel ya que le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio y mejorar su nivel de vida..
texts.en:
Marcia sells refreshments by travelling around all of the city centre of León. She makes the drinks at home between 6 and 8 and later travels around to offer her product until 2pm. The rest of the afternoon she dedicates to her family and to buying the products to make the following day's drinks. The loan she is seeking is to purchase a larger quantity of the produces she sells, such as cocoa, pecans, sugar, cinnamon, and fruit to make the drinks, and in this way earn more. It rates a mention that Señora López is thankful for the loans that she has obtained as they have helped her to grow her business and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cocoa, pecans, sugar, cinnamon, fruits and confectionery.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope S. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Prk Mangga, Brgy Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her general store and livestock business. Hope’s husband, Noe, is 59 years old and works as a farmer. They have 14 children aged between 19 – 42 years old with some of them having their own family while others work to help their parents. 

Hope joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in the general store and livestock businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000 from her business activities.

Hope is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used to fund operations of her general store and had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing, for her 18th loan, the amount of Php 29,500, which she intends to use on her general store and livestock businesses. Hope is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family--to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Voeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Voeung C. and her husband, Mr. Lim Long, live on an island in the Mekong River not far from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1978 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home.  One weaves silk at home and another two attend school.

Voeung is a silk weaver. Her husband is a house builder, and he also runs a battery-charging business. Voeung has received a Kiva loan in the past.  She is now requesting another loan in the amount of $300 to purchase silk materials for the weaving business that she runs with her daughter..

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Mrs. Khoem P., 43, produces and sells cakes. She lives with her four children. Another two of her chidren have ready married and live independently. She became a cake seller in 2005, a skill she learned from a nearby neighbor. One of her sons is working as a taxi driver. Khoem P. was married but divorced her husband years ago. She is a hardworking woman and a determined citizen who triesto earn money to solve all of her family's financial crises. Because Khoem P.’s house has broken down, the family’s living conditions have been affected. Khoem P. will be using her first loan to mend her old house. Any remaining money from the loan will be used to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To mend her old house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old engaged man living with his parents. He's an experienced hairdresser with four years of experience. In 2006, he opened his own barbershop in his hometown. Mohammad provides services to a wide range of clientele in the village and its neighborhoods. 

Today, Mohammad wishes to improve his shop, but he will mainly use the loan to furnish his home. In order to do so, he is requesting a $1,300 loan. This is his second loan; he reimbursed his last loan on time. With his previous loan, he was able to increase his merchandise, such as shampoos, gels, sprays, etc.

loans.use: To improve his shop and furnish his home

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
51-year-old Helen F. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has three adult children. She has been involved in rice farming for more than six years. She also owns a sari-sari (variety) store located at her house. While her husband does the major farming tasks, she spends her time managing the store and making sure her family is happy. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 from the farm and store.

In 2009, Helen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Helen is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs and also additional inventory for the sari-sari store.
