This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Helen from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs, as well as inventory for the variety store

loans.name: Arsenal Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Marie C. who is pictured on the left. Marie is age 31 and was born in Magburaka town. She is married with three children. Her husband is a businessman and two of her children are attending schools. For 5 years now, Marie has been selling groundnuts (peanuts), pepper, tomatoes, salt, sugar, rice and oil. Marie will use this loan to expand her business by buying groundnuts, onions and rice wholesale. 

Pictured here are members of the “Arsenal” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts, onions and rice wholesale

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg T. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family all live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter is a student while her husband works as a director of Uvurhangai province Democratic Party Branch. 

Altantsetseg operates a small cafe in her town with the help of her family. She started her cafe in 2005 out of a small rented place next to her house. Due to her hard work, she has found success in a short time and built a two-storey house in where she is currently operating her cafeteria business. For the future, Altantsetseg hopes to expand her business so she can better serve all of her customers. She is a hard-working, productive woman who is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy more materials, kitchen implements and equipment, and food ingredients in order to cook satisfying meals for her customers.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and inventory

loans.name: Lenin

texts.es: Lenin tiene 50 años de edad, ella vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia, sus dos hijos que tiene ya son independientes y tienen su propia familia. Hace más de 6 años trabaja vendiendo ropa, la modalidad de venta lo realiza visitando a sus clientes, y luego de un tiempo se dispone a realizar las cobranzas de su producto. Este trabajo es su principal fuente de ingresos, es así que visita los centros comerciales, los más concurridos de su ciudad, para adquirir variedad de prendas de vestir, en diversos colores y diseños que sean atractivos para su clientela, que en su mayoría es público femenino.  Espera seguir trabajando como hasta ahora, ganando buena cantidad de clientes para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos y en un futuro poder poner una gran tienda de ropa. Es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lenin is 50 years old. She lives together with her husband in her own house. Her two children that she has are already independent and have their own family. For more than 6 years she has worked selling clothing. Her method of sales is to visit her customers and after a period of time, she prepares to collect the money for her product. This work is her main source of income so she visits the malls, the most popular in her city, to acquire a variety of clothing in various colors and designs that are attractive for her customers, of whom the majority are female. She hopes to continue working like until now, gaining a good amount of customers to improve her economic earnings and in the future, to be able to have a large clothing store. This is her third credit with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she will be purchase more clothing to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more clothing.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M., age 57, and her husband Ricardo, age 58, have four children who are all working, and have been running a small general store selling groceries and fruits for the past 15 years in Silang, Cavite.  The business generates approximately PHP 30,000 a month, which the couple uses to cover their daily living expenses.

Virginia is seeking a loan of PHP 10,000 to help her purchase additional inventory for her store.  She hopes that the additional money from the loan will eventually help her to expand the business.  Virginia has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT), since 2007 and has continually participated in group meetings.*

She dreams that her business will continue to expand and generate more revenue, and that she and her family will be able to live a peaceful and healthy life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to be incorporated in her current product inventory

loans.name: Acquilina

texts.en:
Acquilina R. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Acquilina is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Acquilina owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Acquilina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Acquilina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Acquilina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Acquilina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor A. is from the village of Francfort, in Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Miraflor owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Miraflor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Miraflor’s 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rosefe

texts.en:
Rosefe E. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosefe raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosefe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosefe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Rosefe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: Delma is from the village of  Makawa,Aloran, Mis. Occ. She is 34 years old and married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Delma is involved in fish vending in her local communtiy. Delma has been in this business for about 2 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for this activity. In November 2006, Delma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This was her 10th loan taken from PMPC she previously repaid her loan amounting in 12,000 PHP and is requesting a new loan amounting of 5000 PHP for the additional inventory capital of her business  to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her Fish Vending

loans.name: Meera

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Meera P.. She is married and has two children who are 14 and 12 years old. In 2007, she established her tailoring business.  Working six days a week and five hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. 

In the future, Meera plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children, as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page     

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Sofia;   ella tiene 61 años D. edad, es separada y tiene 3 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta D. alimentos, la socia trabaja vendiendo comidas tradicionales,  en su restaurante, pero en esta ocasión la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la construcción D. un cerco para cubrir su terreno,  ella comprara materiales para cercar su terreno y D. esta forma cubrir los muros con tejas para que las lluvias que vienen no lo derrumben. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales D. construcción para cercar su terreno.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Sofia is a member of the communal bank located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco.   Sofia is 61 years old and takes care of 3 children.  She is separated from her husband.   She alternates her work taking care of her family with a restaurant business where she sells traditional meals.    On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to purchase some construction materials.   She needs to fence in the retaining walls near her home so that the coming rains don't destroy them.  Sofia appreciates and values these loans, and she commits to comply with the payments on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to fence in the retaining walls near her home so that the coming rains don't destroy them.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 25 years old and single. He sells different products such as caps, flasks, bags, utensils and deodorants. He has been doing this business for three years. With this loan, he will add more merchandise to sell and with the profit he hopes to make, he will build a home. 

He says that his business succeeds because he manages to offer better customer care to his customers.  He would like to be a wholesaler to others in the future.

loans.use: To buy more utensils, flasks and deodorants to sell.

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
Eight people are forming this village loan. They are located in Anlong Slat village in Kandal province. This village loan group selected Mrs. Sam S., 50 years old, as the leader for this loan. Each member of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Sam S., is a farming laborer and she is a single woman. With her work, she earns too little income to improve her living. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding. She hopes this business will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Eliud Musyoka

texts.en:
Eliud is 64 years old and supports four members of his family. He raises chicken as a primary business and has a retail shop for cereals. He has been in these businesses for about three years with an income of about 5,300 Kenyan shillings per month.

This is his third loan with KADET after successfully repaying his previous loans well and on time. He hopes to build a better permanent home for his family and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy cereals to stock his kiosk as a secondary business

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU est créé depuis 7 cycles de 6 mois. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui sont toutes issus du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de TAKHIKAO

Madame COUMB. M. assise au dernier rang à partir de la gauche sur la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04. Elle a aussi la charge de sa belle fille. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus et d'objets d'art. Elle fait aussi depuis plusieurs années de la couture 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d'achat de marchandises afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices

Son objectif est de mieux développer son activité et d'augmenter son fonds de roulement.
texts.en: The SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU solidarity group has been in existence for seven six-month cycles. It is composed of 14 women who all live in the same neighborhood. They are organized by kinship and neighborhood. The group is affiliated with the TAKHIKAO banc villageois.  Mrs. COUMB. M., seated in the back row in the left of the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is also responsible for her stepdaughter. She has a small business selling fabrics and decorative items and has been sewing for several years. With her new loan, she will bolster her purchase of merchandise in order to make a larger profit. Her goal is to expand her business and increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy fabric and decorative items

loans.name: Liduena

texts.en:
Liduena M. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 54 years old. Liduena is married and has three children. To make a living, Liduena raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Liduena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liduena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Liduena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Mirna Yanira

texts.es: Mirna Yanira M. D. D. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en Merliot, en el departamento D. La Libertad, en donD. vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 7 y 10 años D. edad. DesD. hace dos años atrás que Mirna trabaja en su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda D. productos deportivos como zapatos, toallas, calzonetas, sandalias, flotadores y mucho más, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en las instalaciones del polideportivos D. Ciudad Merliot, en donD. muchos jovenes y niños reciben clases D. natación, lo cual es una ventaja para Mirna. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda surtir el negocio comprando mayor cantidad D. calzonetas, sandalias y otros accesorios más los cuales son necesarios para realizar el deporte D. la natación.
texts.en:
Mirna Yanira M. D. D. is 32 years old and resides in Merliot, Department of La Libertad, where she lives with her husband and two children (ages 7 and 10). For the past two years, Mirna has worked in her own business. She has a store where she sells sporting goods such as shoes, towels, swimming trunks, sandals, floats, and many other items. Her business is located at the sports facility in Ciudad Merliot where many young people and children take swimming lessons, which is advantageous for Mirna.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can restock her business by purchasing a large quantity of swimming trunks, sandals, and other accessories that are necessary for the sport of swimming.

loans.use: Purchase swimming trunks, sandals, and other swimming accessories

loans.name: Zenitha

texts.en:
Zenitha L. is from the city of Tinago Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old. Zenitha is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Zenitha owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Zenitha has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Zenitha joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenitha is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Zenitha from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Germán

texts.es: El Sr M.  labora como Agente de seguridad  es casado, tiene cuatro  persona a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo  a esta institución con  este  desembolso para  reparación de su vivienda, comprar materiales arena, bloque ,cemento, piedrín, hierro, mano de obra
texts.en:
German works as a security agent, is married, and has the basic responsibility for four people.

This is the first loan that CEPRODEL has offered him.  German appreciates the help the institution is offering with this funding, which he will use to purchase construction materials such as sand, blocks, cement, gravel, iron, and manpower, to improve his home.

loans.use: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO IMPROVE HIS HOUSE

loans.name: Beatriz Eugenia

texts.es: Después de quedar desempleada Beatriz Eugenia P.
texts.en: After becoming unemployed, Beatriz Eugenia P.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Camino Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS AL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Gregorio Eugenio; el tiene 48 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio tiene su negocio de comida al paso el vende lo que son helados, comidas, empanadas, tortas entre otros mas, su negocio se encuentra en la av. El sol en el mismo centro de la ciudad, él lleva años en este negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa, a la vez el socio trabaja en una inmobiliaria brindando asesoramiento, pero más se dedica a su negocio el cual le trae muchas satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales que  mediante este negocio el socio saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra  de mercadería para su negocio para así tener más variedad de comidas que ofrecer.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de  artesanía, agencias de viajes, negocio de venta de útiles escolares y la otra parte estudiantes.

El socio se siente feliz por el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “CAMINEMOS AL FUTURO” (Let’s Head for the Future) communal bank which is located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

Gregorio Eugenio, 48, is married and has two children.  He has a fast food business selling ice cream, meals, turnovers and sandwiches, among others.  His business is located on El Sol Avenue downtown.  He’s been in business for years and works with his wife.  He’s also employed at a real estate firm as a Consultant.  But, he’s mostly dedicated to his business because it brings him much satisfaction, both personal and economic.  It is through this business that he’s able to support his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for his business in order to have wider variety of meals to offer.

The other members sell crafts, run travel agencies, sell school supplies or are students.

The member is happy with the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 57 years old and still very active. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to bring comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. She is a widow and lives with her five children in Pakpattan, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. Her home contains two rooms made of bricks and is situated in the area of Karam Pura. She moved there 15 years ago. 

Due to the death of her husband and her poor financial conditions, Nazeeran couldn’t provide education to her sons and they had to start work to earn income for the family. Her eldest son is a tailor and runs a tailoring shop in the market. The second one works in a Punjabi food restaurant and the youngest one works in an electronics shop as a salesman. Both of her daughters are studying. 

Nazeeran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her eldest son who wants to buy a new sewing machine to improve his tailoring business. The new machine will help him fulfill larger orders on time and earn better profits. He has five years of experience in his business and Nazeeran is hopeful that he will be able to improve his business after investing this loan in it.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is 34 years old, married and blessed with three children.  To earn a living, he sells newspapers.  He has been in the business for five years.  He was previously selling books so as to earn a living.  Since he joined a group in Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he is also in a position to get a loan easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loan.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more newspapers from different editors.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers from different editors.

loans.name: Wangninagbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAGBE est composé de trois personnes qui vendent toutes dans le même marché de Tokplégbé dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Honorine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Honorine est née en 1982 à Cotonou et a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Honorine vit seule avec son enfant à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Honorine s’est installée dans ce quartier depuis onze ans. Honorine ne vit plus avec son mari. Honorine n’est pas allée à l’école, mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu’elle mène depuis quatre ans environs et qui lui apporte des revenus l’aidant à faire face aux besoins de son enfant. Parallèlement à cette activité, Honorine vend divers produits (biscuits, bombons, etc.) au marché Tokplégbé. Honorine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Honorine sollicite à nouveau un crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: The ANGNINAGBE group is made up of three people who all sell goods at the Tokplégbé market, in the Sèmè-Podji municipality. It is the second time that this group is seeking a loan from ALIDé, in order to boost their business. The group's representative, Honorine, has her hand raised in the photograph. She was born in 1982 in Cotonou and has one child who attends school. Honorine lives alone with her child in Agblangandan, in the  Sèmè-Podji municipality, where she moved 11 years ago. She no longer lives with her husband. She did not attend school, but learned hairdressing four years ago in order to make money to see to her family's needs. In addition to this she sells various food products (biscuits, sweets, etc.) at the Tokplégbé market. Honorine sources her goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. In order to see to her customers' needs and to boost her revenue, she and the other group members are seeking a new loan.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing products and food items (sweets, biscuits etc)

loans.name: Yadira De Los Angeles

texts.es: Yadira De Los Ángeles se dedica a una librería, desde muy joven ha sido comerciante no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio ya que en algunas ocasiones sus clientes le solicitaban los productos y no le pagaban. Yadira es una mujer muy emprendedora, por lo que siempre ha brindando a su hijo lo necesario. El crédito es para la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, hojas, marcadores y reglas. Ella siempre sueña con seguir aumentando su inventario y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yadira De Los Ángeles runs a stationery shop.  She’s been a merchant since she was very young.  It’s not been easy to stay in business because often customers would request products and then not pay her.

Yadira is a very enterprising woman because she’s always wanted to provide her son with everything he needs.

The loan is to buy notebooks, mechanical pencils, erasers, sheets of paper, markers and rulers.  She always dreams with continuing to increase her inventory and meeting customer demand.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, mechanical pencils, erasers, sheets of paper, markers and rulers.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Mrs.Tsetsegmaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Both of her daughters attend secondary school while she earns a living running a grocery. She has been in this business for nine years and her shop has grown in recent years. Tsetsegmaa spends most of her time selling items while her husband makes a living delivering food in a microbus. Tsetsegmaa started her store with a small investment and has been careful to continually expand and enhance her business. Local customers are satisfied with the variety of food she sells, and there are no other stores nearby. Earlier this year, she rented new space in a nearby shopping center and began selling clothing there. She is applying for this loan to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard, who is 52 years old, married to Wanjiku and the father of two school-going children, has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 11 years, selling his produce at the local market.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be his fifth loan, his previous ones all repaid well and in good time. Bernard plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer, and in the future hopes to become a very successful farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Oñondivepa se denomina al excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita. La Sra. Sandra es la actual presidenta del comité, fue gracias a ella que se unieron sus vecinas y amigas y lograron formar el comité.
El comité se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, todas ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria. Ellas se definen como mujeres luchadoras y sacrificadas que día a día luchan por llevar el sustento a sus hogares.
La Sra. Sandra se dedica a la venta de ropas desde hace ya varios años. Ella ha formado un grupo de clientes bien definido que la conocen muy bien. Ella dice que todo lo que hace es por el bien de sus familiares para procurarles un futuro mejor.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas ropas, en especial de invierno, ahora se viene el invierno y le gustaría tener mas variedad de ropas par vender.
texts.en:
This excellent group of women formed in the city of Ita is called Oñondivepa.  Sandra is the current president of the committee, and it was thanks to her that neighbors and friends united and succeeded in forming the committee.  

The committee is in their second loan cycle.  They all work together.  They define themselves as being fighters who make sacrifices that every day they fight to bring sustenance to their homes.

Sandra has worked selling clothing for many years.  She has formed a defined group of customers who she knows very well.  She said that everything she does is for the good of her family so that she can provide them a better future.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase more clothing, especially for winter.  Winter is coming and she would like to have a larger variety of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase items of clothing like hats, jackets, and more.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane comes from the village of Kistauri, East Georgia. He is 53 years old, married and lives in the village with his family: wife Natalia, two daughters (14 and 11 years old) and parents, who are retired. Ivane’s daughters go to school. 

Ivane is a farmer. His main source of family income is a beekeeping business. He owns 60 beehives and gets the honey twice a year. He sells it on the local market. Along with beekeeping, Ivane is also busy with corn growing. The corn is also sold on the local market. 

He requests credit for purchasing fertilizers for the cornfield. After fertilizing, Ivane will get a better quality harvest and will sell that harvest for a good price on the market. He plans to reinvest the increase in income in the family farm in order to make it more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the cornfield.

loans.name: Dayci

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dayci; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, blusas, polos, chompas y casacas para mujeres, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como pantalones, chompas, blusas y polos para el negocio de venta de ropa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Manos Juntas [Hands Together] located in the district of Cusco belonging to the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Mrs. Dayci, 29, who is married and has two children. The member alternates her daily activities with a clothing sales business. She sells pants, blouses, polo shirts, sweaters and ladies' jackets. She works from 9 a.m. until 9 p.m. By means of this business the member gets her children ahead. The member wants to expand and improve her clothing sales business. The member is seeking the loan to purchase merchandise such as pants, sweaters, blouses and polo shirts for her clothing sales business. 

The member is happy to receive the loan and promises to comply with the payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as pants, sweaters, blouses and polo shirts for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Mira Fe

texts.en:
Mira Fe is 50 years old and lives in Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 
Mira Fe has a general store that sells different kinds of products. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan  to purchase  more stock for her general store .
Mira Fe has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Mira Fe hopes to have a big shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es ya una persona grande de edad y sus hijos ya todos tienen su propia familia. Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder ayudar a sus nietos ha poder en pesar este ciclo escolar y que tengan lo necesario para sus estudio. 
Desea ayudarles con comprar les sus uniformes y los útiles escolares (carpetas, cuadernos, lápices, plumas, cuadernos y mochilas), quiere que sus nietas tengan una carrera profesional para su futuro. 
Don Francisco planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su pensión gubernamental que obtiene por ser maestro.  
El señor Francisco ya ha tenido un crédito con KIVA el cual realizo sus pagos puntuales, espero contar con su cooperación en este préstamo ya que es para ayudar a sus nietos a tener una buena educación.
texts.en:
Francisco is a person of advanced age and his children all have their own families.  He’s asking for this loan to help his grandchildren start the new school term so that they’ll have everything they need for their studies.  He wants to help them buy their uniforms and school supplies (notebooks, folders, pencils, pens and backpacks).  He wants his granddaughters to have professional careers in the future.

Francisco plans to repay the loan with income he gets from a government pension he gets for being a teacher.  Francisco has already had a KIVA loan that he repaid punctually.  He hopes to have your support again with this loan since it’s to help his grandchildren have a good education.

loans.use: to pay his grandchildren's school costs.

loans.name: Media

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Media works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from raising pigs. Media is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  buy more fish to sell.

Media has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aimalyn

texts.en:
Aimalyn is 30 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with one child.
 
To earn a living, Aimalyn has a business of hog raising. She earns about 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each every three months doing this type of work. 

Aimalyn has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase pigs for her pig raising business.

Aimalyn has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Aimalyn would like to have a big piggery and agri-veterinarian supply. Aimalyn is a (MIGS) Member in Good Standing of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her pig raising business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Leonora has a retail shop that sells fish such as sardines and milk fish. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.
Leonora is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 26 years old and married.  He sells electronic goods to earn a living.  He has employed two people to assist him in his tasks.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business.  He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination.  Joel has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy radios, remote controls, battery chargers and mobile phones

loans.use: To buy radios, remote controls, battery chargers and mobile phones

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa sells items such as cooking oil, canned tomatoes, garden eggs, spaghetti, and more in Takoradi. Theresa has received a junior high school level of education. She is married and has one child. Theresa has been selling food items for five years. She helps her spouse to pay the household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy food items to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 31 years old and has two children, ages 2 and 5. She is married to a businessman. She sells shoes in a store she has been running for 12 years. Odette would like a loan to add more shoes to her store. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. She would like to have a booming business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer and the mother of 3 children, with the last two being of school-going age. She has been in active farming for 20 years. Her farm produces maize, vegetables, passion fruit and tomatoes.

Mary has requested Juhudi Kilimo to advance her a loan of 52,000 KES to enable her to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the cow will help her in feeding and educating her children. She adds Juhudi Kilimo has uplifted farmers' living standards with the farming loans.

Mary is, however, worried about the high costs of animal feeds.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jairo De Jesus

texts.es:
Dedicado a la agricultura la mayor parte de su vida y con la ayuda de sus 4 hijos de 32, 30, 28, 26 años respectivamente les ha demostrado a ellos y a toda su comunidad que si se trabaja con esmero, tesón y alegría se pueden conseguir las metas de la mejor manera. Jairo enseña a los jóvenes de su comunidad a que aprendan sobre el cultivo y la tierra. 

Este gran emprendedor necesita el crédito para comprar insumos y material agrícola para sacar adelante su cultivo y poder comercializar mucho mejor sus productos y continuar con las enseñanzas a todos los jóvenes que ven en Jairo un gran ejemplo de vida.
texts.en:
Working in agriculture the better part of his life and with the help of his four children, ages 32, 30, 28, and 26 respectively, has shown them and the whole community that if you work with care, determination, and happiness, you can reach your goals in the best way.  Jairo teaches the young people of his community to learn about crops and the land.

This great entrepreneur needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies and materials to get his crop ahead, to be able to sell his products better, and to continue with his lessons to all the young people, who see in Jairo a great example of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and materials to take care of his crop.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante Al Progreso 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Marina is the coordinator of her group, 'Con Dios adelante al progreso' 1, 2 & 3 (Forward Progress with God). Her group is located in the rural area of San Pedro de Macoris, surrounded by sugar cane fields. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children. She is a single mother.  Her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them.

Marina is excited to be seeking her 6th loan with Esperanza. She started doing business since almost 8 years ago, at first walking with a bag of clothing, cosmetics and shoes, and now after taking out some loans, she is selling chicken in her community. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business and she will buy some live chickens to start selling every day.  At the end of the day, after she finishes selling chicken, Marina starts working in her house cleaning or attending to her children. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy live chickens for sale

loans.name: La Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es: La Sra. Benjamina   es viuda, tiene 4 hijos, Benjamina tiene 50 años de edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “La inmaculada Concepcion” grupo  conformado por 9  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Benjamina   trabaja desde hace 19  años en la venta de abarrotes en un puesto en el mercado  este negocio surge porque a raíz de que su esposo falleció, ella tenía que mantener a sus cuatro hijos. Es así que trabajo muy duro para sacar  adelante a su familia, empezó vendiendo dulces poco a poco fue creciendo su capital y lo invirtió en arroz leche fideos  a su vez también vende marciano, helados, chupetes en verano. gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos pudieron estudiar, poco apoco fue comprando cosas para su hogar y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar Insumos(Arroz, Fideos, Leche) .Sabemos que Benjamina  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Benjamina is divorced.  She has four children and is 50 years old.  Currently she is a member of La Inmaculada Concepción communal bank group, made up of nine members who work in various business activities.

Benjamina has been working for 19 years selling groceries in a stall in the market.  This business came up because her husband died.  She needed to support her four children.  So she worked very hard to get her family ahead.  She began selling sweets.  Little by little she grew her capital and invested it in rice, milk, and vermicelli.  Occasionally she also sells "marcianos" [ice pops in a plastic tube], ice cream, and ice pops in the summer.

Thanks to her effort and dedication she has gotten better economic income.  Her children managed to study.  Little by little she bought things for her home and above all her family has a better quality of life.

With the goal of continuing to grow, she has requested a new loan to buy supplies (rice, vermicelli, milk).

We know that Benjamina will achieve her goals with a lot of work and effort, and that the EDAPROSPO loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy supplies: milk, rice, and vermicelli

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es: A sus 42 años, el señor Carlos Mario cuenta con un coche dirigido por un caballo en el cual vende legumbres a los habitantes del municipio de Rionegro, al oriente de Antioquia. Cuenta con 4 hijos por los cuales trabaja diariamente con mucho esfuerzo y a los que les quiere brindar la mejor educación y la mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace 15 años, Carlos Mario conoce la actividad de vender legumbres y quiere que su negocio crezca y se consolide como un referente en su municipio. Para poder seguir creciendo, Carlos Mario requiere de la compra de más legumbres para surtir su negocio, y poder así ofrecerles más variedad a sus clientes. Sueña con brindar a sus hijos un hogar estable económicamente donde puedan crecer con todas las necesidades cubiertas y donde puedan acceder a la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
At the age of 42, Carlos Mario has a horse-drawn cart that he uses to sell vegetables to residents of Rionegro in east Antioquia.  He has four children that he works hard daily for with much effort because he wants to give them a better education and quality of life.

For fifteen years, Carlos Mario has been in the vegetable sales business and he wants his business to grow and become a standout in his town.  To continue growing, Carlos Mario needs to buy more vegetables to stock his business and offer more variety to his customers.

He dreams with providing a home for his children that has economic stability where they can grow up with all their basic needs met and where they can have access to the best possible education.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Antonio es soltero, tiene 20 años de edad, es perito contador diplomado, se dedica a la sastrería, a la confección de camisas y pantalones, inició  este negocio como operario y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas  e hilos, de diferentes clases y colores para mejorar su producción de tejidos, ya que espera tener un negocio con mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Jorge Antonio, 20, is single and a certified accounting expert.  He works as a tailor; he makes shirts and pants.  He started in this business as an employee and to date has five years’ experience.  He’s asking for a loan to buy fabric and thread of various kinds and colors to improve his production of textiles since he hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (in the photo with her loom) is 38 years old and her husband; Panha is 31 years old, live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2010 and have no children yet.

Sophea is a silk weaver, while her husband is a security guard. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to get work. She will also use a part of the loan to buy silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to get work and buy silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Channarak

texts.en:
Channarak is 27 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over four years, earning approximately$4 per day. Her husband is a motorbike mechanic who earns approximately $6 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Channarak is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Riham

texts.en: Riham is a 49 year old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy materials for making sweets. She would like to open a small shop to sell her products. In the future she hopes to be able to buy a home of her own.

loans.use: to buy materials for sweet making

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 20-years-old student from Noratus village of Gegharquniq region. 
She is a current student at faculty of Romance  and Germanic Philology, in her first year of education. 
Anna's family consists of 5 members: her parents, grandmother, and two school aged brother. The economic situation that her family is going through is difficult, because her parents don't have permanent work, which puts Anna's professional continuity at risk. Thus, Anna is turning to Kiva in search of support that will allow her to continue with her studies and not abandon her dreams of being an excellent, successful professional. 
Anna hopes for lenders' support and is sure that at the end of her studies she will be able to work and generate income that will allow her to support family economically. Anna dreams to help her parents with the education of her two younger brothers so that in the future they can follow her example.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition to get higher degree in the faculty of Romance  and Germanic Philology

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 28, married, has 2 children, lives in Salyan region Yenikand village.  He has his own grocery store. Having borrowed a loan of $600 from Komak Credit Union  Ramil built the grocery store. 
He applies for the loan of $1300 to be engaged in selling the wholesale trade and retailing the foodstuffs and the manufactured goods 
( light industry ).

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en:
Fizuli has run this business for 2 years.
He is 54, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in Fizuli region Kayidish village.He is married and has 2 children.
Fizuli breeds cows and buffalo.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $600 and bought a buffalo.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Uum

texts.en: Uum is 30 years old, and is married with six children, three of them are girls while the others are boys. Uum and her husband, Mamun buy waste material like plastic cups, plastic bottles, cardboard and paper from her neighbors and other houses in the village. Her husband uses a cart to collect scrap metal and other waste material. Households do not just give away waste material, because there is demand and therefore economic value in recycling. So the more working capital they have, the more scrap they can collect and recycle. Uum and her husband are the first link in this chain, buying waste and scrap materials from households, sorting and cleaning them, before selling them to an intermediate dealer. This dealer comes around in a small truck, collects the sorted-out material and takes it to the warehouses dealer. There, the different materials are weighed in front of Uum’s husband, who then gets paid by the intermediate dealer. The warehouse dealer in turn sends the waste materials to various processing factories, which turn produce clean and reusable recycled paper, cardboard and plastic recycled raw materials. Waste recycling undertaken by Uum and her husband thus helps clean the environment by reusing waste material which otherwise would go to the landfills. In a week Uum can earn $6. She needs a loan of $50 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell , and thus more or less double her income. Uum very much wants to earn more money for her children’s education and to give them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es:
Business Description

Hernán has been selling fried onions, rice with fried fish and chicken for 10 years. He started this business with his own money and he works at it with his wife. They work from 6am – 11am. Their business is located in the centre of the city. After selling food, Hernán makes deliveries in a small car in order to earn more money.

Loan Use

Hernán needs a loan in order to buy new kitchen utensils such as plates, saucepans, spoons etc. He needs these as the utensils he has at present are now too old to use. He would like to provide a better service for his clients.

Personal Information

Hernán is 31 years old and is married to Mariana. They have children all under the age of 18, two of which are in high school and two of which are in elementary school. His 2 eldest children help a lot in the preparation of the foods. They have their own house which is made of cement but is not yet finished. They offer each other mutual support in order to keep going and therefore have a better lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Don Hernán lleva 10 años dedicado a esta actividad, el vende encebollado, guatita, arroz con pescado frito y seco de pollo. El inicio su negocio con capital propio. Su negocio lo atiende junto con su esposa, ellos trabajan desde las 6:00am hasta las 11:00am. El negocio esta ubicado en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad. Además don Hernán después que termina de vender su comida, en la tarde sale hacer fletes en un carrito que tiene para des esta manera generar mas ingresos para su familia.

Uso del Préstamo

Don Hernán desea el crédito para comprar nuevos utensilios de cocina, como platos, ollas, cucharones etc. Esto se debe porque los que tiene ya paso su tiempo de vida útil. Y así desea darles un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Don Hernán tiene 31 años de edad, es casado con la sra. Mariana. Tiene 4 hijos todos menores de edad, dos estudian en colegio y 2 en escuela. Sus 2 hijos mayores le ayudan en muchas ocasiones en a preparación de la comida. La vivienda en la que viven es propia, de un piso de cemento pero aun esta en construcción. Ellos se apoyan mutuamente para seguir adelante y de esta manera tener un mejor estilo de vida.

loans.use: To buy utensils, plates and other products for his diner/Comprar utensilos, platos y otros productos para su comedor

loans.name: Chok

texts.en:
Mrs. Chok M., 54, is a mother of six children and lives with her husband in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband work very hard on their rice paddy growing crops, earning around $5 each day from selling their crop at the market. Three of their children, meanwhile, are employed at a garment factory and together earn around $100 each month, whilst the other three are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Chok M. hopes to use this loan to purchase pig feed and some piglets to raise on their piece of land, with which she hopes to generate a good profit when she sells them.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and some piglets to raise on their piece of land

loans.name: Alma Irene

texts.es:
Alma is a very enterprising and strong woman with dreams of moving ahead in life. Lacking a higher education, Alma and her husband thought about starting their own business to help solve their household expenses and provide for their two small children. Her husband is a fisherman, so they thought of having a seafood business at a local fish market called La Puntilla. They have since acquired a post in the market, and little by little they have established their business.

Winter is by far the most difficult season to sell seafood, with the supply dwindling and the prices rising. So Alma is requesting a loan of $575, which she will repay within six months, to purchase fish and seafood so they can have more merchandise. With your help, Alma, her husband and her children will be able to have Thanksgiving dinner and be happy they're together and no have to worry about money.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Alma es una persona muy fuerte, con deseos de salir adelante y muy emprendedora. La falta de estudios de su esposo y la de Alma los obligó a pensar en poner un negocio para tener un ingreso que les ayudara a solventar los gastos de su casa y sus dos pequeños hijos. El esposo de Alma era pescador, por eso pensaron en poner un negocio de mariscos en un mercado de pescados y mariscos (llamado La Puntilla),desde entonces han seguido con su local y poco a poco se van estabilizando.

Sin embargo el invierno para un vendedor de mariscos es la época más difícil, puesto que la pesca se va haciendo más pequeña y por lo tanto los precios de los productos se hacen más altos. Por lo tanto Alma está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero poder comprar los pescados y tener material para surtir en el mercado. Con tu ayuda Alma, su esposo y sus hijos, podrán tener una cena de acción de gracias en familia y felices por estar juntos y sin preocupaciones de dinero.

loans.use: Purchase fish and seafood

loans.name: Thi Lan

texts.vi:
Ms Lan is sixty years old. She has retired and actually lives on her monthly pension. Her family has a bamboo business since twenty years ago. Her business is the monopoly in the whole city so it is very advantageous. She has never borrowed from anyone but when she heard about the BinhMinh loan program that is very simple, fast and most importantly, there is no need for collateral, she applied right away. She requests for a loan of US$150.00 to buy more bamboo and will use the revenue from this business to repay it.

Translate from Vietnamese by Hien T. Lam, KIVA volunteer.

Bà Lan 60 tuổi, bà là công nhân về hưu và được hưởng lương hưu hàng tháng. Hiện tại gia đình bà đang kinh doanh tre, nứa. Đây là nghề kinh doanh của gia đình bà, tính đến nay đã được 20 năm. Cả thị trấn hiện nay chỉ có duy nhất nhà bà là kinh doanh mặt hàng này nên khá thuận lợi. Bà chưa từng tham gia vay vốn ở đâu đến khi biết đến chương trình cho vay vốn Binhminh thì bà đã đăng ký vay ngay vì thủ tục rất đơn giản, nhanh gọn và quan trọng nhất là bà không cần phải thế chấp gì cả. Bà vay vốn về để mua thêm tre về bán và sẽ sử dụng thu nhập có được từ công việc này để hoàn trả vốn vay.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo for sale

loans.name: Flor Elicenda

texts.es:
Flor Elicenda is 39 years old and she studied through fifth grade. She has a total of 5 children, and 4 of them are still dependant on her. She lives in the district of Mache, in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad.

She buys pigs and raises them for slaughter. She then kills them and distributes their meat in different areas of the mountains. She also makes smoked ham and rawhides. She also buys sheep, fattens them up, and then sells them. Aside from this, she also cultivates barley, chayote squashes, wheat, potatoes, etc.

She is a member of the “Progresistas” communal bank, from which she has received several loans. The first loan was for S/.300.00, which she used to buy four young pigs.

With the loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy 10 pigs of varying sizes; she will also buy barley to feed them.

Flor’s greatest dream is to buy a motorcycle so that her husband can provide transportation to smaller towns in the Mache area, and thereby generate a better income for the household.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Flor Elicenda tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta el quinto grado de primaria, tiene en total 5 hijos y 4 aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Mache, Provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Se dedica a la compra de cerdos para después de engordarlo, por cierto tiempo, los mata y distribuye la carne por diferentes lugares de la sierra, también prepara jamón (carne de cerdo ahumada) y cueros (piel de cerdo deshidratada), además compra carneros, los engorda y los vende. Aparte de ello se dedica a sembrar cebada, chocho, trigo, papas, etc. Ella es socia del banco comunal “Progresistas” en el que adquirió varios préstamos hasta la fecha, el primero fue de S/. 300.00, el cual lo utilizó para comprar 4 cerdos pequeños. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 10 cerdos entre grandes y pequeños, además comprará cebada para alimentarlos. El mayor sueño de la señora Flor es comprar una moto para que su esposo trabaje brindando servicio de movilidad a los caseríos de Mache y así obtener mayores ganancias en su hogar.

loans.use: To buy livestock (pigs, large and small) and feed for them

loans.name: Namayira Centre C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mariam K.. She is currently in the business of running a hotel and is requesting a loan to expand business. Mariam is 40 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 7 to 22 and her children go to school. Each week, Mariam makes approximately UGX 140000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to meet basic needs. Mariam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to increase stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Mariam is joined in her small group by Nakato N., Jesca F. and Ruth N.. Nakato N. has a business selling used clothes and wants to increase stock. Jesca F. is currently operating a business running a bar and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Ruth N. operates a business of selling matooke and wants to expand business.

loans.use: To expand hotel business

loans.name: Rena

texts.en: Rena J. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 50 years old, married and has three children. Rena rented a small booth in Beylagan city bazaar and sells butter, cheese, sour milk, etc. there. She has been engaged in this business for more than seven years. Now, she needs a loan of $600 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
My name is Ramzana R. from Raiwind, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five: two boys and three girls. I would like all my kids to finish school. I embroider and sew clothes whereas my husband drives a tractor to transport sand and cement on order. The tyres of his tractor have deteriorated and we need to replace them.

I would like to request a loan for my group so that other women can also improve their businesses. Balqees B. sells dry fruits; Salma B. needs to fix her tractor; Kaneez B. wants to buy an electric loom (a machine used to manufacture cloth); Mamena B.‘s family operates an auto workshop; and Hussain B. would like to expand her tea stall.

loans.use: Buy new tyres for the tractor

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
In Managua, capital city of the beautiful country of Nicaragua, Mercedes M. owns a beauty salon where she provides services to her clients doing haircuts, cosmetic services and facials. She is a professional of the beauty business because she has done this for 30 years, this is why her clients are satisfied with her services.

We can't forget that Ceprodel has been key in the business by providing loans to expand the beauty salon. Today she comes to Ceprodel for a loan that allows her to buy cosmetics like hair brushes, gels, powder, lotions and hair color. With this loan her family will benefit, which consists of Mercedes and her small son.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

En Managua capital del bello país de Nicaragua, la señora Merceds M. posee su propio negocio de salón de belleza donde atiende a todos sus clientes brindando los servicios de corte de cabello, confección y limpieza facial. Es una profesional en el ramo de la belleza ya que se ha dedicado al negocio desde hace 30 años y por este motivo es que sus clientes se sienten satisfechos con sus servicios.

Nop podemos obviar que Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en el negocio habiendo proporcionado créditos para el crecimiento del salón. Hoy en día ella acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de los cosméticos como lo son peines, gelatinas, talco, colonias y tintes para el cabello. Con este crédito se beneficia ella y su amada familia que consta de su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for beauty salon.

loans.name: Nermina

texts.en:
Nermina is a 19-year-old married woman. She is from the village Berkovići, near the town Lukavac. She is a housewife and has one 6-month-old child.

With this loan in the amount of 1,200 KM (Bosnian Marks) ($950), Nermina wants to buy cosmetic products and then sell them. Her husband has a full-time job, and sometimes works privately.

Nermina wants to fill her free time with this activity, because her husband is at work most of the day, and to contribute to her household's income.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Lang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lang is a 46 year old woman. She is living with her husband; her 2 children have grown up. Her husband is a bronze-smith worker, whose frequent income is about 1,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She has been a TYM partner since 1998. For 10 years, she has been using the loans efficiently; the family’s financial situation has improved, and one of her 2 children is attending a college. In order to renovate the farm, she plans to borrow 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong. Family’s frequent income is about 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lăng năm nay 46 tuổi. Hiện nay chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành. Chồng chị đi đúc đồng thuê cho thu nhập ổn định 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Đến nay qua 10 năm sử dụng vốn vay đúng mục đích và có hiệu quả kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng ổn định. Chị là người phụ nữ rất chăm chỉ, chịu khó và có rất ngiều kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi vì thế dự án chăn nuôi của gia đình chị luôn mang lại hiệu quả cao nhờ đó chị đã nuôi được 1 con trưởng thành, 1 con đang học đại học. Để có vốn đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại phục vụ cho chăn nuôi vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 9.000.000đ

Thu nhập bình quân 2.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: invest in live-stock farm

loans.name: Pheakny

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheakny C., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sokkea Leng, 27, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2005 and have one daughter.

Mrs. Pheakny has been a silk weaver for over ten years. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a security guard for a company in Phnom Penh for four years. He does not have a vehicle for traveling to work so he wants to buy a motorbike for commuting.

Pheakny is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk materials for weaving and to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hiếu  năm nay 47 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 3 con đã trưởng thành.  Ngoài làm nông nghiệp anh chị có thêm nghề làm hàng mã bán cho nhân các xã miền nam của huyện Ý Yên . Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình anh chị còn nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn để làm ăn.  Năm 1997 chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn làm ăn . Nhờ có  vốn vay gia đình chị đã đầu tư  mua thêm  nguyên liệu sản xuất hàng mã  phục vụ ngày càng tốt hơn nhu cầu của người tiêu dùng. Đến nay qua 10 năm sử dụng vốn hiệu quả kinh tế gia đình chị đã dần ổn định và phát triển với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tơi gia đình chị HIếu mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua thêm giấy về làm hàng mã.
texts.en:
Ms. H. is 47 years of age and has 3 children who are grown. Beside agriculture, she and her husband is able to make fine paper crafts to sell to the southern people of Y Yen province. Before becoming a member of this fund, her family did not have the resources to invest into doing any type of businesses. In 1997, she was able to become part of this funding group. The loan she received helped her financially to initially invest into buying supplies/materials to produce fine paper crafts. After 10 years of using and investing the loan she received, her family’s income has been steady with a present monthly income of 3.000.000. This next loan she is requesting an amount of 10.000.000d to buy more supplies/materials needed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Tiaga

texts.en:
Tiaga Leana, 43, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the banana and taro business. She sells to the villagers and the public 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Tiaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, cromoxzone, a spade, a shovel and bush knives for the plantation. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, cromoxzone, spade, shovel, and bush knives

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia O. has been selling yams at Praso market in Elmina since 1993. Felicia received a junior high education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a trader.

Felicia is responsible for paying utility bills and other expenses. Her loan ($525.00) will be used to buy more yams for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Hor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank loan is being requested by fourteen people who live in Preak Samraong Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Mom H. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Because she now has a lot of customers who are buying large amounts of her products, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell to meet their demand. She is a 48-year-old widow with four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while her youngest, who is only five years old, stays at home.

This request includes some end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijas menores de edad a las que mantiene económicamente. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300, aumentó su capital para comprar artículos de segunda mano para luego venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su esposo es el encargado de comprar los artículos usados y ella se encarga de venderlos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más artículos de segunda mano para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo.

Luz Marina desea seguir trabajando para que sus hijas continúen sus estudios y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a partner with Víctor Echave communal bank in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is twenty-eight years old and married. She has three daughters, all of whom are too young to be economically independent. The first loan she received was for S/. 300. She used it to increase her capital for buying secondhand items, which is what she sells. She has been working with the communal bank for almost four years. She tells us that her husband is responsible for buying used items, and that she is in charge of selling them. With this loan of S/. 2,000, which will be repaid in four installments, she will buy more secondhand items to sell. Luz Marina wishes to continue working so that her daughters can stay in school and pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing secondhand items

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na S. is a farmer in Tnor village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Pak Chhan, is a construction worker. Even though they have different businesses, they still earn inadequate income to support their household. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Na S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 35 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Eva S. from Dar es Salaam. She is single with three children between the ages of 14 and 25. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because his parents cannot take care of him. 

Eva has been running a poultry business since 2006. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. 
First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. 

She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, seven days per week. Eva currently earns about US$500 from her business. She is requesting a loan to build a house for raising kuku. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Eva thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To build a house for her chickens.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. is married and the mother of two kids who are currently in senior high school. She is 31 years old and a trader. She trades in garments, cloths, and lace materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods.

For lack of adequate working capital, Abena buys a few stocks of lace materials and sells through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk stocks of lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. Abena belongs to a village bank called ‘K.’. She hopes to receive GHS 700 to make business progress by re-stocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stocks of lace materials and textiles

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 42 años de edad, hace 26 años vive con el padre de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, 3 de ellos aun viven en su casa. Se dedica a la siembra de papa y alverjas, al inicio no se acostumbraba al trabajo, pero el paso de los años han logrado que ame su trabajo. Ahora está muy pendiente de sus cultivos, del tamaño y la calidad, ya que de eso depende el conseguir buenos precios en el mercado.
