Para sus próximas siembras cambiará de semillas, por unas de mejor calidad. Flor es una socia muy tímida, pero es la primera en asistir a cada una de sus reuniones; este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo no ha caído en morosidad. El dinero que solicita lo usará en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y sacos de semilla de otra calidad.
texts.en:
Flor is 42 years of age, and for the last 26 years has lived with the father of their 6 children, 3 of whom still live at home. She works farming potatoes and peas. At the beginning she was not accustomed to the work, but as the years go by she has come to love her job. Now she is very devoted to her crops, to the size and quality, as these things are important to get a good price at the market. For her next crops she will change to seeds of better quality. Flor is a very shy group member, but she is the first to attend every one of the meetings. This is her eighth loan with MFP and in all this time she has never defaulted. The money she requests will be used to buy chemical fertilizers and bags of seeds of a different quality.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Abdunaim

texts.ru: Абдунаим мужчина 57 лет, живёт и продаёт в городе Гафурове.Он женат, имеет пятерых детей.На рынке торгует продуктами питания, по бизнесу ему помогает его жена.Завозит товар ему его сыновья.Они для облегчения работы родителей помогают им. Кроме этого Абдунаби занимается откормом и продажей скота. Абдунаим в кредит хочет увеличить свой скот.За уходом скота помогают Абдунаби его невестки, которые проживают с ним в одном доме.  При затруднениях погашения, ему помогут его сыновья , которые все работают на разных предприятиях.
texts.en:
Abdunaim is 57 years old, married has five children. He lives and works in the city of Gafurov. He sells food products at a local market, and his wife helps him with the business. His sons deliver the products to him. They help their parents and ease their work. Besides this business, Abdunaim is also involved in raising and selling livestock. Abdunaim wants to obtain this loan to increase his livestock headcount. Abdunaim’s daughters-in-law, who live in the same house, help him to look after the livestock. If he experiences any difficulty repaying this loan, his sons, all of whom hold different jobs, would help with the repayment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing livestock headcount

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Doña Rebeca es originaria de Retahuleu con residencia en el paraje Coxomo del Cantón Patzarajman del Municipio de Totonicapan ella se deica a  satreria en diferentes tipos de costuras, delantales, pantalones, cortes tipicos ella aprenio el oficio en la ciudad de Guatemala  en las maquilas cunado contrajo matrimonio su esposo es sastre hoy en dia necesita un credito para la compra de una maquina de coseher, y sus materiales para una su operaria ya que se acerca la fiesta de la comunidad en dodnde tiene un pedido para las niñas de un uniforme.
texts.en:
Ms. Rebeca is originally from Retahuleu, but she resides in Coxomo, in the Patzarajman canton of the Totonicapan municipality. She is involved in dressmaking, sewing different types of aprons, pants, and traditional clothing. She learned this skill in the factories of Guatemala City when she got married. Her husband is a tailor. She now needs a loan in order to purchase a sewing machine and materials because the community festival is approaching, and she has to fill an order for girls’ uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is 36 years old and is married to Wilfredo T., who is a farmer. They live in the village of Minallo Naguillian, in Isabela. They are blessed with three children who are all currently studying. Her eldest child, Tiffany Joy, is 14 years old. Her second child, John Mark, is 12 years old. The youngest child, Wilfredo, is 9 years old. She feels happy because her family members have good relationships with one another and her children are disciplined. Ofelia diligently maintains her general store to help her husband provide for the children’s educational needs. She is requesting her second loan, amounting to PHP 20,000, to fund additional working capital to further improve her business. She hopes that someday she will attain all her goals in life through the support of lenders and her hard work. She will use the majority of the loan in purchasing different groceries to retail in her store. Ofelia says that Kiva lenders are of great help in the improvement of her business and maintenance of basic necessities at home.

loans.use: Working Capital for General Store

loans.name: Urkupiña Group

texts.es: El grupo “Urkupiña” esta representado por la señora Carmela y conformado por 15 miembros que van cursando juntos su quinto ciclo demostrando siempre puntualidad, respeto y ganas D. salir adelante. En general las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades entre ellas la venta D. productos como comida, cerveza, material escolar, abarrotes y al servicio D. peluquería, carpintería y transporte público D. pasajeros. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo y para la compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus trabajos haciéndose mas competitivos en el mercado y generando mayores ingresos para dar a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida.
texts.en:
The group “Urkupiña” is represented by Carmela, and composed of 15 members who are together in their fifth cycle, demonstrating punctuality, respect, and the desire to move ahead. In general, the members are engaged in different activities, among them the selling of food, beer, school materials, and groceries, and in the services of a hair salon, carpentry, and public transport. The fate of the financing is to increase their work capital to buy materials, raw ingredients, and tools to improve their jobs, making them more competitive in the market, and to generate income to give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида Мусоева  1969 года рождения ,замужем имеет 3 детей. Закончив университет не нашла достойную работу, сидела долгое время дома. После замужества  также сидела дома, но дети росли и их потребности тоже.  Решила заняться продажей яиц. С  имевшихся кур наседок начала продавала яйца. Позже получив кредит решила продавать уже на рынке покупая большую партию яиц с поставщиков. Занимается купля продажей яиц  11 лет.
texts.en:
Farida M. was born in 1969. She is married and has three children. After graduating the university, she couldn't find a decent job, and for a long time, stayed at home. Once she was married, she also stayed home, but as her children grew, their needs grew as well. So she decided to sell eggs. Since she had chickens, she began selling eggs. She later received a loan and decided to sell at the market, buying a large batch of eggs from suppliers. She has been buying and selling eggs now for 11 years.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of eggs

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina tiene 43 años, es madre soltera de 2 niños: Margarita de 14 y Severo de 12 años, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar la vida que actualmente lleva. Su negocio es la compra y venta de bicicletas, los día sábados se levanta muy temprano y se dirige a la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca) a comprar bicicletas de segunda mano, las cuales lleva a su taller y con mucha destreza arregla, para después pintarlas y dejarlas como nuevas. Saturnina tiene un puesto en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), donde vende las bicicletas a precios muy accesibles y su puesto es muy concurrido porque sus arreglos son tan buenos que las bicicletas quedan como nuevas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y mejor si al final del día se queda sin mercadería, lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es encontrar los repuestos necesarios. Para un futuro cercano espera ver crecer a su negocio y que le genere mejores ingresos económicos, con los cuales pueda costear los estudios superiores de sus hijos. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a sus compañeras de banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone al grupo. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más bicicletas, pintura y repuestos, con los cuales espera incrementar la cantidad de bicicletas que arregla y luego vende.
texts.en:
Saturnina is 43 years old, and is the single mother of two children: Margarita who is 14 and Severo who is 12. She lives in her own home and her greatest wish is to improve her daily life. She buys and sells bicycles. On Saturdays she gets up very early and goes to the Explanada Laguna Temporal (the site of the fairs in the city of Juliaca) to buy second-hand bicycles, which she brings to her workshop where she skillfully repairs and paints them, making them as good as new.

Saturnina has a stall in the San Jose market (an important market in Juliaca), where she sells her bicycles at reasonable prices. Her stall is busy because her repairs are so good that the bikes are like new. What she like most about her job is selling, and the best is when she has no merchandise left at the end of the day.

She has been in this business for 5 years, and the most difficult aspect is finding the necessary parts. In the near future, she hopes to see her business grow and generate more income, which she can use to pay for higher education for her children.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she is ready to make all her repayments on time, because she does not wish to cause any problems for her fellow community bank members. She is a respected bank member because of the order that she gives to the group. With the 800 PEN she requests she will buy more bicycles, paint, and parts, which she will use to increase the number of bicycles that she repairs and sells.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise
